Itinerary.Name: Arrival in Delhi
Description: Your journey begins with a warm welcome at Indira Gandhi International Airport, where you’ll be greeted and transferred to your hotel. Upon arrival, complete the check-in process and take some time to unwind. Relax and rejuvenate after your travels, preparing for the exciting days ahead. Enjoy the rest of the day at leisure, exploring nearby attractions or simply resting. Experience the charm of Delhi as you settle in for the night. Get ready to dive into the city's rich history and vibrant culture tomorrow. Overnight stay in Delhi. A delightful journey awaits, filled with unforgettable sights and experiences. Let the adventure begin!

Itinerary.Name: Delhi Sightseeing
Description: Kick off with a morning tour of Old Delhi, passing the majestic Red Fort and visiting Jama Masjid, India’s largest mosque. Glide through Chandni Chowk’s bustling lanes on a rickshaw, soaking in the vibrant market atmosphere, then pay homage at Raj Ghat, Mahatma Gandhi’s memorial. In the afternoon, explore New Delhi’s landmarks: the towering Qutub Minar, the serene Humayun’s Tomb, and a drive past India Gate and Rashtrapati Bhavan. Discover the blend of Mughal grandeur and colonial elegance that defines the city. As the day winds down, relish local cuisine or take a peaceful evening stroll. Overnight in Delhi.

Itinerary.Name: Delhi to Mandawa (Shekhawati)
Description: After breakfast, journey to Mandawa, a gem in Rajasthan’s Shekhawati region. Check into your hotel and later explore its 18th-century havelis adorned with frescoes, each room a unique masterpiece.This quaint town, with its imposing castle, transports you to a bygone era. Overnight stay at hotel in Mandawa.

Note: The small little beautiful town of Mandawa is in the heart of the Shekhawati region. Known for its wonderful castle and magnificent havelis, Mandawa gives the impression of living in the bygone era. Mandawa can be transcribed as a surprise at every turn. No single room either, in the havelis, is similar to that of the other. Most of the buildings are dated from the 18th century to early 20th century.

Itinerary.Name: Mandawa to Bikaner
Description: Depart early for Bikaner, stopping en route at Fatehpur to admire its frescoes. Arrive in Bikaner, a desert city famed for its camel culture and ornate wells. Explore its medieval forts and vibrant markets, soaking in its timeless charm. Overnight stay at hotel in Bikaner.

Bikaner: Lying in the north of the Desert State, the city is dotted with many sand dunes. Bikaner retains the medieval splendor that pervades the city’s lifestyle. More popularly called the camel country, the city is renowned for the best rIding camels in the world. The ship of the desert is an inseparable part of life here. Be it pulling heavy carts, transporting grains or working on wells, camels are the prime helpers. The wells of Bikaner – an important source of water are other attractions of the city. These are built on high plinths with slender minarets towers on each of the Four Corners and can be noticed even from a distance.

Itinerary.Name: Bikaner to Jaisalmer
Description: Drive to Jaisalmer, the “Golden City,” founded in 1156 AD atop Trikuta Hill. Check into your hotel and explore its golden sandstone architecture. Discover legends of the Bhatti Rajputs as you wander through this desert marvel. Overnight stay at hotel in Jaisalmer.

Jaisalmer: Rising from the heart of the Thar Desert like a golden mirage is the city of Jaisalmer. A commanding fort etched in yellow sandstone stands, with its awesome splendor, dominating the amber-hued city. The city has an interesting legend associated with it, according to which, Lord Krishna-the head of the Yadav Clan, foretold Arjuna that a remote descendent of the Yadav Clan would build his kingdom atop the Trikuta Hill. His prophecy was fulfilled in 1156 AD when Rawal Jaisal, a descendent of the Yadav Clan and a Bhatti Rajput, abandoned his fort at Lodurva and founded a new capital -Jaisalmer, perched on the Trikuta Hill.

Itinerary.Name: Jaisalmer Sightseeing
Description: Following breakfast, embark on a full-day exploration of Jaisalmer, the 'Golden City,' nestled in the heart of the Great Indian Desert. Bathed in golden hues, the city’s temples, forts, and palaces—crafted entirely from yellow sandstone—unfold like an open-air museum of intricate carvings, ornate façades, and latticed balconies. Begin with the UNESCO-listed Jaisalmer Fort, the world’s oldest living fort and the tour’s crown jewel.

Wander through its labyrinthine lanes, marveling at the opulent Patwon-Ki-Haveli with its delicate filigree work, the whimsically curved Salim-Singh-Ki-Haveli, and the tranquil Gandhi Sagar Tank. As the afternoon sun softens, journey to the Sam Sand Dunes to experience a quintessential Rajasthani desert village. Climb the rolling dunes for a front-row seat to nature’s grand finale: a fiery sunset that ignites the sky in shades of amber and crimson. Return to your hotel under a canopy of stars, reflecting on the day’s wonders, and settle in for an overnight stay in Jaisalmer.

Itinerary.Name: Jaisalmer to Jodhpur/Luni
Description: After breakfast at the hotel, depart for Jodhpur, an imperial city steeped in history and perched on the edge of the Thar Desert. Known as the former capital of Marwar and the stronghold of the Rathor dynasty, Jodhpur invites exploration of its regal heritage.

Begin your sightseeing at Mehrangarh Fort, a formidable structure towering over the city on a rocky hilltop. Wander through its palaces adorned with intricate miniature paintings and visit the poignant cradle room, a testament to royal lineage. Next, explore the serene Jaswant Thada Memorial, a cluster of exquisite marble cenotaphs shimmering in the sunlight. Later, continue your journey to Luni, where you’ll check into Fort Chanwa, a striking red sandstone fortress that blends history with luxury. Conclude the day with an overnight stay in Luni, immersed in the grandeur of Rajasthan’s architectural legacy.

Itinerary.Name: Jodhpur to Udaipur via Ranakpur
Description: Depart for Udaipur, pausing en route to explore the awe-inspiring Ranakpur Temples, a 500-year-old Jain marvel renowned for its immaculate preservation. Wander through these sprawling, architecturally intricate temples, where 1,444 exquisitely carved pillars—each distinct in design—stand as testaments to artistic mastery. The complex features 29 grand halls, 80 domes, and elegant pavilions adorned with celestial nymphs frozen in dance, their delicate engravings highlighting the site’s brilliance. After marveling at this symphony of stone, continue your journey to Udaipur, the enchanting 'City of Lakes,' where you’ll check into your hotel for an overnight stay.

Itinerary.Name: Udaipur Sightseeing
Description: After breakfast, embark on a sightseeing tour of Rajasthan’s enchanting lake cities. Begin with a visit to the majestic City Palace, where intricately carved balconies, grand arches, and lavishly decorated pillars reflect the opulence of Rajput and Mughal architecture. Explore its historic chambers, including the Zanana Mahal (women’s quarters), the regal Durbar Hall, and the ornate Shambhu Niwas. As the day transitions to evening, indulge in a serene boat ride on Lake Pichola, where the golden hues of the sunset cast a magical glow over the water. Admire the panoramic vistas of rolling hills, shimmering palaces, ancient temples, and bustling bathing ghats that frame the lake’s shores. Return to your hotel afterward for a restful overnight stay, reflecting on the day’s blend of history and natural beauty.

Itinerary.Name: Udaipur to Pushkar
Description: After breakfast, depart for Pushkar, a town steeped in spiritual lore and revered as the 'king of all tiraths (pilgrimage sites).' The heart of Pushkar is its sacred semicircular lake, flanked by 52 ghats (steps leading to the water), with a maximum depth of 10 meters. Pilgrims flock here to take a holy dip, especially during Karthik Purnima—a full moon in the Hindu month of Kartik—believed to cleanse sins and grant salvation. Bathing during the brighter fortnight of Kartik and glimpsing the idol of Varah (Vishnu’s boar incarnation) is said to break the cycle of rebirth, with the Purnima dip equating to the blessings of a hundred penances. Mythologically, Pushkar is said to host countless yojana (pilgrimage spots), surpassing even the count known to Brihaspati, the celestial teacher of gods. By evening, return to your hotel for a peaceful overnight stay, reflecting on the town’s divine aura.

Itinerary.Name: Pushkar to Jaipur
Description: Drive to Jaipur, the vibrant capital of Rajasthan, famously known as the Pink City for its stunning pink-hued architecture. This historic city is renowned for its magnificent forts, palaces, and serene lakes, offering a glimpse into its royal past. Steeped in culture, history, and rich traditions, Jaipur captivates visitors with its bustling markets, grand heritage sites, and warm hospitality. Nestled against the Aravalli Hills, the city enjoys natural protection from the vast Thar Desert, adding to its unique landscape. After a day of exploration, unwind with an overnight stay at a hotel, preparing for more adventures ahead.

Itinerary.Name: Jaipur Sightseeing
Description: Visit the magnificent Amber Fort, constructed during the reign of Raja Man Singh, and experience a memorable elephant ride to the hilltop. Explore the grandeur of City Palace, showcasing a perfect blend of Rajasthani and Mughal architecture. Walk through Chandra Palace, the seven-storied centerpiece offering breathtaking views of the city. Step into Jantar Mantar, a remarkable solar observatory equipped with precise astronomical instruments. Marvel at the iconic Hawa Mahal, the five-story pink sandstone masterpiece built in 1799. Admire its 593 intricately carved stone Jharokas, designed to allow royal women to observe the lively streets while remaining unseen.

Itinerary.Name: Jaipur to Agra via Fatehpur Sikri
Description: Visit the magnificent Amber Fort, constructed during the reign of Raja Man Singh, and experience a memorable elephant ride to the hilltop. Explore the grandeur of City Palace, showcasing a perfect blend of Rajasthani and Mughal architecture. Walk through Chandra Palace, the seven-storied centerpiece offering breathtaking views of the city. Step into Jantar Mantar, a remarkable solar observatory equipped with precise astronomical instruments. Marvel at the iconic Hawa Mahal, the five-story pink sandstone masterpiece built in 1799. Admire its 593 intricately carved stone Jharokas, designed to allow royal women to observe the lively streets while remaining unseen.

Itinerary.Name: Agra / Delhi Departure
Description: Start the day with a breathtaking sunrise visit to the Taj Mahal, the iconic Monument of Love built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan as a tribute to his wife, Mumtaz Mahal. Shah Jahan was later laid to rest beside her in this magnificent tomb, which took 22 years and 20,000 workers to complete. The stunning white marble was sourced from Makrana, Rajasthan, and adorned with intricate inlay work of precious and semi-precious stones, reflecting the grandeur of Mughal architecture. After this mesmerizing experience, return to the hotel for breakfast.
Explore the grandeur of Agra Fort, a massive Mughal fortress known for its impressive architecture and rich history.

Continue the journey with a visit to Itmad-Ud-Daulah’s Tomb, designed in the elegant Charbagh style. Built under the guidance of Itmad-Ud-Daulah himself, this tomb showcases delicate inlay work, including intricate patterns like a wine flask with snake-shaped handles. It also serves as the final resting place for other family members.

Next, head to Mughal Emperor Akbar’s Tomb in Sikandra, located just 3 km from Agra. Akbar initiated its construction, and his son Jehangir completed it, incorporating Indo-Saracenic architectural elements reminiscent of the Taj Mahal.

Name: Forts and Palaces of India
Title: Explore Fort and Palaces of India Tour - Eaze Tours
Card_Heading: Explore Fort and Palaces of India Tour - Eaze Tours
Description: Explore the majestic Fort and Palaces of India with Eaze Tours. Experience royal heritage, stunning architecture, and timeless stories on your journey.
Summary: Embark on a journey through India’s most iconic forts and palaces, where history, grandeur, and architectural brilliance come to life. From the majestic Amer Fort to the opulent Mysore Palace, each destination offers a glimpse into the country’s regal past. To explore more of Rajasthan’s royal heritage, check out our Rajasthan Tour Packages for a deeper dive into its vibrant culture. For a truly luxurious experience, consider the Palace on Wheels Tour Package—a royal train journey that takes you through Rajasthan’s most magnificent landmarks in unparalleled comfort. Let Eaze Tours craft an unforgettable adventure through India’s royal splendor!
Overview: Embark on a captivating 14-day journey through India's most iconic forts and palaces, immersing yourself in the rich history, architectural grandeur, and vibrant cultures of Rajasthan and beyond. This meticulously crafted itinerary offers a blend of guided tours, cultural experiences, and leisure time, ensuring a comprehensive exploration of India's royal heritage.

TourCompanion.Name: Royal Heritage Guide
TourCompanion.Description: Expert cultural guides, private transport, multilingual support

Itinerary.Name: Arrival NJP Railway Station / (IXB) Bagdogra Airport – Gangtok
Description: Your journey begins with your arrival at NJP Railway Station or Bagdogra Airport (IXB), nestled at an elevation of 500 ft (150 m). Here, an office executive will warmly greet you and assist with your transfer to Gangtok, a scenic 130 km drive ascending to 5,500 ft (1,677 m). The approximately four-hour journey winds through lush landscapes, offering glimpses of the Eastern Himalayas. Upon reaching Gangtok, check into your hotel and unwind, soaking in the serene atmosphere of Sikkim’s capital. Overnight stay at the hotel in Gangtok.

Itinerary.Name: Gangtok Sightseeing
Description: After breakfast, embark on a full-day excursion to the breathtaking Tshangu Lake, a glacial marvel located 43 km from Gangtok. The three-hour drive takes you to an altitude of 12,400 ft (3,780 m), where the lake’s crystal-clear waters, averaging 50 ft in depth, shimmer against a backdrop of snow-capped peaks. Spend time admiring the pristine beauty and crisp mountain air before returning to Gangtok. The evening is free to relax or explore local markets. Overnight stay at your hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Gangtok to Kalimpong
Description: Begin the day with half-day sightseeing in Gangtok. Choose between the revered Rumtek Monastery, a hub of Tibetan Buddhism, or the cascading Jhakri Water Falls. Later, visit cultural landmarks like Droul Chorthen, the Research Institute of Tibetology, the Directorate of Handicraft & Handloom, and the tranquil Enchey Monastery. Post-lunch, journey to Kalimpong (3,937 ft/1,200 m), an 85 km drive through terraced hillsides and pine forests. Check into your hotel upon arrival and enjoy the town’s laid-back charm. Overnight in Kalimpong.

Itinerary.Name: Kalimpong to Darjeeling
Description: After breakfast, explore Kalimpong’s highlights: Dello Hills for panoramic views, the historic Dr. Graham’s Home, vibrant flower nurseries, and the spiritual Jang-Dong-Palriffo Brang. Stroll through the bustling local markets, where you can shop for traditional handicrafts and Tibetan souvenirs. Conclude with Durbin Dara Hills, offering breathtaking vistas of the Teesta River and Himalayan ranges, before departing for Darjeeling. The 70 km drive ascends to 7,380 ft (2,250 m), offering misty valleys and tea gardens en route. Stop at scenic viewpoints for stunning photo opportunities. Check into your Darjeeling hotel and savor the colonial-era ambiance. Overnight stay in Darjeeling.

Itinerary.Name: Explore Darjeeling
Description: Rise early (around 4 AM) for a memorable drive to Tiger Hills (8,364 ft/2,550 m) to witness the sunrise casting golden hues over Mt. Kanchendzonga (weather permitting). Return via Ghoom Monastery, one of Darjeeling’s oldest, and the Batasia Loop, a feat of railway engineering. Post breakfast, visit the Japanese Temple, Peace Pagoda, Padmaja Naidu Himalayan Zoological Park (home to red pandas), and the Himalayan Mountaineering Institute. Explore the Tibetan Refugee Center (closed Sundays) or opt for the Rock Garden and Ganga Maya Lake. Overnight in Darjeeling.

Itinerary.Name: Darjeeling – NJP Railway Station / (IXB) Bagdogra Airport
Description: After breakfast, bid farewell to the hills as you transfer to NJP Railway Station or Bagdogra Airport (100 km, ~3 hours). Enjoy the scenic drive through winding roads, lush tea gardens, and charming mountain villages one last time. Reflect on the memories of misty peaks, tranquil lakes, and vibrant cultures as you journey onward. Take with you the warmth of the locals, the flavors of authentic cuisine, and the serenity of nature’s embrace. Whether it’s the thrill of adventure or moments of quiet bliss, cherish the unforgettable experiences. Safe travels, and we hope to welcome you back soon!

TourCompanion.Name: North East Travel Expert
TourCompanion.Description: Professional guide, local support, and transportation team

Itinerary.Name: Arrival NJP Railway Station / (IXB) Bagdogra Airport – Darjeeling
Description: Upon arrival at NJP Railway Station or Bagdogra Airport, our representative will greet you and facilitate your transfer to Darjeeling. The 72 km drive (1.5 hours) takes you through lush landscapes, winding roads, and scenic tea gardens to the hill station (7,380 ft). En route, enjoy picturesque views of rolling hills and charming villages. Upon reaching Darjeeling, check into your hotel and take some time to relax. Stroll through the vibrant local markets or savor a cup of authentic Darjeeling tea. Enjoy the cool mountain breeze and prepare for an exciting journey ahead. Overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Darjeeling Sightseeing
Description: Begin at 4:00 AM with a drive to Tiger Hill to marvel at the sunrise over Kanchenjunga (weather-dependent). Capture breathtaking views before returning via Ghoom Monastery and Batasia Loop. Enjoy a hearty breakfast before visiting the Japanese Temple and Peace Pagoda, offering serene surroundings. Explore Padmaja Naidu Zoo (closed Thursday) and the Himalayan Mountaineering Institute to learn about legendary climbers. Stop by Tenzing Rock for an adventurous photo opportunity and visit the Tibetan Refugee Center (closed Sunday) for local handicrafts. Later, stroll through Mall Road for shopping, opt for a tea estate tour, or visit Rock Garden & Ganga Maya Lake. Overnight stay in Darjeeling.

Itinerary.Name: Explore more in Darjeeling
Description: After breakfast, journey 50 km (2 hours) to Mirik. Stop at Pashupati Nagar Market near the Indo-Nepal border for shopping. Explore the vibrant stalls offering local handicrafts, clothing, and souvenirs. Spend the afternoon at serene Mirik Lake, surrounded by lush tea gardens and pine forests. Enjoy optional boating or horse riding while taking in the picturesque views. Take a leisurely walk along the lakeside, capturing stunning photos of the scenic landscape. Visit the nearby Bokar Monastery for a moment of peace and reflection. Return to Darjeeling by evening for your stay, unwinding after a day filled with beautiful experiences.

Itinerary.Name: Darjeeling – NJP Railway Station / (IXB) Bagdogra Airport
Description: After breakfast, take in the final views of Darjeeling before departing for NJP/IXB (100 km, 3 hours). Enjoy a comfortable journey as you proceed with your onward travel arrangements, bringing your unforgettable Darjeeling adventure to a close. Safe travels!

From the serene landscapes of Darjeeling to the vibrant local culture, this journey promises memories that will last a lifetime. Whether you're a nature enthusiast, a history buff, or someone seeking tranquility, Darjeeling caters to all. TourCompanion.Name: EazeTours Local Guide
TourCompanion.Description: Experienced guide for sightseeing, local insights, and cultural tips

Itinerary.Name: Arrival in Manali
Description: Upon arriving in Manali, check into your accommodation and spend the day acclimatizing to the altitude. Meet your guide to review the itinerary and prepare your gear for the upcoming adventure. In the afternoon, explore Manali on a biking excursion, visiting highlights such as the historic Naggar Castle, the serene Jagatsukh Temple, and the rejuvenating Vashist Hot Spring. Take in breathtaking mountain views as you ride through scenic trails. Stroll through the vibrant Mall Road, where you can shop for local handicrafts and savor delicious Himachali cuisine. Return to your hotel for an overnight stay.

Itinerary.Name: Manali to Rohtang Pass (61 km)
Description: After breakfast, embark on a full-day biking tour around Manali, covering scenic spots like Manikaran, Hadimba Temple, and the lush Kullu Valley. Along the way, enjoy breathtaking views of snow-capped peaks, meandering rivers, and charming villages. Stop for a refreshing break at a local café or explore vibrant markets showcasing Himachali crafts. The 61 km ride takes approximately 2 hours, offering a mix of cultural and natural wonders. Capture stunning photos at picturesque viewpoints and immerse yourself in the serene beauty of the Himalayas. Overnight stay at a hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Rohtang Pass to Jispa (86 km)
Description: Post-breakfast, begin your journey toward Leh via Rohtang Pass (3,990m). Traverse through Gulaba, Marchi, Rani Nala, Koksar, and Tandi—where the Chandra and Bhaga rivers merge—before arriving in Jispa. Along the way, take in breathtaking views of snow-capped peaks, winding roads, and lush valleys. Capture stunning photographs and experience the thrill of high-altitude travel. The 86 km ride, lasting 2.5 hours, offers a mix of adventure and serenity, making it a memorable part of your journey. Upon reaching Jispa, unwind with an overnight stay at a hotel or fixed tent, enjoying a warm meal with breakfast and dinner included.

Itinerary.Name: Jispa – Darcha- Suraj Tal- Baralachal Pass (4890m) – Sarchu (110 Km)
Description: Fuel up with breakfast before biking through dramatic high-altitude landscapes. Ride past rugged mountain terrain and picturesque valleys, capturing stunning panoramic views. Pass Darcha, a hub for trekkers heading to Zanskar Valley, and ascend the breathtaking Baralachal Pass (4,890m), where snow-capped peaks and winding roads create an unforgettable journey. Feel the thrill of the open road as you navigate challenging yet rewarding stretches of the route. Arrive in Sarchu for an overnight stay in tents, where you can unwind under a star-studded sky. Enjoy a warm meal with breakfast and dinner provided, recharging for the adventure ahead.

Itinerary.Name: Sarchu – Pang – Dibiring – Tsokar (180 Km)
Description: After breakfast, ride toward Tso Kar Lake, pausing for photo opportunities amid stark, surreal vistas. Along the way, witness breathtaking high-altitude landscapes and nomadic settlements. Upon arrival, settle into fixed tents and explore the area, keeping an eye out for wildlife (camera in hand!). Stroll along the lake’s shores, where the changing hues of the water create a mesmerizing view. Capture the beauty of this remote oasis and soak in the tranquility of the surroundings. As the evening unfolds, share travel stories by the campfire and enjoy dinner under the stars, embracing the serenity of this untouched wilderness.

Itinerary.Name: Tsokar – Sumdah – Tsomoriri (145 Km)
Description: Depart Tsokar after breakfast, biking through Sumdah Village and past sulfur springs and Tibetan refugee settlements. Cross Namshang La Pass (4,920m) and Thachung Karo Lake before reaching Karzok (Tsomoriri). Along the way, enjoy breathtaking views of rugged mountain landscapes and remote high-altitude plains. Stop for a short break to soak in the serene surroundings before continuing the journey. Upon arrival, explore the pristine lake on foot (bikes prohibited), witnessing its crystal-clear waters reflecting the towering peaks. Interact with local nomadic communities and experience their unique culture. Overnight in tents with meals, enjoying the tranquility of this stunning destination.

Itinerary.Name: Tsomoriri – Mahay BrIdge- Chumathang – Leh (145 Km)
Description: Post-breakfast, ride along the Indus River, stopping at Chumathang’s natural hot springs and Hemis Monastery. Capture stunning landscapes along the way and immerse yourself in the region’s rich culture. Arrive in Leh by evening and check into a hotel. Stroll through the local markets or relax at a café, soaking in the serene atmosphere. Enjoy free time to unwind, with breakfast and dinner included.

Itinerary.Name: Nubra Valley Over Khardung La Pass (120 Km)
Description: After breakfast, embark on an exhilarating ride to Nubra Valley via the iconic Khardung La Pass (5,602m), the highest motorable road in the world. Pause at the summit to take in breathtaking views of snow-capped peaks and glaciers. While there, enjoy a cup of hot tea at the highest cafeteria in the world, situated along the historic Silk Road that once connected Tibet, China, and Turkmenistan. As the road descends, witness the stunning transformation of the landscape as it opens up to the lush green valley of Ladakh, nourished by the Shyok and Nubra rivers. This region, once a vital stop for ancient caravans traveling to Central Asia, is now home to flourishing apple, apricot, and mulberry orchards, particularly in Hunder. Lamaism remains an integral part of life in the valley, reflected in its rich cultural heritage. Continue the journey through Nubra Valley to reach Diskit, a scenic drive of approximately four hours. Upon arrival, check in to your guesthouse and relax. Later in the afternoon, opt for a unique experience with a Bactrian camel ride on the sand dunes between Hunder and Diskit Village. Conclude the day with a peaceful evening in Diskit, where you will stay overnight.

Itinerary.Name: Diskit – Leh
Description: After breakfast, visit Diskit Monastery, founded by Changzem Tserab Zangpo in the 14th century. This historic monastery holds deep cultural significance, with its ancient murals and artifacts reflecting the rich heritage of the Nubra Valley. The site is also home to the tallest statue of Maitreya Buddha in Ladakh, offering breathtaking views of the surrounding landscape. Later, head to Sumoor village, known for its peaceful atmosphere and scenic beauty, before driving back to Leh. Upon arrival, check in at the hotel and relax. In the late afternoon, visit Shanti Stupa for a mesmerizing sunset tour. Perched atop a hill in the Changspa locality, the stupa was built in 1983 on a rock and inaugurated by HH Dalai Lama. From this vantage point, enjoy a stunning sunset over Leh Valley. Return to Leh for some leisure time, perfect for shopping or exploring the local markets. End the day with a delightful dinner.

Images.alt: statue of Maitreya Buddha in Ladakh

Itinerary.Name: Leh – Lamayuru (240 Km) – Leh
Description: After breakfast, embark on a full-day ride to lower Ladakh, known as Sham Valley, a region filled with stunning landscapes and cultural treasures. Drive straight to Lamayuru, home to one of the oldest monasteries in Ladakh, and admire the breathtaking moon land formations, a surreal landscape resembling the lunar surface. On the way back to Leh, visit Rizong Gompa, a serene monastery known for its meditation retreats, and explore Alchi Choskor, an ancient monastic complex with exquisite murals. Continue to Likir, famous for its towering Buddha statue, and Basgo Palace, a historical fort with intricate murals. Stop at Nimmo to witness the mesmerizing confluence of the Indus and Zanskar rivers, where the contrasting colors of the waters create a spectacular sight. If time permits, make a brief photo stop at Gurudwara Pathar Saheb, a revered Sikh shrine known for its legendary stone. The rest of the day is free to explore the vibrant Leh market, where you can shop for souvenirs, handicrafts, and local delicacies.

Itinerary.Name: Arrival in Leh
Description: Enjoy a free day to relax, shop for souvenirs, or explore Leh independently. Stroll through the bustling markets, visit local cafés, or take in the stunning mountain views. You can also explore nearby attractions, interact with locals, or capture the beauty of Leh through your lens. In the evening, celebrate your journey’s success with your team over a final dinner, sharing memories and experiences from your adventure. Overnight at hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Departure from Leh
Description: Bid farewell to the majestic Himalayas as you cherish the unforgettable memories of your journey. Wake up to the crisp mountain air one last time before an early morning transfer to the airport for your flight to Delhi or your onward destination. Take in the breathtaking landscapes as you depart, reflecting on the serene monasteries, rugged terrains, and warm hospitality that made your trip truly special. Carry with you the essence of Ladakh’s rich culture, stunning vistas, and spiritual charm, knowing that this extraordinary adventure will remain in your heart forever. Until next time, let the mountains call you back!

Name: Himalayan Adventure Tour â€“ Mountain Bike Manali to Leh
Title: Mountain Bike Tour Manali Leh Travel Package - Eaze Tours
Description: Embark on an epic Manali–Keylong–Jispa-Darcha-Suraj Tal-Baralachal Pass adventure to Leh, Nubra Valley, and more with Eaze Tours packages. Book Now!
Summary: Ready to experience the adventure of a lifetime? Our Mountain Bike Tour from Manali to Leh offers the perfect blend of stunning landscapes, exhilarating biking trails, and unforgettable memories. Don’t miss out on this epic journey—book your tour today and get ready for an adventure that will challenge your limits and leave you in awe of the beauty of the Himalayas. Visit our Markha Valley Trek Package page to learn more and secure your spot. Let Eaze Tours be your guide to an unforgettable experience!
Overview: Experience the thrill of cycling through the majestic Himalayas with our Manali to Leh Mountain bike tour package. This journey takes you across rugged terrains, lush valleys, and some of the world’s highest motorable passes. Designed for adventure enthusiasts, this tour offers breathtaking views, cultural encounters, and the satisfaction of conquering challenging routes.
AdditionalInformation:
• Difficulty Level: Moderate to High – Suitable for experienced cyclists.
  • Best Time to Visit: June to September.
  • What to Bring: Comfortable biking gear, warm clothing, sunscreen, and personal essentials.
  • Travel insurance is highly recommended for this tour.
  • Surprise Gifts at the end of the tour.
  • Assistance on arrival – departure at airport.
  • Rides are provided as per the itinerary.
  • Package details are subject to client customization.
WhatsIncluded:
• Accommodation in camps or guesthouses.
  • Check-in and checkout set at 12:00 PM.
  • Daily breakfast and dinner provided.
  • Professional biking guides and support staff.
  • English-speaking local guides in all cities as per itinerary.
  • An Eaze Tour Manager accompanies the group.
  • 2 water bottles per guest per day during sightseeing tours.
  • Garland welcome upon arrival.

  • Airfare, visa fees, and any medical/hospitalization or evacuation expenses.
  • Tips for drivers, guides, or restaurant staff.
  • Any expenses not listed above.

TourCompanion.Name: Himalayan Bike Support Team
TourCompanion.Description: Expert cycling guide, mechanic, medical vehicle, oxygen, spares

Itinerary.Name: Arrival Leh
Description: Upon arrival at Leh airport, you will be warmly welcomed by our representative and transferred to your hotel. As you check in, you will be served refreshing tea, coffee, and snacks to help you settle in comfortably. After completing the check-in formalities, you can relax and acclimatize to the high-altitude surroundings. Following a delicious lunch, embark on a leisurely walking tour through the local market, where you can explore traditional crafts and immerse yourself in the vibrant atmosphere. Alternatively, visit the serene Shanti Stupa and the historic Tsomo Castle, both offering breathtaking views of the region. Conclude your day with a comfortable overnight stay at the hotel, where you will be served a delightful breakfast and dinner.

Itinerary.Name: Leh Sightseeing
Description: After breakfast, set out for a full-day sightseeing tour around Leh. Visit the ancient Lamayuru Monastery, followed by the serene Rizong Monastery and the historic Alchi Monastery, known for its exquisite murals. Stop at Gurudwara Pathar Saheb, a revered Sikh shrine, and witness the stunning confluence of the Indus and Zanskar rivers at Nimmo. After an enriching day, return to Leh and enjoy some free time for personal activities. End the day with a relaxing overnight stay at the hotel with dinner included.

Itinerary.Name: Leh – Spituk (Kali Temple) – Zinchen: 4-5 H. Trek
Description: After breakfast, drive to Spituk Bridge, located about 7 kilometers from Leh, behind the Spituk Monastery. From here, begin your trekking adventure along the Indus River, traversing a flat and desolate plain at the base of the majestic Stok Mountains. As you ascend to higher altitudes, cross breathtaking mountain passes that offer stunning panoramic views. The trail eventually leads through a dramatic gorge, creating a sense of complete isolation before reaching Zingchen. Conclude the day with an overnight stay in a camp at Zingchen, with dinner included.

Itinerary.Name: Zinchen – Yurutse: 5-6 H. Trek
Description: After breakfast, set off from Zingchen towards Rumbak, following a straightforward trail that gradually leads into Hemis National Park, home to rare wildlife such as the elusive snow leopard, bharal, marmots, and wolves. As you trek through a narrow path, the valley gradually opens up, revealing breathtaking landscapes. Continue your journey until you reach Yurutse, a serene campsite nestled below the majestic Gandala Pass. Spend the night in a camp, surrounded by the tranquility of the mountains, with dinner included.

Itinerary.Name: Yurutse – Gondala (4350m) – Shingo – Skyu: 7 – 8 H. Trek
Description: After breakfast, begin your trek from Yurutse, following a scenic path along the mountainside before crossing a small valley. The trail then ascends steeply in a zigzag pattern, leading to the breathtaking Gandala Pass at 4,380 meters. After soaking in the panoramic views, start the long descent towards Shingo, a journey of about two hours, gradually entering the picturesque Markha Valley. A short walk further brings you to the village of Skyu, where you will set up camp for an overnight stay in tents, with dinner included.

Itinerary.Name: Skyu – Markha Village: 7-8 H. Trek.
Description: After breakfast, begin your trek towards Markha Village, following a well-defined trail along the right bank of the Markha River, where lush vegetation contrasts with the rugged landscape. Cross the river to reach a barren plain before arriving at Chaluk. Continue along the left bank, navigating another river crossing before ascending towards Markha Village. At the far end of the village, set up camp near the river, offering a peaceful and scenic resting spot. Enjoy an overnight stay in tents with dinner included.

Itinerary.Name: Markha Village – Hankar – Thachunche: 7-8 H. Trek
Description: After breakfast, begin your trek towards Tchatchutse, passing through the picturesque village of Hankar. The trail offers stunning views of the surrounding mountains and landscapes as you gradually ascend through the valley. After a long yet rewarding journey, reach Tchatchutse and settle into your campsite for an overnight stay in tents, with dinner included.

Itinerary.Name: Thachunche – Nimaling: 5-6 H. Trek
Description: After breakfast, set out on a trek towards Nimaling, a breathtaking high-altitude pasture at 4,900 meters. This vast grazing land comes alive in the summer months with herds of sheep, goats, and yaks. Towering to the south stands Kang Yatse, a majestic 6,400-meter peak, offering a stunning backdrop to the serene landscape. After a rewarding trek, settle into your campsite for an overnight stay in tents, with dinner included.

Itinerary.Name: Nimaling – Shang Sumdo: 7-8 H. Trek
Description: After breakfast, begin your trek towards Kongmaru La, the highest pass of the journey at 5,100 meters. The trail winds through dramatic narrow gorges before reaching the summit, where breathtaking views of the Ladakh ranges and the distant villages of the Indus Valley unfold. After soaking in the panoramic scenery, descend from the pass and continue trekking towards Shang Sumdo. Conclude the day's adventure with an overnight stay in tents, with dinner included.

Itinerary.Name: Shang Sumdo Village – Hemis – Leh: 2 H. Trek /Drive
Description: After breakfast, take a short trek along the stream leading to Hemis Monastery, one of the oldest and wealthiest monasteries in Ladakh. Explore its vibrant murals, ancient artifacts, and spiritual ambiance before driving back to Leh. En route, visit Thiksey Monastery, known for its grand Maitreya Buddha statue, followed by Shey Palace and Stok Palace, which also houses a fascinating museum. Upon arrival in Leh, check into your hotel and enjoy the rest of the day at leisure for individual activities. Dinner and an overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Leh Departure
Description: After breakfast in time depart from the base location, taking with you unforgettable memories departure transfer to airport, board onward flight and a sense of accomplishment.

Name: Markha Valley Trekking Tour in India

Description: Explore the thrilling Markha trek from Leh to Hemis via Spituk, Zinchen, Nimaling, and Shang Sumdo. Experience India's scenic trekking routes with Eaze Tours.
Summary: Experience the breathtaking beauty of the Markha Valley with our expertly curated tour package. From stunning landscapes to rich cultural encounters, this adventure promises unforgettable memories. Book your Markha Valley tour today and let Eaze Tours guide you through this Himalayan gem! Looking for more travel options? Explore our Ladakh & Kashmir Tour Package in India for an extended journey through India’s most scenic destinations! Reserve your spot now!
Overview: Discover the untouched beauty of India’s mountains, forests, and valleys with our Markha valley trekking tour package in India. Perfect for nature lovers and adventure seekers, this tour takes you through picturesque trails, rich cultural heritage, and diverse landscapes. Whether it’s the Himalayan foothills, Western Ghats, or the serene deserts of Rajasthan, this trekking journey is a blend of adventure and tranquility.
AdditionalInformation:

  • Best Time to Visit: October to March for most regions; May to September for Himalayan treks.
  • What to Bring: Comfortable trekking shoes, warm clothing, a backpack, water bottle, and personal essentials.
  • Travel insurance is recommended.

  • Any expenses not listed above.

TourCompanion.Name: Markha Trek Support Crew
TourCompanion.Description: Experienced mountain guide, cook, mule handlers, safety team

Itinerary.Name: Arrival in Kolkata
Description: Upon arrival in Kolkata, begin your journey with a warm welcome and breakfast, followed by a detailed tour briefing by the local staff. Spend the day exploring the vibrant 'City of Joy,' also known as Mother Teresa’s city. Visit the beautiful Jain Temple, the fascinating Zoological Gardens, and the iconic Victoria Memorial, which stands as a symbol of the city's rich history. Enjoy a scenic drive past landmarks such as the Howrah Bridge, Dalhousie Square, Fort Williams, Secretariat Building, and Old Court House Street. Absorb the cultural and historical essence of Kolkata before unwinding at your hotel for an overnight stay, preparing for more adventures ahead.

Itinerary.Name: Kolkata / Bagdogra / Darjeeling
Description: After breakfast, depart from Kolkata and transfer to the airport for your flight to Bagdogra. Upon arrival at Bagdogra Airport, embark on a scenic drive to Darjeeling, a journey of approximately three hours covering 68 kilometers. Nestled in the Eastern Himalayas, Darjeeling is one of India’s most picturesque hill stations and boasts the world’s highest racecourse. Spend the day exploring its key attractions, including Lablong Village, the Mountaineering Institute, and Tenzing Norgay House, the home of the first Everest hero. Upon reaching Darjeeling, check into your hotel and relax, soaking in the refreshing mountain air. Enjoy an overnight stay at the hotel, preparing for the next day’s adventures.

Itinerary.Name: Darjeeling
Description: Begin your day with an early morning excursion to Tiger Hill, where the breathtaking sunrise paints the sky in vibrant hues of gold and purple. From this vantage point, enjoy a mesmerizing view of the distant Himalayan peaks, a sight that leaves a lasting impression. On the way back, visit the famous Ghoom Monastery, a serene and spiritual retreat that houses a majestic statue of Maitreya Buddha. Spend the rest of the day leisurely exploring the bustling markets of Darjeeling, where you can shop for souvenirs and local handicrafts, or visit one of the renowned tea gardens to witness the process behind the world-famous Darjeeling tea. Conclude the day with a relaxing overnight stay at your hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Darjeeling / Pemayangste
Description: After breakfast, embark on a scenic drive to Pemayangste, a serene destination in Pelling, West Sikkim. Situated at an altitude of 2,085 meters, Pemayangste is home to one of Sikkim’s most significant monasteries. In the afternoon, visit the historic Pemayangste Monastery, the second oldest and one of the most revered monasteries in the region. Belonging to the Nyingma order, it holds great spiritual importance, with all other Nyingma monasteries in Sikkim being subordinate to it. Immerse yourself in the peaceful ambiance of the monastery, surrounded by breathtaking mountain views. After a day of exploration, check into your hotel and unwind for an overnight stay.

Itinerary.Name: Pemayangste / Gangtok
Description: After breakfast, set out on a picturesque drive to Gangtok, the vibrant capital of Sikkim, nestled amidst lush green forests and breathtaking mountain landscapes. This charming city is known for its serene monasteries, rich cultural heritage, and stunning views of the Himalayas. Upon arrival, check into your hotel and take the rest of the day to relax at leisure. You may choose to explore the nearby markets, take a stroll through the scenic streets, or simply unwind in the peaceful ambiance of your hotel. Enjoy a comfortable overnight stay, preparing for more adventures in this enchanting Himalayan destination.

Itinerary.Name: Gangtok
Description: After breakfast, embark on a city tour of Gangtok, a place where tradition and modernity blend seamlessly. Explore the city's many monasteries, each reflecting the deep-rooted Himalayan Buddhist culture and offering a glimpse into Sikkim’s spiritual heritage. Visit some of the most revered sites, taking in the serene atmosphere and intricate architecture. As the afternoon unfolds, enjoy leisure time to explore Gangtok at your own pace. You can stroll through the bustling markets, savor local delicacies, or simply relax and admire the breathtaking views of the surrounding hills. Conclude the day with an overnight stay at your hotel, preparing for more memorable experiences ahead.

Itinerary.Name: Gangtok / Rumtek Monastery / Gangtok
Description: Begin your day with a morning visit to Enchey Monastery, a sacred site offering tranquility and spiritual significance. From there, head to The Residency, a vantage point that provides breathtaking views of the surrounding mountains. Explore the White Memorial Hall, a historical landmark, followed by a visit to the Institute of Tibetology, which houses an extensive collection of Tibetan artifacts, manuscripts, and religious relics. Next, visit the serene Deer Park, home to lush greenery and Buddhist teachings. Later, continue your journey to the renowned Rumtek Monastery, the largest in Sikkim, belonging to the Red Hat sect of Tibetan Buddhism. Spend the afternoon at leisure before returning to your hotel for an overnight stay in Gangtok.

Itinerary.Name: Gangtok / Bagdogra / Kolkata
Description: After breakfast, depart from Gangtok and enjoy a scenic drive to Bagdogra Airport to catch your flight to Kolkata. Upon arrival in Kolkata, transfer to your hotel and check-in. The rest of the day is yours to relax at leisure. You may choose to unwind at the hotel, explore the vibrant streets of Kolkata, or visit any remaining attractions at your own pace. Enjoy the city's rich cultural ambiance, indulge in local cuisine, or take a peaceful evening stroll along the Hooghly River. Conclude the day with an overnight stay at your hotel, preparing for the final leg of your journey.

Itinerary.Name: Departure Kolkata
Description: After breakfast, enjoy a leisurely morning in Kolkata. You may choose to relax at the hotel or explore the city one last time, picking up souvenirs or experiencing local culture before your departure. At the scheduled time, transfer to the airport for your onward journey, bringing an end to a memorable trip filled with breathtaking landscapes, spiritual experiences, and cultural discoveries. Safe travels!

Summary: Embark on an unforgettable journey through the enchanting landscapes of North East India with Eaze Tours. Whether you're drawn to the serene beauty of Gangtok or the breathtaking views of Darjeeling, we have the perfect itinerary for you. Explore our exclusive Gangtok tour package in India and Darjeeling tour package in India to plan your dream getaway. Book now and let us craft an experience you'll cherish forever! Embrace the beauty of North East India and create unforgettable memories. Book your tour today.
Overview: Dive into the serene charm of India's North East with our North East Tour Package. This journey will take you through breathtaking landscapes, vibrant culture, and unique traditions. From the lush tea gardens of Assam to the misty hills of Meghalaya and the vibrant festivals of Nagaland, this tour is a perfect blend of nature, adventure, and heritage.

• Best Time to Visit: October to April, when the weather is pleasant and ideal for sightseeing.
  • Ideal For: Families, solo travelers, couples, and adventure enthusiasts.

TourCompanion.Name: EazeTours Cultural Escort
TourCompanion.Description: Local guide with deep knowledge of Eastern Indian heritage and traditions

Itinerary.Name: Arrive Delhi
Description: Upon arrival in Delhi, the vibrant capital of India, you will be warmly welcomed and transferred to your hotel. After check-in, take some time to relax and unwind from your journey. Depending on your arrival time, you may choose to explore the city's bustling streets, visit nearby attractions, or enjoy a taste of Delhi’s diverse culinary delights. The day is at your leisure, allowing you to rest and prepare for the exciting adventures ahead. Enjoy an overnight stay at your hotel in Delhi.

Itinerary.Name: Delhi to Manali
Description: After breakfast, drive to Manali, passing through Mandi, the gateway to Kullu Valley. En route, witness the impressive Pandoh Dam, which diverts Beas River water through tunnels to Baggi. The journey through the scenic Sainj Valley offers breathtaking mountain views. Along the way, visit the Vaishno Devi Temple, a small cave shrine, and explore the charming villages of Katrain and Patlikuhl. Stop at Nagar to visit the Roerich Gallery, showcasing the works of Russian painter Nicholas Roerich. Continue the drive, soaking in the beauty of the Himalayan landscape. Arrive in Manali by evening, check into your hotel, and relax. Overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Manali to Keylong
Description: After breakfast, explore Manali with a local sightseeing tour. Nestled at the northern end of Kullu Valley, Manali is a charming resort town surrounded by stunning landscapes. Enjoy scenic walks, visit famous attractions, and soak in the town’s vibrant atmosphere. Later, begin your journey toward Keylong, driving along breathtaking mountain roads. The route offers spectacular views of lush valleys, snow-capped peaks, and picturesque villages. Enjoy the changing landscapes as you ascend toward the rugged terrain of Lahaul. Arrive in Keylong by evening, check into your hotel, and unwind after the scenic drive. Overnight stay at the hotel in Keylong.

Itinerary.Name: Keylong to Hemis
Description: After an early breakfast, embark on a challenging yet breathtaking journey from Keylong to Hemis. The route passes through Darcha, a major tent site on this rugged road. Continue toward Baralacha La Pass at 4,883 meters, a significant crossroads connecting different valleys. After crossing into Sarchu, another key tent site, the adventure intensifies as you ascend Lachung La Pass (5,060 meters), the second-highest pass on the Manali-Leh road. The journey continues to Pang before tackling Taglang La, the world’s second-highest motorable road at 5,328 meters. As you descend into Ladakh, pass through Upshi, admiring its striking landscapes. Arrive in Hemis by evening and stay overnight at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Hemis to Pangong Lake / Tso Moriri Lake
Description: In the morning, visit the historic Hemis Monastery, the largest and most significant monastery in Ladakh. Located 49 km south of Leh, it was built in the 17th century by Chapgon Gyalshas and has been under royal patronage ever since. Hemis serves as the headquarters of the Drukpa order, overseeing all monasteries in Ladakh and training Lamas for royal monasteries in Leh, Shey, and Bazgo. In the 19th century, it survived a siege by General Zorawar Singh due to the wisdom of its head Lama. After the monastery visit, travelers can choose between Pangong Lake or Tso Moriri Lake. Overnight stay near the chosen lake.

Itinerary.Name: Pangong Lake / Tso Moriri Lake to Leh
Description: After enjoying the serene beauty of Pangong Lake or Tso Moriri Lake, begin the journey back to Leh. En route, visit Thiksey Monastery, a magnificent 12-story structure resembling the Potala Palace in Lhasa. Explore Shey Palace, the former summer residence of Ladakhi kings, known for its giant copper-gold Buddha statue. Arrive in Leh by evening and check into the hotel. On Day 7, take a complete rest at the hotel, allowing time to acclimatize and relax after the long journey. Stroll around Leh’s markets, explore local cafes, or simply enjoy the peaceful mountain surroundings. Overnight stay in Leh.

Itinerary.Name: Local Sight seeing
Description: After breakfast, begin the day by exploring Leh’s vibrant market, where you can browse traditional Ladakhi handicrafts, Tibetan artifacts, and souvenirs. Next, visit the historic Leh Palace, a grand nine-story structure offering breathtaking panoramic views of the town and the surrounding mountains. In the afternoon, take a stroll through the women’s vegetable market, a lively place showcasing fresh local produce and a glimpse into the daily life of the locals. Later, head to the peaceful Sankar Gompa, a serene monastery known for its intricate murals and spiritual ambiance. As the evening sets in, soak in the tranquil atmosphere before returning to the hotel for an overnight stay in Leh.

Itinerary.Name: Leh to Khardung-la top
Description: After breakfast, embark on an exhilarating journey to Khardung-La, the highest motorable road in the world at an altitude of 18,380 feet (5,578 meters). The drive offers breathtaking views of the surrounding snow-capped peaks and deep valleys. Beyond Khardung-La lies the stunning Nubra Valley, known for its mesmerizing landscapes and rich Buddhist heritage. The valley is home to several ancient monasteries, including the 350-year-old Diskit Monastery, as well as Sumur and Tigar Monasteries, each offering a glimpse into the region’s deep spiritual roots. The journey through Nubra Valley also presents unparalleled trekking opportunities, making it a paradise for adventure enthusiasts. Return to Leh for an overnight stay.

Itinerary.Name: Shopping and Cultural Programme
Description: On the tenth day, immerse yourself in the rich culture and traditions of Ladakh. Spend the day shopping for authentic Ladakhi handicrafts, traditional jewelry, Pashmina shawls, and Tibetan souvenirs in Leh’s bustling markets. Later, visit the Tibetan refugee camp at Choklamsar, where you can learn about the lives of Tibetan settlers and explore their unique craftsmanship. Continue to the Library and Ecological Development Center, which offers insights into Ladakh’s heritage, sustainable practices, and environmental initiatives. In the evening, enjoy a cultural program showcasing traditional Ladakhi music and dance, providing a deeper understanding of the region’s vibrant customs. Return to the hotel for an overnight stay in Leh.

Itinerary.Name: Local Sight-seeing
Description: On the eleventh day, embark on a journey through some of Ladakh’s most iconic monasteries and cultural landmarks. Begin with a scenic drive from Leh to Lamayuru, a picturesque village known for its ancient Lamayuru Monastery, often referred to as the 'Moonland' due to its unique landscape. Explore the monastery’s rich history, stunning murals, and sacred caves. Continue the journey to Likir Monastery, home to a magnificent 75-foot statue of Maitreya Buddha and an impressive collection of Buddhist artifacts. Visit Alchi Monastery, one of Ladakh’s oldest monastic complexes, renowned for its exquisite frescoes and wood carvings. After a fulfilling day of sightseeing, spend the night in Lamayuru, surrounded by its mystical terrain.

Itinerary.Name: Lamayuru to Kargil
Description: On the twelfth day, the journey continues from Lamayuru to Kargil, passing through breathtaking landscapes and historically significant sites. The route winds through rugged mountain terrain, offering stunning views of the dramatic Ladakhi landscape. Travelers will pass through Fotu La, the highest pass on the Srinagar-Leh highway, and Namika La, another high-altitude pass with panoramic vistas. Along the way, visit Mulbekh Monastery, famous for its ancient rock-carved statue of Maitreya Buddha. As the caravan moves closer to Kargil, the scenery transitions into lush valleys and flowing rivers. Upon arrival in Kargil, check into the hotel and relax, reflecting on the day's mesmerizing journey through the heart of Ladakh.

Itinerary.Name: Kargil to Srinagar
Description: On the thirteenth day, the journey proceeds from Kargil to Srinagar, passing through the breathtaking Zoji La Pass, one of the most challenging yet stunning mountain passes in the region. As the caravan descends, travelers enter the lush and picturesque Sonamarg, often called the 'Meadow of Gold,' with its rolling green landscapes and snow-capped peaks. The scenery gradually transforms from rugged Ladakhi terrain to the verdant beauty of the Kashmir Valley. Upon arrival in Srinagar, the capital of Jammu and Kashmir, check into the hotel and relax. The serene Dal Lake, Mughal gardens, and vibrant local markets await exploration, marking a transition from Ladakh’s stark beauty to Kashmir’s lush charm.

Itinerary.Name: Srinagar, Local Sight-seeing
Description: On the fourteenth day, the exploration of Srinagar begins with a visit to the enchanting Dal Lake, a jewel of Kashmir. More than just a vast expanse of water, Dal Lake is an intricate maze of interconnected waterways, floating gardens, and charming houseboats. The lake is divided into three sections—Gagribal, Lokut Dal, and Bod Dal—by scenic causeways, each offering unique views and experiences. At the city end of the lake, Dal Gate regulates the flow of water into the Jhelum River, adding to the lake’s significance. A leisurely Shikara ride on the tranquil waters offers mesmerizing views of the surrounding mountains and traditional Kashmiri houseboats, making it a truly unforgettable experience.

Itinerary.Name: Srinagar to Jammu
Description: On the fifteenth day, the journey from Srinagar to Jammu takes travelers through some of the most picturesque hill stations in the region. Passing through Batote, Patnitop, and Kud, the scenic drive offers breathtaking views of lush green meadows, dense pine forests, and rolling hills. As the road winds down towards Jammu, travelers pass through the famous Jawahar Tunnel, a 3-kilometer-long engineering marvel that connects the Kashmir Valley with the rest of India. The changing landscapes, from the cool mountain air of Patnitop to the warmer plains of Jammu, make the journey a captivating experience. Upon arrival in Jammu city, travelers check in to their hotel for an overnight stay, preparing for the next leg of their adventure.

Itinerary.Name: Jammu to Delhi
Description: On the final day of the journey, travelers embark on the drive from Jammu to Delhi, marking the conclusion of an unforgettable exploration. As the road winds through the plains of Punjab and Haryana, the journey offers glimpses of rural landscapes, bustling towns, and the vibrant culture of North India. A farewell stop is planned at Karnal, where travelers can reflect on their experiences and bid farewell to their fellow companions. Upon arrival in Delhi, the journey officially comes to an end, with travelers proceeding towards their onward destinations. The memories of breathtaking landscapes, cultural encounters, and thrilling adventures remain, making this an experience to cherish for a lifetime.

Name: Ladakh and Kashmir Tour Package

Title: Ladakh & Kashmir Tour Package India | Delhi to Srinagar
Description: Explore Ladakh and Kashmir tour package in India: Delhi, Manali, Keylong, Hemis, Pangong, Lamayuru, Likir, Srinagar, and more. Book your adventure today!
Summary: Experience the magic of Ladakh and Kashmir with our 15 Nights/16 Days Ladakh and Kashmir Tour Package, designed for unforgettable adventures amidst stunning landscapes and cultural heritage. Book your journey today and create memories that will last a lifetime! For more adventure packages, explore our Delhi Leh Ladakh tour package in India and start planning your dream vacation with Eaze Tours now.
Overview: Embark on a mesmerizing journey through the scenic landscapes of Ladakh and Kashmir with our exclusive tour package. Witness Kashmir's lush valleys and tranquil lakes, coupled with Ladakh's rugged mountains and high-altitude desert. This package promises an unforgettable experience filled with adventure, culture, and natural beauty.
AdditionalInformation:
• Best Time to Visit: April to October for Kashmir; June to September for Ladakh.
  • Difficulty Level: Moderate, suitable for all age groups.
  • What to Bring: Warm clothing, sturdy shoes, sunglasses, sunscreen, and a camera.
  • Oxygen support is available for high-altitude areas.
  • Travel insurance is highly recommended.

  • Daily breakfast and dinner.
  • Private transportation for all transfers and sightseeing.
  • Inner line permits for restricted areas in Ladakh.

Itinerary.Name: Arrival in Delhi
Description: Upon arrival in Delhi, the vibrant capital of India, you will be warmly welcomed and transferred to your hotel. After check-in, take some time to relax and unwind from your journey. Depending on your arrival time, you may choose to explore the city's bustling streets, visit nearby attractions, or enjoy a taste of Delhi’s diverse culinary delights. The day is at your leisure, allowing you to rest and prepare for the exciting adventures ahead. Enjoy an overnight stay at your hotel in Delhi.

Itinerary.Name: Explore Delhi
Description: On the second day, immerse yourself in the rich history and vibrant culture of Delhi. Begin the day by visiting India Gate, a grand war memorial that stands as a tribute to soldiers who sacrificed their lives. Stroll around its lush surroundings, taking in the patriotic ambiance. Next, head to Qutub Minar, the world's tallest brick minaret, adorned with intricate carvings and inscriptions from centuries past. As you explore its ancient complex, admire the grandeur of Indo-Islamic architecture. The rest of the day can be spent discovering Delhi’s bustling streets, savoring local delicacies, or shopping at vibrant markets. After a fulfilling day, return to the hotel for a comfortable overnight stay.

Itinerary.Name: Delhi to Leh
Description: On the third day, depart from Delhi and take a scenic flight to Leh, soaring over the majestic Trans-Himalayas. Upon arrival, experience the thrill of landing at one of the highest airports in the world. You will be warmly welcomed and transferred to your hotel, where a brief orientation about the itinerary will be provided over breakfast. Due to the high altitude, acclimatization is essential, so rest for the first half of the day. After a relaxing break, enjoy a leisurely walk through the vibrant Leh market, soaking in the local culture, traditional crafts, and bustling atmosphere. Conclude the day with an overnight stay at the hotel, preparing for the adventures ahead.

Itinerary.Name: Leh
Description: On the fourth day, start with a visit to Spituk Monastery, a serene Buddhist monastery that offers a glimpse into the spiritual life of Ladakh. Then, explore the Kali Temple (Temple of Palden Lhamo), where both Buddhist and Hindu devotees, including Indian Army personnel, come to worship. After lunch at the hotel, take a stroll through Leh Market, experiencing the vibrant local culture and traditional handicrafts. In the evening, visit Shanti Stupa, a Japanese peace pagoda perched on a hilltop, offering breathtaking panoramic views of Leh town, Khardung La, and the Indus Valley. Capture the mesmerizing sunset and conclude your day with a peaceful dinner at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Leh / Lamayuru / Uleytopko (160 Kms)
Description: After breakfast, embark on a scenic drive to Lamayuru, one of the oldest and most significant monasteries in Ladakh. En route, visit Likir Monastery, known for its grand Buddha statue, and Gurudwara Pathar Sahib, a revered Sikh shrine. Upon arrival, check into a camp at Alchi or Uleytopko and enjoy a hot lunch. In the afternoon, explore the breathtaking Moon Landscapes, a surreal terrain resembling the moon’s surface. Visit the historic Lamayuru Monastery, perched dramatically on rugged cliffs, offering stunning views and rich spiritual heritage. Conclude the day with an overnight stay at a camp or hotel, surrounded by Ladakh’s serene and mystical beauty.

Itinerary.Name: Uleytopko / Alchi / Leh (70 Kms)
Description: After breakfast, embark on a journey back to Leh, stopping at key cultural and historical sites along the way. Visit the Alchi Monastery, famous for its ancient murals and unique Kashmiri-influenced architecture. Explore Basgo Palace, a historic fortress offering breathtaking views of the valley. Continue to the Hall of Fame, a war memorial dedicated to the valor of Indian soldiers. Arrive in Leh by the afternoon and enjoy a delicious lunch at the hotel. The rest of the day is free for leisure—relax at the hotel, explore the vibrant Leh market, or soak in the serene Himalayan atmosphere. Conclude the day with an overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Leh / Nubra Valley (120 Kms)
Description: After breakfast, embark on a scenic drive to Nubra Valley via Khardung La, the world’s highest motorable pass at 18,380 feet. Witness breathtaking views of the snow-capped peaks and deep valleys along the way. By afternoon, arrive at Diskit, the administrative center of Nubra Valley. Spend the rest of the day exploring Diskit and Hunder Villages, known for their sand dunes, double-humped Bactrian camels, and serene landscapes. Visit the Diskit Monastery, home to a towering Maitreya Buddha statue overlooking the valley. Enjoy a peaceful evening amidst the beauty of Nubra Valley before retiring for an overnight stay at a hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Nubra Valley / Leh (120 Kms)
Description: After breakfast, visit the Diskit Monastery, the oldest and largest monastery in Nubra Valley, housing a magnificent Maitreya Buddha statue and offering stunning panoramic views of the valley. Take some time to explore the surrounding landscape before beginning the drive back to Leh via the same route, crossing the mighty Khardung La Pass (18,380 feet) once again. Enjoy the breathtaking scenery along the way, with opportunities to capture mesmerizing views of the Himalayan ranges. Upon arrival in Leh, check in to your hotel and relax. Spend the evening at leisure, exploring the local market or simply unwinding. Overnight stay at the hotel in Leh.

Itinerary.Name: Leh / Pangong Lake (160 Kms)
Description: After breakfast, embark on a scenic drive to Pangong Lake (14,500 feet) via Changla Pass (17,350 feet), the third-highest motorable road in the world. The journey takes you through breathtaking landscapes, rugged mountain terrains, and picturesque villages, offering stunning views of the Himalayan wilderness. Upon reaching Pangong Lake, witness its mesmerizing blue waters that change shades with the sunlight, surrounded by towering mountains. Spend the evening soaking in the serene beauty of this high-altitude lake, made famous by Bollywood movies. Enjoy a peaceful night under the starlit sky at a campsite near the lake. Overnight stay in a camp by Pangong Lake.

Itinerary.Name: Leh / Pangong Lake (160 Kms)
Description: After breakfast, embark on the return journey to Leh from Pangong Lake, retracing the scenic route through Changla Pass. Along the way, visit the Hemis Monastery, the largest and wealthiest monastery in Ladakh, known for its ancient Buddhist relics and vibrant murals. Next, explore Thiksey Monastery, a stunning hilltop monastery resembling the Potala Palace in Tibet, offering breathtaking views of the Indus Valley. Finally, stop at Shey Palace, the former summer retreat of Ladakhi kings, housing a giant gold-plated Buddha statue. Arrive in Leh by evening, where you can relax at your hotel or explore the local market. Overnight stay at a hotel in Leh.

Itinerary.Name: Depart from Leh to Delhi
Description: On the final day, enjoy an early breakfast before transferring to the Leh Airport for your flight to Delhi. Experience a breathtaking aerial view of the Himalayas one last time. Upon arrival in Delhi, you will be escorted to your hotel for check-in. The rest of the day is at leisure—explore the city's vibrant markets, indulge in local cuisine, or relax after the journey. Reflect on the unforgettable memories of Ladakh’s stunning landscapes, ancient monasteries, and thrilling high-altitude passes. Overnight stay at a hotel in Delhi, marking the end of an extraordinary adventure.

Itinerary.Name: Depart Delhi
Description: After breakfast, enjoy some free time for last-minute shopping or relaxation. Depending on your flight schedule, you will be transferred to the airport for your onward journey. Bid farewell to Delhi, carrying unforgettable memories of the breathtaking landscapes, cultural experiences, and thrilling adventures from your Ladakh expedition. Safe travels!

Itinerary.Name: Ayurveda – A Balance of Body, Mind, and Soul
Description: Arrive in Kerala, the land of authentic Ayurvedic healing, and begin your wellness journey. Experience a holistic Ayurvedic treatment that revitalizes your body, calms your mind, and nourishes your soul. Let the serene environment and ancient therapies guide you toward deep relaxation and transformation. Rejuvenate with herbal oils, therapeutic massages, and personalized treatments designed to restore balance and harmony. Immerse yourself in the wisdom of Ayurveda, where centuries-old traditions offer natural healing and renewal. Kerala’s lush landscapes and tranquil retreats provide the perfect setting for a profound wellness experience. Embrace the journey to holistic well-being and return refreshed, recharged, and deeply renewed. Your path to true wellness starts here.

Itinerary.Name: The Blessings of Nature
Description: Immerse yourself in Kerala’s tranquil embrace, where nature enhances your healing journey. The region’s lush greenery, fresh air, and cool monsoon climate create the ideal atmosphere for deep rejuvenation. The high humidity boosts the absorption of herbal medicines, making Ayurvedic treatments more effective in restoring balance and vitality. Let the soothing rains and serene surroundings amplify your wellness experience, ensuring a profound connection between nature and healing. As you relax amidst Kerala’s natural beauty, feel your stress melt away, replaced by a sense of renewal and harmony. Embrace the blessings of nature and allow Ayurveda to work its magic on your body and mind.

Itinerary.Name: Dental Vacations
Description: Combine wellness with world-class dental care in Kerala, where affordability meets excellence. Experience high-quality treatments like root canals, crowns, and implants from skilled professionals using advanced technology. As you enhance your smile, immerse yourself in Kerala’s serene landscapes, from tranquil backwaters to lush greenery, ensuring a stress-free recovery. The region’s holistic healing environment complements your dental treatments, promoting relaxation and overall well-being. Enjoy a rejuvenating getaway while receiving top-tier care at a fraction of international costs. Whether for cosmetic enhancements or essential procedures, Kerala offers the perfect blend of healthcare and leisure, making your dental vacation both rewarding and revitalizing.

Itinerary.Name: Ayurveda for Rejuvenation
Description: Embark on a transformative Ayurvedic journey at Kerala’s top hospitals and wellness resorts, where ancient wisdom blends with modern comfort. Rejuvenate your body and mind through daily yoga, meditation, and personalized stress-relief treatments. Experience the healing touch of expert therapists using time-tested herbal therapies to restore balance and vitality. Indulge in nourishing Ayurvedic meals tailored to support your well-being, while serene accommodations provide the perfect space for relaxation and renewal. Surrounded by Kerala’s tranquil landscapes, immerse yourself in a holistic retreat that refreshes your senses and revitalizes your soul. Let Ayurveda guide you toward lasting wellness, inner harmony, and complete rejuvenation.

Itinerary.Name: Abhyangam (Oil Massage)
Description: Indulge in the rejuvenating benefits of Abhyangam, a traditional Ayurvedic oil massage known for its deep healing effects. This specialized 45-minute therapy uses warm herbal oils tailored to your body’s needs, enhancing blood circulation, relieving muscle tension, and alleviating rheumatic discomfort. Through rhythmic strokes and expert techniques, Abhyangam nourishes the skin, calms the nervous system, and promotes overall well-being. As the therapeutic oils penetrate deeply, toxins are flushed out, leaving you feeling refreshed and revitalized. Experience the profound relaxation and rejuvenation that this ancient therapy offers, restoring balance to both body and mind. Let the healing power of Ayurveda bring you renewed energy and vitality.

Itinerary.Name: Ilakkizhi (Patrasweda)
Description: Discover the healing power of Ilakkizhi, a traditional Ayurvedic therapy designed to relieve pain and rejuvenate the body. Warm bundles of medicinal leaves, grated coconut, and herbal powders are gently massaged over the body using rhythmic strokes. The heat and medicinal properties penetrate deep into the muscles and joints, easing stiffness, reducing inflammation, and enhancing blood circulation. This therapy is especially effective for alleviating rheumatic pain, joint swelling, and muscular tension, promoting deep relaxation and overall well-being. As your body absorbs the therapeutic warmth, feel stress and discomfort melt away, leaving you refreshed, re-energized, and deeply healed by Ayurveda’s ancient wisdom.

Itinerary.Name: Podikkizhi (Choornasweda)
Description: Experience the rejuvenating power of Podikkizhi, an Ayurvedic therapy that revitalizes the body and calms the mind. Warm linen bags filled with medicinal herbs and powders are gently massaged over the body, inducing therapeutic sweating that helps eliminate toxins. This detoxifying treatment balances Vata and Kapha doshas, relieving body aches, muscle stiffness, and joint discomfort. As the warmth penetrates deep into the tissues, it enhances blood circulation, reduces inflammation, and promotes overall well-being. The soothing heat and rhythmic massage work together to dissolve stress and tension, leaving you feeling deeply relaxed, re-energized, and refreshed. Let Ayurveda’s ancient wisdom restore your vitality and balance.

Itinerary.Name: Panchakarma
Description: Embark on the ultimate Ayurvedic detox with Panchakarma, a transformative purification therapy that restores balance and vitality. This intensive process comprises five specialized treatments—Vamana (therapeutic vomiting), Virechana (purgation), Snehavasti (oil enema), Kashayavasti (decoction enema), and Nasya (nasal therapy)—each designed to eliminate deep-seated toxins from the body. By cleansing the digestive system, improving circulation, and rejuvenating internal organs, Panchakarma enhances overall well-being and promotes long-term health. Under expert Ayurvedic guidance, this therapy revitalizes both body and mind, leaving you feeling lighter, healthier, and more energized. Surrender to this ancient healing ritual and experience complete renewal from within.

Itinerary.Name: Abhyangam with Special Face Massage
Description: Indulge in the ultimate relaxation with Abhyangam combined with a special Ayurvedic face massage, a rejuvenating therapy that revitalizes both body and mind. Warm herbal oils are gently massaged over the body using rhythmic strokes, enhancing circulation, relieving muscle tension, and promoting overall well-being. The specialized facial massage, enriched with herbal extracts and essential oils, deeply nourishes the skin, improving texture, glow, and elasticity. This holistic therapy not only enhances skin radiance but also calms the nervous system, alleviates stress, and restores inner harmony. Experience a profound sense of relaxation and renewal as Ayurveda works its magic, leaving you refreshed, rejuvenated, and glowing with vitality.

Itinerary.Name: Udvarthanam (Herbal Powder Massage)
Description: Rejuvenate your body with Udvarthanam, a unique Ayurvedic therapy that uses herbal powders in a vigorous upward massage to stimulate circulation and detoxification. This energizing treatment helps break down excess fat, improves metabolism, and supports weight management, making it ideal for those seeking a toned and revitalized body. The friction generated by the massage exfoliates the skin, enhances lymphatic drainage, and removes toxins, leaving you feeling lighter, refreshed, and full of vitality. As the herbal powders penetrate deep into the skin, they promote a natural glow while balancing Kapha dosha. Experience the transformative benefits of Udvarthanam and embrace a renewed sense of energy and well-being.

Itinerary.Name: Navarakkizhi
Description: Immerse yourself in the healing warmth of Navarakkizhi, a specialized Ayurvedic therapy that deeply nourishes and rejuvenates the body. In this unique treatment, warm linen bags filled with Navara rice—a medicinal variety cooked in herbal decoctions—are gently massaged over the body. This soothing therapy enhances muscle strength, relieves arthritis, fibromyalgia, and nerve-related disorders, while promoting anti-aging and overall rejuvenation. The rich nutrients in Navara rice deeply penetrate the tissues, improving skin texture, reducing inflammation, and restoring vitality. Ideal for those seeking renewed energy and relief from chronic pain, Navarakkizhi offers a luxurious and therapeutic experience, leaving you feeling refreshed, revitalized, and balanced.

Itinerary.Name: Ksheeradhara
Description: Experience the deeply calming and nourishing effects of Ksheeradhara, an Ayurvedic therapy where a continuous stream of medicated milk is gently poured over the body or forehead. This cooling treatment helps balance Pitta dosha, making it ideal for relieving stress, anxiety, insomnia, and skin disorders. The herbal-infused milk penetrates the skin, providing intense hydration, soothing inflammation, and enhancing overall skin radiance. As the warm, rhythmic flow relaxes the nervous system, it induces a state of deep relaxation and mental clarity. Ideal for those seeking emotional and physical rejuvenation, Ksheeradhara leaves you feeling refreshed, serene, and revitalized from within.

Itinerary.Name: Thakradhara
Description: Unwind with Thakradhara, a deeply soothing Ayurvedic therapy where a continuous stream of medicated buttermilk is gently poured over the forehead. This cooling treatment is highly effective in calming the mind, relieving stress, anxiety, migraines, and insomnia, while also helping manage hypertension and memory-related concerns. The therapeutic properties of buttermilk help balance Pitta dosha, reducing excess heat in the body and promoting a state of deep relaxation and mental clarity. As the gentle flow soothes the nervous system, you’ll experience a profound sense of peace and rejuvenation. Ideal for those seeking stress relief and emotional balance, Thakradhara leaves you feeling refreshed, calm, and revitalized.

Itinerary.Name: Pizhichil
Description: Unwind with Thakradhara, a deeply soothing Ayurvedic therapy where a continuous stream of medicated buttermilk is gently poured over the forehead. This cooling treatment is highly effective in calming the mind, relieving stress, anxiety, migraines, and insomnia, while also helping manage hypertension and memory-related concerns. The therapeutic properties of buttermilk help balance Pitta dosha, reducing excess heat in the body and promoting a state of deep relaxation and mental clarity. As the gentle flow soothes the nervous system, you’ll experience a profound sense of peace and rejuvenation. Ideal for those seeking stress relief and emotional balance, Thakradhara leaves you feeling refreshed, calm, and revitalized.
