Itinerary.Name: Arrival in Chennai
Description: Upon arrival in Chennai, the vibrant gateway to southern India, you will be welcomed with traditional hospitality. This historic city, established in 1639 by the East India Company, is one of India’s oldest and most culturally rich destinations. After a warm reception, you will be transferred to your hotel for a comfortable overnight stay. Chennai, known for its deep-rooted traditions and modern outlook, offers a glimpse into the region’s colonial past, bustling markets, and stunning coastline. The city's unique blend of heritage and contemporary charm sets the perfect tone for the journey ahead, allowing you to immerse yourself in its diverse culture before embarking on an exciting exploration of South India.

Itinerary.Name: Chennai Sightseeing and Transfer to Mahabalipuram
Description: After a refreshing breakfast, meet our tour executive who will provide a brief overview of your journey and hand over essential travel documents. Begin your exploration of Chennai with a half-day sightseeing tour, passing through significant landmarks such as Anna Salai, the bustling commercial hub, and Marina Beach, one of the longest urban beaches in the world. Visit the Gandhi Memorial and Kala Kshetra, a renowned cultural academy, before heading to the historic Mylapore Temple and the iconic Kapaleeshwarar Temple, known for its stunning Dravidian architecture. After soaking in the city's rich heritage, embark on a scenic drive to Mahabalipuram. Upon arrival, check in to your hotel and unwind with an overnight stay.

Itinerary.Name: Mahabalipuram and Kanchipuram Tour
Description: Begin your day with a delightful breakfast before setting off on a journey to Kanchipuram, the ancient capital of the Pallava dynasty, famously known as the 'City of a Thousand Temples.' Explore the architectural brilliance of Ekambareswarar Temple, Kailasanatha Temple, Sri Kamakshi Temple, and Varadarajaswamy Temple, each reflecting the grandeur of Dravidian craftsmanship. Kanchipuram is also celebrated for its exquisite silk weaving, making it a haven for silk lovers. Later, return to Mahabalipuram for a half-day city tour of this historic port, built in the 7th century and renowned for its magnificent rock-cut sculptures. Visit the Shore Temple, an architectural gem dedicated to Lord Shiva and Lord Vishnu. Conclude the day with a peaceful overnight stay at your hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Mahabalipuram to Pondicherry
Description: After a hearty breakfast, check out from your hotel and embark on a scenic drive to Pondicherry, a charming coastal town that beautifully blends French colonial heritage with Indian culture. Upon arrival, check in to your hotel and set out for a half-day city tour. Begin with a visit to the renowned Aurobindo Ashram, a serene retreat located 10 kilometers north of Pondicherry, dedicated to the integration of Yoga and modern science. After enjoying a leisurely lunch, explore Auroville, an international township founded with the vision of fostering unity and sustainable living. As the day winds down, return to your hotel for a comfortable overnight stay, ready to soak in more of Pondicherry’s unique charm.

Itinerary.Name: Pondicherry to Chidambaram and Thanjavur
Description: After a delightful breakfast, embark on a journey to Chidambaram, home to the revered Nataraja Temple. This magnificent temple, adorned with a golden-plated sanctum, is dedicated to Lord Shiva in his cosmic dancer form, symbolizing the rhythm of the universe. The temple’s intricate architecture and spiritual significance make it a must-visit destination. After exploring this sacred site, continue your drive to Thanjavur, a city renowned for its rich cultural heritage and historical monuments. Upon arrival, check in to your hotel and unwind, enjoying the rest of the day at leisure. Immerse yourself in the serene ambiance of this heritage city as you prepare for the explorations ahead.

Itinerary.Name: Thanjavur Sightseeing
Description: After a delightful breakfast, embark on a journey to Chidambaram, home to the revered Nataraja Temple. This magnificent temple, adorned with a golden-plated sanctum, is dedicated to Lord Shiva in his cosmic dancer form, symbolizing the rhythm of the universe. The temple’s intricate architecture and spiritual significance make it a must-visit destination. After exploring this sacred site, continue your drive to Thanjavur, a city renowned for its rich cultural heritage and historical monuments. Upon arrival, check in to your hotel and unwind, enjoying the rest of the day at leisure. Immerse yourself in the serene ambiance of this heritage city as you prepare for the explorations ahead.

Itinerary.Name: Thanjavur to Trichy and Chettinad
Description: After a fulfilling breakfast, set out on a journey to Trichy, a city rich in history and tradition. Explore the iconic Rock Fort Temple, majestically perched atop a 23-meter-high rock, offering breathtaking panoramic views of the city. Continue to the revered Srirangam Temple, one of the largest temple complexes in India, dedicated to Lord Vishnu and known for its intricate carvings and towering gopurams. After immersing yourself in Trichy’s spiritual and architectural wonders, proceed to Chettinad, a region renowned for its opulent mansions, unique cuisine, and vibrant cultural heritage. Visit the Chettinad Museum, which houses an impressive collection of traditional artifacts, showcasing the grandeur of the Chettiar community. End the day with a peaceful overnight stay at your hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Chettinad to Madurai
Description: After a delightful breakfast, embark on a scenic drive to Madurai, one of the oldest and most culturally significant cities in southern India. Often referred to as the 'Athens of the East,' Madurai boasts a rich history spanning over 2,500 years. The city has long been a center of Tamil learning, art, and architecture, with its vibrant streets echoing tales of its glorious past. Upon arrival, check in to your hotel and unwind, soaking in the essence of this historic destination. Spend the rest of the day at leisure, preparing to explore the city's architectural marvels and bustling markets the following day. Enjoy a restful overnight stay at your hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Madurai Sightseeing
Description: After breakfast, set out to explore the cultural and architectural wonders of Madurai. Begin with a visit to the iconic Meenakshi Temple, a masterpiece of Dravidian architecture adorned with intricately carved gopurams, vibrant sculptures, and sacred halls that echo centuries of devotion. This magnificent temple complex, dedicated to Goddess Meenakshi and Lord Sundareswarar, is a spiritual and artistic marvel. Later, continue your journey to the Tirumalai Nayak Palace, a stunning 17th-century structure renowned for its grand domes, elaborate stucco work, and towering arches that reflect Indo-Saracenic design. Spend the evening at leisure, soaking in the city's lively atmosphere before retiring for a peaceful overnight stay at your hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Madurai to Periyar
Description: After a refreshing breakfast, embark on a scenic drive to Periyar, home to the famous Periyar Tiger Reserve nestled in the lush Western Ghats. This renowned wildlife sanctuary is a haven for diverse flora and fauna, including majestic elephants, elusive tigers, and a variety of bird species. Upon arrival, check into your hotel and take in the tranquil surroundings. Later, experience the beauty of Periyar Lake with a serene boat ride, offering a unique opportunity to witness wildlife in their natural habitat along the water’s edge. As the day winds down, explore the vibrant local markets, known for their aromatic spices and handicrafts. Enjoy a restful overnight stay at your hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Periyar Wildlife Safari
Description: Start your day with a hearty breakfast before setting out to explore the captivating Periyar Wildlife Sanctuary. Immerse yourself in the serene beauty of this lush reserve, home to a rich variety of wildlife, including majestic elephants, graceful deer, and an array of exotic bird species. Enjoy a tranquil boat ride on Periyar Lake, where you can witness animals gathering along the water’s edge, offering a truly mesmerizing experience. The peaceful surroundings and abundant biodiversity make this an unforgettable adventure. After a day of exploration, return to your hotel and unwind, embracing the tranquility of nature before settling in for a restful overnight stay.

Itinerary.Name: Periyar to Kumarakom and Houseboat Cruise
Description: After a delightful breakfast, embark on a scenic drive to Kumarakom, a serene destination nestled on the banks of Vembanad Lake. Upon arrival, step aboard a traditional houseboat and set sail on a mesmerizing journey through Kerala’s enchanting backwaters. This intricate network of lakes, canals, and estuaries offers a glimpse into the tranquil village life, where time seems to slow down. As the houseboat glides through the emerald waters, witness lush paddy fields, coir-making factories, and ancient temples that reflect Kerala’s rich cultural heritage. Enjoy freshly prepared local delicacies on board while soaking in the peaceful surroundings. As evening falls, the houseboat anchors at a scenic spot, allowing you to unwind and enjoy a restful overnight stay amidst nature’s beauty.

Itinerary.Name: Houseboat Cruise to Cochin
Description: Wake up to the soothing sounds of nature as your houseboat gently cruises through Kerala’s picturesque backwaters. After a delightful breakfast on board, continue your journey, taking in the lush landscapes and serene waterways before disembarking. From here, drive to Cochin, a vibrant port city that blends colonial charm with modern influences. Upon arrival, check into your hotel and set out to explore the city's historical and cultural landmarks. Visit St. Francis Church, India’s oldest European church, and marvel at the iconic Chinese Fishing Nets, a unique sight along the coastline. Explore the Mattancherry Palace, famed for its exquisite mural paintings depicting scenes from Hindu mythology. In the evening, immerse yourself in Kerala’s artistic heritage with a mesmerizing Kathakali dance performance. Conclude the day with a peaceful overnight stay at your hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Departure from Cochin
Description: Begin your final day in Cochin with a relaxed breakfast, savoring the last moments of your journey through South India. Spend the remainder of the day at your own pace, whether by exploring the city's bustling markets, taking a quiet stroll along the waterfront, or simply unwinding at your hotel. When the time comes, proceed to Cochin Airport for your onward journey, carrying with you cherished memories of vibrant cultures, stunning landscapes, and unforgettable experiences from this incredible tour.

Description: Explore the enchanting sights of South India with our Chennai Cochin tours. Immerse in rich culture, scenic beauty, & unforgettable experiences with Eaze Tours.
Summary: Embark on a scenic and cultural adventure with our South India Chennai to Cochin Tour Package, where you’ll explore the vibrant beauty and rich heritage of Southern India. Perfect for travelers from the USA, UK, and Europe, this tour offers a blend of history, nature, and tradition. Ready for more unforgettable experiences? From Chennai's colonial elegance to Cochin's historic allure, this tour offers a perfect blend of heritage, nature, and relaxation.

  • Ideal For: Culture enthusiasts, history lovers, and those seeking a mix of adventure and relaxation.

TourCompanion.Name: South India Tour Escort
TourCompanion.Description: Experienced local guide, private transport, temple protocol assistance

Itinerary.Name: Arrival in Cochin
Description: Upon arrival in Cochin, experience a warm traditional welcome before proceeding to your hotel for a comfortable overnight stay. Known as the ‘Queen of the Arabian Sea,’ Cochin is Kerala’s commercial hub and home to one of the finest natural harbors in the world. The city has a rich history shaped by centuries of trade and cultural exchanges, with influences from the British, Arabs, Chinese, Portuguese, and Dutch. Its vibrant blend of colonial architecture, bustling markets, and serene coastal beauty makes it a captivating destination. Take the rest of the day to unwind and soak in the unique charm of this historic port city.

Itinerary.Name: Cochin City Tour
Description: After a delicious breakfast, meet with our representative for a comprehensive briefing about your journey and receive your travel documents. Begin your exploration of Cochin with a visit to St. Francis Church, the oldest European church in India, built in 1503 by the Portuguese. This historic site once housed the remains of Vasco da Gama before they were relocated to Lisbon. Next, witness the iconic Chinese Fishing Nets, a fascinating legacy introduced by traders from the court of Kublai Khan, offering a glimpse into Cochin’s maritime past. Continue to Mattancherry Palace, originally built by the Portuguese in 1557 and later renovated by the Dutch in 1663. The palace is renowned for its exquisite murals depicting scenes from the Ramayana, Mahabharata, and Hindu legends, along with an impressive collection of historical maps and royal artifacts. As the day winds down, immerse yourself in Kerala’s rich artistic heritage with an enchanting Kathakali dance performance, a vibrant display of storytelling through elaborate costumes and expressive movements. Enjoy a restful overnight stay at your hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Cochin to Munnar
Description: After breakfast, embark on a scenic drive to Munnar, a charming hill station nestled at an altitude of 1,600 meters above sea level. Once the favored summer retreat of the British, Munnar is renowned for its vast tea plantations, lush landscapes, and tranquil ambiance. The region is home to unique flora, including the rare Neelakurinji flower, which blooms once every 12 years, covering the hills in a mesmerizing shade of blue. Munnar also boasts Anamudi, the highest peak in South India, making it a paradise for trekking enthusiasts. Upon arrival, check into your hotel and take the rest of the day to soak in the breathtaking beauty of this serene destination. Enjoy a peaceful overnight stay at your hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Munnar
Description: Spend the day immersing yourself in the breathtaking beauty of Munnar. Wake up to the fresh mountain air and enjoy a leisurely breakfast before heading out to explore the lush tea plantations that blanket the rolling hills. Take a guided nature walk through the scenic landscapes, where you can witness the intricate process of tea cultivation and processing. Visit local attractions such as the Tea Museum, Echo Point, and Mattupetty Dam, or simply relax amidst the serene surroundings. Whether you choose to embark on a gentle trek, capture stunning photographs, or enjoy the peaceful ambiance, Munnar offers a perfect retreat into nature. Conclude the day with an overnight stay at your hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Munnar to Periyar
Description: After breakfast, embark on a scenic drive to Periyar, home to one of India’s most renowned wildlife sanctuaries. Spanning 777 square kilometers, the Periyar Tiger Reserve is a haven for diverse flora and fauna. The sanctuary is particularly famous for its thriving population of wild elephants, which can often be seen roaming freely in their natural habitat. At the heart of the reserve lies a serene 26-square-kilometer artificial lake, created by the Mullaperiyar Dam, offering a unique vantage point for wildlife spotting. A boat cruise on the lake provides an unforgettable opportunity to observe elephants, wild boars, gaur, and various bird species. Upon arrival, check in to your hotel and spend the rest of the day exploring the local market at your own pace. Enjoy an overnight stay in Periyar.

Itinerary.Name: Periyar Wildlife Exploration
Description: After breakfast, spend the day exploring the wildlife within Periyar Tiger Reserve. The sanctuary, known for its diverse flora and fauna, offers a serene and immersive experience in nature. A boat ride on Periyar Lake provides a unique opportunity to observe elephants, wild boars, sambar deer, and various bird species in their natural habitat. The lush greenery and tranquil waters create a perfect setting for wildlife photography and relaxation. After an eventful day, return to your hotel and unwind with an overnight stay.

Itinerary.Name: Periyar to Kumarakom
Description: After breakfast, embark on a scenic drive to Kumarakom, where you will board a traditional houseboat for an unforgettable backwater cruise. Kerala’s backwaters, a vast network of lakes, canals, and rivers, offer a glimpse into the region’s unique ecosystem and traditional way of life. As the houseboat glides through serene waterways, you will witness lush paddy fields, quaint villages, and locals engaged in age-old practices such as coir-making and fishing. Along the route, you can stop at small tea shops and experience the rustic charm of village life. As the sun sets, the houseboat anchors in a tranquil spot, allowing you to soak in the peaceful surroundings. Enjoy a restful overnight stay on the houseboat, floating amidst Kerala’s enchanting backwaters.

Itinerary.Name: Alleppey to Kovalam
Description: After breakfast, disembark from the houseboat and begin your journey to Kovalam, one of South India’s most renowned beach destinations. Nestled along the Arabian Sea, Kovalam is famous for its pristine shoreline, swaying coconut palms, and a relaxed coastal atmosphere. The town boasts three stunning beaches, with Lighthouse Beach being the most popular, offering breathtaking views and vibrant seaside activities. Upon arrival, check into your hotel and unwind as you soak in the serene surroundings. The rest of the day is yours to enjoy at leisure—relax on the golden sands, take a dip in the refreshing waters, or explore the lively beachside cafes and markets. End the day with an overnight stay at your hotel, embracing the tranquil charm of Kovalam.

Itinerary.Name: Kovalam
Description: After breakfast, immerse yourself in the serene beauty of Kovalam as you enjoy a full day of leisure by its tranquil beaches. The golden sands and gentle waves create the perfect setting for relaxation, whether you choose to take a refreshing swim, soak up the sun, or take a peaceful stroll along the coastline. The charming beachfront is dotted with cafes and local markets, offering a glimpse into the vibrant coastal culture. As the sun sets, let the soothing sound of the waves set the tone for a restful evening. Conclude the day with an overnight stay at your hotel, embracing the coastal bliss of Kovalam.

Itinerary.Name: Kovalam
Description: Spend another blissful day unwinding on the serene beaches of Kovalam, where the rhythmic waves and golden sands invite you to relax at your own pace. Whether you prefer basking in the sun, taking a dip in the clear waters, or simply strolling along the scenic coastline, the day is yours to enjoy. Explore the local markets, savor delicious seafood, or indulge in a rejuvenating Ayurvedic massage to enhance your beachside retreat. As the day winds down, take in the breathtaking sunset before returning to your hotel for a peaceful overnight stay.

Itinerary.Name: Kovalam to Trivandrum Departure
Description: After a leisurely breakfast, take the time to soak in the last moments of your stay in Kovalam. Whether you choose to take a final stroll along the beach, relax at your hotel, or explore the nearby attractions, the day is yours to enjoy at a relaxed pace. At the scheduled time, you will be transferred to Trivandrum Airport for your onward journey, carrying with you beautiful memories of Kerala’s scenic landscapes, rich culture, and warm hospitality.

TourCompanion.Description: Experienced guide with local knowledge and cultural expertise

Itinerary.Name: Arrival in Delhi
Description: Upon arrival in Delhi, the bustling capital of India, you will receive a traditional welcome before being transferred to your hotel for an overnight stay. Delhi is a fascinating blend of history and modernity, where ancient monuments stand alongside contemporary skyscrapers, and the energy of the streets is palpable. As you explore, you’ll witness the contrast of cycle rickshaws weaving through narrow lanes while luxury cars glide past on wide boulevards. The city’s diverse culinary landscape is equally captivating, offering everything from rich Mughlai delicacies to gourmet wood-fired pizzas. With its vibrant culture, historic charm, and dynamic urban life, Delhi promises an unforgettable start to your journey.

Itinerary.Name: Delhi City Tour
Description: After breakfast, you will receive a detailed briefing about your tour, along with your travel documents. The day begins with an exploration of Old Delhi, a historic district steeped in Mughal grandeur. Visit Jama Masjid, the largest mosque in India, built in 1656 by Emperor Shah Jahan. As you step into the bustling lanes of Chandni Chowk, the vibrant atmosphere filled with centuries-old shops, spice markets, and traditional eateries will transport you back in time. A rickshaw ride through these narrow alleys adds to the charm of the experience. Nearby, the iconic Red Fort, constructed in 1648, stands as a testament to Mughal architectural brilliance. Transitioning into New Delhi, the contrast is striking. Explore the Qutub Minar, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, and Humayun’s Tomb, both showcasing the elegance of Mughal craftsmanship. Drive past India Gate, a war memorial honoring Indian soldiers, and admire the grandeur of the President's House, Parliament House, and Connaught Place, which reflect the colonial-era charm of the city. The day’s journey through the heart of India’s capital offers an unforgettable glimpse into its rich heritage and dynamic modernity.

Itinerary.Name: Delhi to Agra
Description: After breakfast, drive to Agra, the city of love, nestled along the Yamuna River. Upon arrival, check into your hotel and relax before exploring Agra’s magnificent monuments. Visit the Taj Mahal, the breathtaking white marble mausoleum built by Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal. This masterpiece of Mughal architecture took 22 years to complete and is renowned for its intricate inlay work. Later, explore Agra Fort, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, known for its grand palaces and impressive Mughal-era architecture. Enjoy some leisure time to explore local markets or unwind at your hotel. Overnight stay in Agra.

Itinerary.Name: Agra to Fatehpur Sikri to Ranthambore
Description: After breakfast, embark on a scenic drive to Ranthambhore, stopping en route at Fatehpur Sikri, the former Mughal capital built by Emperor Akbar in 1571. This UNESCO World Heritage Site showcases stunning architectural marvels, including Akbar’s grand residential complex, the Jama Masjid, and the revered Tomb of Salim Chisti. Despite its magnificence, the city was abandoned due to water scarcity. After exploring its rich history, continue your journey to Ranthambhore, renowned for its wildlife sanctuary and historic fort. Upon arrival, check into your hotel and unwind, preparing for the adventures ahead. Enjoy a restful overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Ranthambhore Safari
Description: Begin your day with an early morning safari in Ranthambore National Park, one of India's most renowned tiger reserves. As you traverse the dense forests and open grasslands, keep an eye out for the elusive Royal Bengal Tiger, along with leopards, sloth bears, and a diverse array of bird species. The park's rugged terrain, set against the backdrop of the Aravalli Hills, offers breathtaking scenery. After a midday rest, embark on an afternoon safari for another chance to witness the park’s incredible wildlife. Explore the historic Ranthambore Fort and ancient ruins scattered within the sanctuary. Conclude the day with a relaxing evening at your hotel, surrounded by nature’s tranquility.

Itinerary.Name: Ranthambore to Jaipur
Description: After breakfast, embark on a scenic drive to Jaipur, the captivating capital of Rajasthan, famously known as the Pink City. Renowned for its majestic forts, opulent palaces, and vibrant markets, Jaipur offers a perfect blend of history and modernity. As you arrive, you will notice the city's distinct pink-hued buildings, a tradition dating back to 1876 when the city was painted pink to welcome the Prince of Wales. Upon reaching Jaipur, check into your hotel and unwind. The rest of the day is at leisure, allowing you to explore the bustling bazaars, savor Rajasthani delicacies, or simply relax in the comfort of your hotel. Enjoy an overnight stay in Jaipur.

Itinerary.Name: Jaipur City Tour
Description: After breakfast, begin your exploration of Jaipur with a visit to the magnificent Amber Fort, a striking example of Rajput architecture perched on a hilltop. Ascend to the fort on an elephant ride or by jeep, experiencing the grandeur of this historic stronghold. Inside, admire the intricate mirror work of Sheesh Mahal and the artistic carvings of Diwan-e-Khas. Later, visit the City Palace, a stunning fusion of Mughal and Rajasthani architecture, housing courtyards, museums, and the impressive Chandra Mahal, which offers panoramic views of the city. Continue to Jantar Mantar, the largest astronomical observatory in the world, and marvel at its precision-built instruments. Conclude your day at Hawa Mahal, the iconic Palace of Winds, with its 593 small windows designed for royal women to discreetly observe the bustling streets below. Enjoy an overnight stay in Jaipur.

Itinerary.Name: Jaipur to Delhi for Departure
Description: After a leisurely breakfast at your hotel, bid farewell to the vibrant city of Jaipur and embark on your journey back to Delhi. Enjoy the scenic drive as you pass through the picturesque landscapes of Rajasthan. Upon arrival in Delhi, you will be transferred to the airport for your onward flight, marking the end of your enriching and memorable journey through India's cultural and historical wonders. Safe travels!

Itinerary.Name: Arrival in Cochin
Description: Upon arrival in India, you will receive a warm traditional welcome before being transferred to your hotel for an overnight stay. The journey begins in Cochin, often referred to as the ‘Queen of the Arabian Sea,’ which serves as the commercial hub of Kerala. This vibrant city is home to one of the finest natural harbors in the world, making it a historically significant trade center. Cochin was once a bustling hub for trade with the British, Arabs, Chinese, Portuguese, and Dutch. The city's rich history and cultural heritage are beautifully reflected in its architecture and overall ambiance, offering visitors a fascinating glimpse into its diverse past and vibrant present.

Itinerary.Name: Cochin City Tour
Description: After breakfast, meet with our representative for a detailed briefing about your tour and to receive your travel documents. Begin your exploration of Cochin by visiting its historical landmarks, each telling a story of the city’s rich past. Start at St. Francis Church, built in 1503 by Portuguese Franciscan friars, which once housed the remains of Vasco da Gama before they were moved to Lisbon. Witness the iconic Chinese Fishing Nets, a legacy introduced by traders from the court of Kublai Khan. Continue to Mattancherry Palace, originally built by the Portuguese in 1557 and later renovated by the Dutch in 1663. Inside, marvel at the vibrant murals depicting scenes from the Ramayana, Mahabharata, and other Hindu epics. In the evening, immerse yourself in Kerala’s cultural heritage with a mesmerizing Kathakali dance performance. Conclude the day with a comfortable overnight stay at your hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Cochin to Munnar
Description: After breakfast, embark on a scenic drive to Munnar, a breathtaking hill station situated 1,600 meters above sea level. Once the favored summer retreat of the British government in South India, Munnar is renowned for its sprawling tea plantations, charming towns, and serene ambiance. The region is also home to the rare Neelakurinji flower, which blooms only once every 12 years, adding a unique charm to the landscape. Adventure seekers will find Anamudi, the highest peak in South India, an ideal spot for trekking. Upon arrival, check into your hotel and enjoy the rest of the day at leisure, soaking in the stunning natural beauty of the hills. Spend a restful night at your hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Munnar
Description: After breakfast, set out to explore the enchanting tea and coffee plantations that define Munnar’s scenic charm. Walk through the lush green estates, breathing in the refreshing aroma of fresh tea leaves while witnessing the meticulous process of tea production. The rolling hills covered in neatly manicured plantations offer a picturesque setting, perfect for relaxation and photography. Engage with local workers to learn about traditional tea-picking methods and the rich history of tea cultivation in the region. The tranquil surroundings and cool mountain air create an ideal atmosphere to unwind and embrace the natural beauty of Munnar. After a day of exploration, return to your hotel for a comfortable overnight stay.

Itinerary.Name: Munnar to Periyar
Description: After breakfast, embark on a scenic drive to Periyar, home to one of India’s most renowned wildlife sanctuaries. The Periyar Tiger Reserve spans 777 square kilometers, with 360 square kilometers of dense forest, providing a safe haven for diverse wildlife, including the majestic wild elephants that roam freely. A key attraction of the reserve is the 26-square-kilometer artificial lake, created by the Mullaperiyar Dam, where a tranquil boat cruise offers an excellent opportunity to spot elephants, sambars, wild boars, and even the elusive tiger. The sanctuary also boasts over 265 species of birds, including hornbills, kingfishers, and cormorants, making it a paradise for bird watchers. Upon arrival, check into your hotel and spend the rest of the day exploring the local market, where you can find spices, handicrafts, and souvenirs. End the day with a restful overnight stay at your hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Periyar Wildlife Exploration
Description: After breakfast, set out for an exciting wildlife safari inside Periyar National Park, where you can witness animals in their natural habitat. As you traverse the dense forests, keep an eye out for wild elephants, deer, Indian bison, and, with luck, even a tiger. The park’s rich biodiversity also includes a variety of bird species, making it a paradise for nature lovers and photographers. Later, embark on a peaceful boat ride on Periyar Lake, offering a closer view of the park’s lush surroundings and the wildlife that frequents the water’s edge. The serene atmosphere and breathtaking scenery make for an unforgettable experience. Conclude the day with a relaxing overnight stay at your hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Periyar to Kumarakom
Description: After breakfast, embark on a scenic drive to Kumarakom, a serene village set along the picturesque Vembanad Lake. Upon arrival, board a traditional houseboat and begin an enchanting cruise through Kerala’s famous backwaters, a vast network of lakes, canals, and estuaries that sustain a unique ecosystem teeming with aquatic life. As you drift through the tranquil waterways, take in the sights of lush paddy fields, swaying coconut palms, and charming villages where local fishermen and artisans engage in age-old traditions like coir-making and fishing. The journey offers a glimpse into Kerala’s rich culture and slow-paced rural life. As evening falls, the boat will anchor at a peaceful location, allowing you to enjoy a relaxing overnight stay on the houseboat, surrounded by the soothing sounds of nature.

Itinerary.Name: Kumarakom to Kovalam
Description: After breakfast, embark on a scenic drive to Kovalam, one of South India’s most stunning and well-known beach destinations. This coastal paradise is famous for its golden sands, swaying coconut palms, and crystal-clear waters. Kovalam boasts three beautiful crescent-shaped beaches, with Lighthouse Beach being the most popular, offering breathtaking views and a lively atmosphere. Upon arrival, check into your hotel and unwind amidst the serene surroundings. The rest of the day is yours to relax by the beach, soak up the sun, or take a refreshing dip in the Arabian Sea. Enjoy the tranquil ambiance as the waves gently lap the shore. End the day with a restful overnight stay at your hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Kovalam
Description: After breakfast, spend the day at your leisure, soaking in the beauty of Kovalam’s pristine beaches. Relax on the soft golden sands, listen to the rhythmic waves, or take a rejuvenating swim in the clear blue waters. For those seeking adventure, optional water activities such as surfing, parasailing, and jet skiing are available, offering an exhilarating experience against the stunning coastal backdrop. You can also explore the charming beachside cafes, indulge in a soothing Ayurvedic massage, or simply enjoy a peaceful stroll along the shore as the sun sets. Unwind and embrace the tranquil vibes of this coastal paradise before returning to your hotel for a restful overnight stay.

Itinerary.Name: Kovalam
Description: Wake up to the soothing sounds of the waves and enjoy another leisurely day in Kovalam, embracing its serene coastal charm. Spend your time unwinding on the golden sands, taking a refreshing dip in the sea, or strolling along the scenic shoreline. If you’re in the mood for exploration, visit nearby attractions such as the iconic Lighthouse Beach, Hawah Beach, or the tranquil Samudra Beach. You can also indulge in a traditional Ayurvedic spa treatment or savor fresh seafood at a beachside café. As the day comes to an end, witness a breathtaking sunset over the Arabian Sea before returning to your hotel for a peaceful overnight stay.

Itinerary.Name: Kovalam to Trivandrum Departure
Description: After a leisurely breakfast, take the time to enjoy your final moments in Kovalam. Whether you choose to relax by the beach, indulge in a soothing Ayurvedic massage, or explore the local markets for last-minute souvenirs, the day is yours to unwind at your own pace. Stroll through the vibrant streets, pick up handcrafted souvenirs, or simply soak in the tranquil coastal atmosphere one last time. At the designated time, you will be transferred to Trivandrum Airport for your onward journey, carrying with you beautiful memories of Kerala’s stunning landscapes, rich culture, and warm hospitality. Safe travels!

Title: Romantic Kerala Tour Package for Couples - Eaze Tours
Description: Explore the beauty of Kerala with our romantic tour package. Enjoy serene backwaters, scenic beaches, and unforgettable experiences with your loved one.
Summary: Unveil the magic of Kerala with our Romantic Kerala Tour Package in India, designed to create unforgettable moments with your loved one amidst serene backwaters, lush landscapes, and tranquil beaches. Whether you're from the USA, UK, or other European countries, Kerala offers the perfect blend of romance and adventure. Ready for more romantic getaways? Explore our Romantic Andaman Tour Package for Couples or indulge in the beauty of sun-kissed shores with our Exotic Beaches in India package. Book your dream vacation today and let love take you on a journey like no other!
Overview: Celebrate your love amidst the serene beauty of Kerala with our Romantic Kerala Tour Package. Known as 'God’s Own Country,' Kerala offers breathtaking landscapes, tranquil backwaters, misty hill stations, and sun-kissed beaches, creating the perfect backdrop for romance. This tour is thoughtfully designed to provide couples with unforgettable moments and memories to cherish forever.
AdditionalInformation:

  • Ideal For: Newlyweds, couples celebrating anniversaries, and romantic getaways.
  • What to Bring: Comfortable clothing, sunscreen, and a camera to capture precious moments.
  • Customization options are available for personalized experiences.

TourCompanion.Description: Knowledgeable guide, private car driver, cultural interpreters

Itinerary.Name: Arrival in Port Blair
Description: Upon arriving in Port Blair in the morning by flight, you will be warmly greeted and escorted to your hotel for check-in. After settling in, set out to explore the historic Cellular Jail, a poignant reminder of India's struggle for independence. This colonial-era prison once housed many freedom fighters, and its preserved structure offers a glimpse into the sacrifices made during British rule. In the evening, witness the mesmerizing Sound and Light Show at the Cellular Jail, where powerful narrations and visual effects bring alive the stories of bravery and resilience. The Hindi show starts at 6:00 pm daily, while English shows are available on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday at 7:15 pm.

Itinerary.Name: Port Blair to Havelock Island
Description: After a delicious breakfast, make your way to the ferry terminal for a picturesque journey to Havelock Island, a stunning gem of the Andaman archipelago. Upon arrival, you will be greeted and transferred to your hotel, where you can unwind and soak in the island’s tranquil ambiance. In the afternoon, visit the renowned Radhanagar Beach, also known as Beach No. 7, celebrated as one of Asia’s most beautiful beaches by Time Magazine. Bask in the golden sunlight, take a leisurely swim in the azure waters, or simply relax amidst the breathtaking scenery. As the day winds down, savor a romantic candlelight dinner by the beach, creating an unforgettable experience under the starlit sky.

Itinerary.Name: Havelock Island
Description: Start your day with a delightful breakfast before setting out on an exciting boat ride to Elephant Beach, a paradise known for its vibrant coral reefs and crystal-clear waters. Upon arrival, witness the mesmerizing underwater world through a glass-bottom boat, offering a glimpse of the diverse marine life without getting wet. For adventure seekers, snorkeling provides an up-close experience with colorful corals and exotic fish in the pristine waters. After the thrilling activities, unwind on the soft sandy shore, soaking in the serene beauty of the beach. Spend the rest of the day at leisure, enjoying the tranquil surroundings before heading back to your hotel for a peaceful evening.

Itinerary.Name: Havelock Island
Description: Wake up to another beautiful day on Havelock Island, where adventure and relaxation await. Today, you have the option to embark on an unforgettable Discover Scuba Diving experience, diving into the crystal-clear waters to explore the mesmerizing marine life and vibrant coral reefs. If you prefer a different thrill, try your hand at sport fishing, an exciting activity that lets you test your skills in the deep waters surrounding the island. Alternatively, continue your snorkeling adventure in exclusive, less-crowded spots, where you can swim alongside exotic fish and admire untouched coral formations. Whether you seek adventure or tranquility, Havelock Island offers a perfect blend of both, ensuring an unforgettable experience.

Itinerary.Name: Havelock Island to Port Blair
Description: After enjoying a leisurely breakfast, bid farewell to the serene beauty of Havelock Island as you proceed to the jetty for your ferry ride back to Port Blair. Relax and take in the stunning ocean views during the journey. Upon arrival, you will be greeted and transferred to your hotel, where you can unwind after your travels. The rest of the day is at your leisure—explore the local markets for souvenirs, take a stroll along the waterfront, or simply relax at your hotel. Enjoy a comfortable overnight stay in Port Blair, preparing for the next leg of your journey.

Itinerary.Name: Port Blair
Description: After breakfast, embark on a half-day excursion to Ross Island, a place steeped in history and once the administrative headquarters of the British in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands. As you step onto the island, you’ll be transported back in time, wandering through the remnants of British-era buildings, including the old church, bakery, and officer’s quarters, now beautifully reclaimed by nature. The island's eerie yet enchanting ruins, covered in creeping roots and vines, tell the tale of a bygone era. Enjoy the scenic beauty, spot deer and peacocks roaming freely, and soak in the island’s peaceful atmosphere before returning to Port Blair. The rest of the day is at leisure, followed by an overnight stay at your hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Port Blair Departure
Description: After a relaxing breakfast, take in the last moments of your stay in the beautiful Andaman Islands. Depending on your flight schedule, you may have some time for last-minute shopping or a short walk along the waterfront. At the designated time, you will be transferred to the airport, where you will board your flight for your onward journey. As you bid farewell to this tropical paradise, carry with you unforgettable memories of pristine beaches, rich history, and breathtaking natural beauty. Safe travels, and we hope to welcome you again for another incredible adventure!

Itinerary.Name: Delhi to Chandigarh
Description: Upon arrival at Delhi airport, meet your designated coach and begin your journey towards Chandigarh, a city known for its modern architecture and well-planned layout. Enjoy the scenic drive as you pass through the picturesque countryside of North India. Chandigarh, designed by the renowned architect Le Corbusier, is often referred to as the 'City Beautiful' due to its clean streets, lush greenery, and well-maintained gardens. Upon arrival, check into your hotel and take some time to relax after your journey. Depending on your arrival time, you may explore the local markets or take a leisurely walk around the city. Enjoy a comfortable overnight stay at your hotel in Chandigarh.

Itinerary.Name: Chandigarh to Manali
Description: After an early breakfast, embark on a scenic drive from Chandigarh to Manali, a breathtaking hill station nestled in the Himalayas. En route, take a refreshing stop at Kullu, known for its stunning valleys, apple orchards, and vibrant handicrafts. Visit the revered Vaishno Mata Mandir, a popular pilgrimage site dedicated to Goddess Vaishno Devi, where devotees seek blessings for prosperity and well-being. Continue your journey through winding mountain roads, picturesque villages, and the majestic Beas River flowing alongside. By evening, arrive in Manali, a paradise for nature lovers and adventure seekers. Check into your hotel and unwind, preparing for the exciting days ahead. Enjoy a comfortable overnight stay in Manali.

Itinerary.Name: Manali to Solang Valley and Back
Description: Begin your day with an exhilarating experience of water rafting in the Beas River, navigating through its thrilling rapids amidst stunning mountain scenery (subject to weather conditions). After this adrenaline-pumping adventure, proceed towards the breathtaking Solang Valley, nestled between Solang Village and Beas Kund. Known for its panoramic views of glaciers, snow-capped peaks, and vast ski slopes, the valley is a haven for adventure lovers. Depending on the season, you can indulge in activities like skiing, paragliding, zorbing, and snowmobiling. Spend time soaking in the serene beauty or enjoying a cable car ride to get a mesmerizing aerial view of the valley. Return to Manali by evening and relax at your hotel for an overnight stay.

Itinerary.Name: Manali to Rohtang Snow Point and Back
Description: Begin your day with a scenic drive towards Rohtang Snow Point, a breathtaking destination renowned for its pristine snow-covered landscapes and panoramic mountain views. Situated 51 km from Manali, Rohtang remains blanketed in snow for most of the year, making it a perfect spot for snow activities. Enjoy free time playing in the snow, building snowmen, or engaging in thrilling activities like sledging, skiing, and snow biking. Important Note: Rohtang Pass access is subject to government and Border Security Force (BSF) permissions. If travel to Rohtang Pass is restricted, you will visit the designated snow point along the route where activities are permitted. After an exciting day in the snow, return to Manali by evening and relax at your hotel for an overnight stay.

Itinerary.Name: Manali Sightseeing
Description: Start your day with a visit to Jagatsukh Gayatri Mandir, followed by the Vashisht Kund, known for its natural hot water springs. Next, explore the Hidimba Devi Temple, an ancient wooden shrine set amidst tall cedar forests. After the temple visits, spend your afternoon strolling through Mall Road, shopping for souvenirs, woolens, and local handicrafts. You can also indulge in adventure activities or relax at a cozy café. As the evening sets in, enjoy a delightful get-together with your travel companions, sharing stories and experiences over music and refreshments. This day perfectly balances spirituality, exploration, and relaxation, making your Manali trip unforgettable. Overnight stay in Manali.

Itinerary.Name: Manali to Chandigarh
Description: After breakfast, begin your journey back to Chandigarh, passing through the scenic Kullu Valley, known for its breathtaking landscapes and lush greenery. En route, visit a Shawl Factory in Kullu, where you can witness the intricate craftsmanship of traditional Himachali woolens and shop for souvenirs. Enjoy the picturesque drive along the Beas River, soaking in the serene mountain views. By evening, arrive in Chandigarh and check into your hotel. The rest of the evening is free for relaxation or an optional visit to local markets for shopping. This marks the end of a memorable journey through the Himalayan wonders. Overnight stay in Chandigarh.

Itinerary.Name: Chandigarh to Delhi and Departure
Description: After an early breakfast, embark on your journey back to Delhi, enjoying the comfortable drive through the well-connected highway. Upon arrival in Delhi, proceed to the airport for your onward flight back home, marking the end of a wonderful trip filled with cherished memories. Take with you the unforgettable experiences of the scenic Himalayan landscapes, adventure activities, and cultural explorations from the past few days. Bid farewell to your fellow travelers as your tour concludes. Safe travels!

Title: Manali Tour Package | Kullu Manali Holiday & Himalayan Tour
Description: Book your Manali tour package with EazeTours. Enjoy a romantic Manali honeymoon, Kullu adventures & Himalayan tour experiences in one perfect getaway.
Summary: Ready to explore the breathtaking beauty of Manali with our exotic Manali sightseeing tour package? Itinerary.Name: Bangalore (Monday)
Description: The Golden Chariot tour offers two distinct itineraries for guests. The first itinerary begins with a check-in at Taj West End at 3:00 pm, followed by high tea at the Banquet Hall. A presentation on tour guidelines, safety, and security is scheduled before a visit to Chitrakala Parishad or an art gallery. Guests then enjoy a cultural show before proceeding to Yeshwantpur Railway Station for a traditional Indian welcome. Dinner is served onboard The Golden Chariot as the train departs for Mysore at 9:00 pm. The alternate itinerary starts with an 11:00 am check-in at Our Native Village, a 100% eco-friendly resort. After lunch, guests explore the resort, enjoy an herbal and organic farm tour, and participate in a pottery session, village games, and bullock cart rides. The day concludes with a short rest before departing for Yeshwantpur Railway Station. This alternative is available for those opting out of the Bangalore sightseeing tour.

Itinerary.Name: Mysore / Kabini / Bandipur (Tuesday)
Description: On Day 2, guests depart for Kabini/Bandipur at 10:00 am after breakfast, arriving at Jungle Lodge by 1:00 pm for lunch. The afternoon is dedicated to an exciting Jungle Safari or Boat Safari, followed by an evening wildlife film screening, with dinner and an overnight stay at the lodge. Alternatively, guests can visit Ranganathittu Bird Sanctuary and Mysore Zoo, enjoy lunch onboard, and explore the Brindavan Gardens before heading to Kabini, a renowned wildlife haven. The Rajiv Gandhi National Park (Nagarhole/Kabini) offers thrilling safaris with sightings of elephants, gaur, sambar, tigers, leopards, and over 300 bird species, making it a paradise for nature lovers.

Itinerary.Name: Mysore (Wednesday)
Description: On Day 3, the journey begins with breakfast onboard at 8:30 am, followed by a return to The Golden Chariot at 11:30 am. Guests enjoy lunch onboard at 1:00 pm before heading out for Mysore sightseeing at 3:00 pm, exploring the grand Mysore Palace and the historic town of Srirangapatnam. The evening unfolds at Lalitha Mahal Palace, where guests experience a mesmerizing cultural show, followed by a lavish dinner. By 10:00 pm, everyone returns onboard The Golden Chariot, ready for the next leg of the adventure. Mysore: A Royal Legacy Mysore is known for its royal heritage, splendid palaces, and majestic buildings. It is also famous for its music, dance, arts, and crafts. The Mysore Palace, built in Indo-Saracenic style, is a treasure trove of art and architecture. Visit Srirangapatnam, Tipu Sultan’s fortress, which houses important historical sites like the mosque and the dungeons were British officers were held captive.

Itinerary.Name: Hassan (Thursday)
Description: Day 4 begins with an early morning departure from Mysore to Hassan at 6:00 am, arriving by 8:15 am. At 9:00 am, guests set out for Shravanabelagola, home to the towering Gommateshwara statue, requiring a 700-step climb (palanquins are available for convenience). After returning, lunch is served onboard at 1:00 pm. The afternoon is dedicated to exploring the magnificent Belur and Halebid temples, known for their intricate Hoysala architecture. By 7:15 pm, guests return to The Golden Chariot, which departs for Hospet at 7:45 pm. Dinner is served onboard as the journey continues.Belur & Halebid: A World of Worship Belur is famous for its stunning Hoysala Temple Complex, including the Chennakesava Temple, which showcases intricate sculptures. Halebid, once the capital of the Hoysala dynasty, is home to the beautiful Hoysaleswara Temple. Shravanabelagola features Asia’s largest monolithic statue of Lord Gomateswara, standing 58 feet tall.

Itinerary.Name: Hospet (Friday)
Description: Day 5 begins with arrival in Hospet at 6:00 am, followed by breakfast at 8:30 am before departing for a Hampi sightseeing tour. Guests explore the Virupaksha Temple, Queen’s Bath, Elephant Stables, and the Local Crafts Bazaar, immersing themselves in the grandeur of this UNESCO World Heritage Site. At 1:00 pm, lunch is served onboard The Golden Chariot before the journey continues at 3:00 pm with visits to the Royal Enclosure, Hazara Rama Temple, and the beautifully illuminated Vittala Temple, known for its iconic stone chariot and musical pillars. The day concludes at 8:00 pm with dinner onboard, preparing guests for the next adventure. Hampi: A World Heritage Site Hampi, once the capital of the Vijayanagara Empire, is a UNESCO World Heritage site. The ruins, scattered across 26 square kilometers, tell tales of grandeur and glory. Explore the temples and palaces, including the Vittala Temple, which features an impressive stone chariot.

Itinerary.Name: Badami (Saturday)
Description: Day 6 begins with an early 5:00 am departure from Hospet to Badami, arriving around 8:30 am. After breakfast at 9:00 am, guests explore the stunning Badami Caves and the UNESCO-listed Pattadakal temple complex, known for its exquisite Chalukyan architecture. By 1:30 pm, guests return onboard The Golden Chariot for lunch before the train departs for Goa at 2:00 pm. The afternoon is reserved for relaxation, with access to spa and gym facilities onboard. Dinner is served as the journey continues, with the train reaching Goa post-midnight, preparing for the final leg of this luxurious adventure. Badami: A World Heritage Site Badami, with its stunning rock-cut temples and caves, offers a glimpse into India’s rich history. Pattadakal, known for its Chalukyan architecture, is another UNESCO World Heritage site and a testament to the region’s cultural richness.

Itinerary.Name: Goa (Sunday)
Description: On the final day, guests enjoy breakfast onboard at 9:30 am before departing for Goa sightseeing at 10:00 am. The tour begins with a visit to the historic churches of Old Goa at 11:00 am, followed by a stop at the charming Sola Souto Maior Portuguese house at 12:15 pm for tea, coffee, and shopping. Lunch is served at the Majorda Beach Resort at 2:00 pm, after which guests can unwind with an Ayurvedic massage, a casino visit, or a relaxing time at the pool and beach (extra charges apply). By 6:00 pm, the group departs from the resort, returning to The Golden Chariot for dinner at 7:15 pm. At 9:00 pm, the train departs for Bangalore, marking the conclusion of this luxurious journey. Goa: A World of Golden Beaches Goa is known for its beautiful beaches, colonial architecture, and relaxed pace of life. With its rich history, stunning landscapes, and vibrant culture, Goa is more than just a beach destination.

Itinerary.Name: Bangalore (Monday)
Description: On the final morning, guests enjoy a leisurely breakfast onboard from 8:00 am to 9:30 am, reflecting on their incredible journey. At 11:00 am, The Golden Chariot arrives at Yeshwantpur Railway Station, where the entire crew bids a warm farewell, marking the end of an unforgettable luxury rail experience.

Itinerary.Name: Sunday, Departure at 16:30 PM Delhi
Description: Embark on a luxurious journey aboard the Royal Rajasthan on Wheels for a seven-day exploration through the vibrant state of Rajasthan. The adventure begins in New Delhi, where your royal journey commences, taking you through the magnificent former princely states of India. Upon your arrival at Safdarjung Station, you will be welcomed with a traditional greeting, including a ceremonial aarti, tika, garlanding, and refreshing mocktails. After check-in, you will be escorted to your private cabin. Experience the true essence of royal life aboard a moving palace, where luxury and tradition are seamlessly combined.

Itinerary.Name: Monday, Arrival at 09:15 AM, Breakfast onboard | Departure at 17:10 PM Jodhpur
Description: The second-largest city in Rajasthan, Jodhpur, is renowned for its magnificent Mehrangarh Fort, which stands as a symbol of Rajput glory. Another highlight is Jaswant Thada, a marble cenotaph built in 1899. Enjoy lunch at a hotel, and in the evening, return to the train for dinner onboard.

Itinerary.Name: Tuesday, Arrival at 08:00 AM, Breakfast onboard | Departure at 14:30 PM Udaipur
Description: The day begins in Udaipur, the 'Venice of the East,' where you’ll explore the breathtaking City Palace and the exquisite Crystal Gallery. After lunch, the journey continues to Chittorgarh, home to the legendary Chittorgarh Fort. Witness the tales of bravery at the Vijay Stambh and Gaumukh Reservoir, and cap off the evening with a captivating light and sound show followed by a cultural performance and dinner.

Itinerary.Name: Tuesday, Arrival at 16:45 PM | Departure at 22:00 PM Chittorgarh
Description: Start your day with a thrilling safari at Ranthambore National Park, where you might spot the majestic Bengal tiger. Visit the Amareshwar Mohadeo Temple before heading to Jaipur, the 'Pink City.' Here, you’ll be greeted by caparisoned elephants and the melodious sounds of the Shehnai. Explore the Hawa Mahal, enjoy an elephant ride at Amber Fort, and delve into history at the City Palace. The day concludes with a cultural program and dinner.

Itinerary.Name: Thursday, Arrival at 11:00 AM, Breakfast onboard | Departure at 18:30 PM Khajuraho
Description: The Khajuraho Temples, built between the 9th and 12th centuries, are famous for their intricate sculptures depicting passion, eroticism, dance, music, and other aspects of Indian culture. Located in Madhya Pradesh, these temples are masterpieces of architecture and artistry, with only 20 of them surviving the test of time. Visit the temples and museum, and enjoy lunch at a hotel and dinner onboard.

Itinerary.Name: Friday, Arrival at 06:00 AM | Departure at 18:00 PM Varanasi
Description: The spiritual capital of India, Varanasi, is over 3,000 years old and is famous for its temples and sacred ghats along the Ganges River. Visit the Jyotirlinga Visvanatha Temple (Golden Temple) and the Jnana Vapi well. Experience the vibrant Maha Aarti ceremony at the ghats and visit the Buddhist temples at Sarnath. After a hotel lunch, return for dinner onboard.

Itinerary.Name: Saturday, Arrival at 05:00 AM, Breakfast onboard | Departure at 23:00 PM Agra
Description: Famous for the iconic Taj Mahal and the historic Agra Fort, Agra is a must-visit destination for any traveler. The city is also known for its rich culture and craftsmanship, including marble inlay work, leather goods, footwear, and brassware. After a visit to the Taj Mahal and other attractions, enjoy lunch at a hotel and dinner onboard.

Itinerary.Name: Sunday, Arrival at 07:00 AM, Breakfast onboard, Check-out at 07:45 AM Delhi
Description: Your unforgettable royal adventure draws to a close as you return to the vibrant city of Delhi. After enjoying a final breakfast onboard, complete the check-out process and bid a heartfelt farewell to the magical journey through Rajasthan’s timeless landscapes, majestic palaces, and rich regal heritage.

TourCompanion.Name: EazeTours Cultural Escorts
TourCompanion.Description: Expert guides for each city, onboard train hospitality, multilingual support

Itinerary.Name: Wednesday – New Delhi
Description: The journey begins at Delhi Safdarjung Railway Station, where guests receive a traditional Indian welcome before boarding the luxurious Palace on Wheels for an unforgettable week-long tour through Rajasthan. The grand experience starts with a reporting time of 18:00 hrs, followed by the train’s departure at 18:30 hrs, setting the stage for a regal adventure through India’s royal heritage.

Itinerary.Name: Thursday – Jaipur
Description: The journey’s first stop is Jaipur, the Pink City and capital of Rajasthan, founded by Maharaja Sawai Jai Singh II in 1727 A.D.. Guests arrive at 3:45 hrs and embark on a guided tour, beginning with the iconic Hawa Mahal (Palace of Winds), known for its intricate honeycombed windows. The tour continues to the Amber Fort, where a majestic elephant ride takes visitors up the hill to explore its grand architecture. After a lavish lunch at a five-star hotel, guests visit the City Palace Museum and the Jantar Mantar Observatory, an astronomical marvel. The train departs for its next destination at 20:00 hrs, concluding a day filled with royal splendor.

Itinerary.Name: Friday – Sawai Madhopur
Description: Arriving in Sawai Madhopur at 05:30 hrs, guests embark on an early morning safari at Ranthambore National Park, renowned for its 10th-century fort ruins and as one of the best places in India to spot tigers in the wild. The park, spanning 392 sq. km, is home to diverse wildlife, including hyenas, jackals, and over 300 bird species. After exploring the region’s local handicrafts, ethnic ornaments, and traditional costumes, the journey continues to Chittorgarh, with an arrival at 16:00 hrs. The afternoon is dedicated to exploring the legendary Chittorgarh Fort, a symbol of Rajput valor and sacrifice. As night falls, guests enjoy a mesmerizing view of the illuminated fort and cultural performances, before the train departs at 02:00 hrs (next day, Saturday) for the next royal destination.

Itinerary.Name: Saturday – Udaipur
Description: Arriving in Udaipur at 08:00 hrs, the Palace on Wheels brings guests to the enchanting Lake City, founded in 1559 A.D. by Maharana Udai Singh of the Mewar dynasty. Udaipur’s charm lies in its majestic marble palaces, especially the Jag Niwas (Lake Palace) and Jag Mandir, which appear as floating castles on Lake Pichola. After a luxurious lunch at a five-star hotel, guests explore the City Palace, an architectural masterpiece that showcases the grandeur of Rajasthan’s royal heritage. The train departs at 15:30 hrs, leaving behind the mesmerizing beauty of Udaipur as the journey continues.

Itinerary.Name: Sunday – Jaisalmer
Description: Arriving in Jaisalmer at 09:15 hrs, guests step into the heart of the Thar Desert, where the majestic Yellow Sandstone Fort, founded by Rawal Jaisal in 1156 A.D., dominates the skyline. The journey continues with visits to the intricately carved havelis, including Nathmalji-ki-Haveli, Patwon-ki-Haveli, and Salim Singh-ki-Haveli, each a masterpiece of Rajasthani craftsmanship. Guests can explore vibrant local markets, offering pattu shawls, mirror work, embroidered textiles, wooden trinkets, and silver jewelry. After lunch onboard, an exhilarating camel ride on the golden dunes of Sam awaits, accompanied by refreshing tea amidst the desert landscape. As night falls, a grand cultural performance and dinner at a five-star hotel bring the magical Jaisalmer experience to a close before the train departs at 23:30 hrs.

Itinerary.Name: Monday – Jodhpur
Description: Arriving in Jodhpur at 07:00 hrs, guests are welcomed to the Blue City, surrounded by a high stone wall with seven gates. The journey begins with a visit to the Mehrangarh Fort, an architectural marvel founded in 1459 A.D. by Rao Jodha, housing grand palaces like Moti Mahal, Sheesh Mahal, Phool Mahal, and Sileh Khana. Nearby, the elegant Jaswant Thada, a white marble cenotaph, offers a serene retreat. After a royal lunch at a palace hotel, guests can explore the city's vibrant markets, renowned for embroidered shoes, metal curios, silverware, paintings, and tie-dye fabrics. As the day concludes, the Palace on Wheels departs at 16:30 hrs, leaving behind the grandeur of Jodhpur.

Itinerary.Name: Tuesday – Bharatpur / Agra
Description: On Day 07, the journey begins with an early morning arrival in Bharatpur at 05:00 hrs, where guests explore the Keoladeo Ghana National Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site famous for its rich birdlife, including Siberian Cranes, Egrets, and numerous migratory species. After departing at 08:45 hrs, the train reaches Agra at 10:00 hrs, where guests visit the Agra Fort, a stunning Mughal-era fortress. Following a royal lunch, the highlight of the day awaits—an awe-inspiring visit to the Taj Mahal, the timeless symbol of love, built by Emperor Shah Jahan for Mumtaz Mahal. Guests can also explore Agra’s exquisite marble inlay work, leather goods, and jewelry before departing at 19:30 hrs, marking the grand conclusion of an unforgettable journey.

Itinerary.Name: Wednesday – New Delhi
Description: On Day 08, the Palace-on-Wheels returns to Delhi Safdarjung Railway Station at 07:30 hrs, marking the conclusion of an unforgettable journey through Rajasthan’s rich heritage. Guests enjoy a final breakfast onboard, reflecting on the breathtaking experiences, royal hospitality, and cultural treasures explored over the past week before bidding farewell to this luxurious expedition.

TourCompanion.Description: Onboard concierge, multilingual guides, and heritage experts

Itinerary.Name: Arrive in Delhi (Normal check-in time at the hotel is 14:00 hrs)
Description: Upon arrival at Indira Gandhi International Airport, you will be warmly welcomed by our representative, who will assist you at the arrival lounge while holding a placard. You will then be transferred to your hotel for check-in and relaxation. Later, explore Delhi, a city where ancient history and modern vibrancy coexist. Discover its architectural marvels, shaped by various dynasties, and learn about its 5,000-year-old legacy as both a metropolis and a necropolis. Enjoy the bustling streets, vibrant markets, and rich culture of India's capital. After a fulfilling day of sightseeing, return to your hotel for a comfortable overnight stay in Delhi.

Itinerary.Name: Delhi – Gorakhpur (Flight) – Kushinagar (60 Kms / 2 Hrs Approx)
Description: In the morning, transfer to the airport for your flight to Gorakhpur. You will board Indigo flight 6E-2334, departing from Delhi at 10:20 AM and arriving in Gorakhpur at 11:45 AM in economy class. Upon arrival, you will be transferred to Kushinagar, a journey of approximately two hours by road. After reaching Kushinagar, check in to your hotel and take some time to relax. Later, explore Kushinagar, one of the four holiest Buddhist pilgrimage sites, where Lord Buddha delivered his last sermon and attained Mahaparinirvana. Visit significant landmarks such as the Mahaparinirvana Temple, Ramabhar Stupa, and Wat Thai Temple. After a spiritually enriching day, return to the hotel for an overnight stay in Kushinagar.

Itinerary.Name: Kushinagar – Vaishali – Patna (350 km / 6 hrs Approx.)
Description: After enjoying breakfast at the hotel in Kushinagar, embark on a scenic drive to Vaishali, a historically significant Buddhist site that Siddhartha Gautama visited multiple times. Upon arrival, explore the Mahavana Forest, a tranquil retreat that once served as a meditation haven for Buddhist monks and ascetics. Continue your journey to Gosingalasāla, another serene forested area known for its deep spiritual ambiance, making it an ideal place for meditation and reflection. After immersing yourself in the peaceful surroundings of Vaishali, proceed towards Patna. Upon arrival, check in at the hotel and unwind after the long journey. Enjoy a restful overnight stay in Patna, preparing for the explorations ahead.

Itinerary.Name: Patna – Nalanda – Rajgir – Bodhgaya
Description: Begin the day with an early morning drive from Patna to Bodhgaya, passing through the historically rich sites of Nalanda and Rajgir. First, visit Nalanda, the ancient hub of Buddhist learning, renowned for the prestigious Nalanda University, which once attracted scholars from across the world. Continue the journey to Vulture’s Peak, a sacred site where Lord Buddha delivered the profound Prajnaparamita (Heart Sutra) teachings. Next, explore Rajgir, a spiritually significant location where Buddha spent several years meditating and preaching. Experience the breathtaking ropeway ride to Shanti Stupa and visit the surrounding monasteries. By evening, arrive in Bodhgaya, check in at the hotel, and unwind. Enjoy a peaceful overnight stay in Bodhgaya.

Itinerary.Name: Explore Bodhgaya – The Land of Enlightenment
Description: Spend the day exploring the sacred sites of Bodhgaya, the place where Siddhartha attained enlightenment under the revered Bodhi Tree after three days of deep meditation. Walk along the serene banks of the Falgu River, where Buddha meditated before his awakening. Discover the seven sacred spots where he spent seven weeks in deep contemplation, reflecting on his enlightenment. Visit various Buddhist temples and monasteries, each showcasing unique architectural and spiritual traditions from around the world. Experience the profound spiritual energy that makes Bodhgaya a key pilgrimage destination for Buddhists. As the day concludes, relax and reflect on the experience with an overnight stay in Bodhgaya.

Itinerary.Name: Bodhgaya to Varanasi (300 km / 6 hrs)
Description: Start the day with an early morning drive from Bodhgaya to Varanasi, covering 300 km in about six hours. Upon arrival, check in at the hotel and relax before heading to Sarnath, where Buddha delivered his first sermon. Visit Chowkandi and Dhamek Stupas, explore ancient monastery ruins, and see the Mahabodhi Society Temple and Tibetan Temple. Stop by the Sarnath Museum (closed on Fridays) to view Buddhist relics. In the evening, witness the grand Ganga Aarti at Dashashwamedh Ghat, an enchanting ceremony of fire, chants, and devotion. Interact with sadhus, capture stunning photographs, and immerse yourself in the spiritual ambiance. End the day with an overnight stay in Varanasi.

Itinerary.Name: Explore Varanasi
Description: Begin the day with a peaceful boat ride at dawn on the sacred Ganges River, witnessing the mesmerizing sunrise as pilgrims perform their morning prayers. Glide past the bathing ghats and the revered burning ghats, where Hindus conduct cremation rituals with deep spiritual significance. Visit Banaras Hindu University, founded in 1916, and explore the Bharat Kala Bhavan Museum, renowned for its Mughal miniature paintings and brocade textiles. Discover the Bharat Mata Temple and Durga Temple, reflecting India’s rich cultural heritage. Conclude with a visit to the famous Vishwanath Temple, dedicated to Lord Shiva, with its iconic golden spires. End the spiritually enriching day with an overnight stay in Varanasi.

Itinerary.Name: Varanasi – Delhi – Departure
Description: On the final day, begin with a leisurely breakfast at the hotel in Varanasi, reflecting on the spiritual journey through India's sacred sites. After breakfast, proceed to the airport for your flight to Delhi. Upon arrival in Delhi, seamlessly connect to your international flight for your onward journey, carrying with you unforgettable memories of this enriching exploration of Buddhist heritage and India's timeless cultural legacy. Safe travels!

TourCompanion.Name: Buddhist Heritage Guide Team
TourCompanion.Description: Expert local guides, multilingual narrators, heritage scholars

Itinerary.Name: Delhi-Rishikesh (230 kilometers/ 06-07 hours)
Description: Upon arrival in Delhi, our tour representative will assist you with a smooth transfer to Rishikesh by road. Enjoy the scenic journey as you approach this spiritual town. Upon arrival, check in at the hotel and relax. The evening is free for leisure, allowing you to explore nearby areas or attend a briefing session about the trip. Enjoy a delicious dinner at the hotel and have a comfortable overnight stay, preparing for the exciting experiences awaiting you in Rishikesh.Rishikesh The birthplace of Yoga, Rishikesh is located 24 kilometers away from HarIdwar. It is a place where pilgrims come to meditate, do yoga and learn about other aspects of Hinduism. There are many ancient and newly built temples along the river Ganges. The whole town is consIdered to be sacred and it is saId that meditation here leads to salvation.

Itinerary.Name: Rishikesh – Barkot (170 kms / 07-08 hrs)
Description: After a delicious morning breakfast, set out for a local sightseeing tour of Rishikesh, visiting iconic landmarks such as Ram Jhula, Laxman Jhula, and Swarg Ashram. These sacred sites offer breathtaking views of the Ganges River and a serene spiritual atmosphere. Later, embark on a scenic drive to Barkot via Mussoorie, stopping at the famous Kempty Falls to enjoy its refreshing waters. By late evening, arrive in Barkot, check in at the hotel, and unwind. Conclude the day with a hearty dinner and an overnight stay, preparing for the next day's spiritual journey.

Itinerary.Name: Barkot – Jankichatti – Yamunotri – Barkot (50 kms & 6 kms. Trek)
Description: After a hearty breakfast, embark on a journey to Yamunotri, the sacred source of the Yamuna River. Drive to Jankichatti, the base point for the trek. From here, enjoy a scenic 6 km trek to Yamunotri, where pilgrims cook rice by dipping it in the hot water of Surya Kund, taking it home as Prasad. After a holy dip in Jamunabai Kund, perform Pooja at Divya Shila and seek blessings at Yamunotri Temple. Later, trek back to Jankichatti and drive to Barkot. Conclude the day with dinner and an overnight stay at the hotel. Yamunotri: Nestled in the Garhwal Himalayas at an altitude of 3,293 meters, Yamunotri is the sacred source of the Yamuna River and a revered pilgrimage site. The river originates from the Champasar Glacier, located 1 km ahead of the shrine. According to legend, the great sage Asit Muni once resided here. Yamuna, the daughter of the Sun God (Surya) and sister of Yama (God of Death), is worshipped for spiritual purification. The Surya Kund, a hot water spring, is known for its healing properties, while Divya Shila, a sacred rock, is worshipped before entering the temple.

Itinerary.Name: Barkot- Harsil (170 kilometers)
Description: Post breakfast, leave by road for Uttarkashi. Later, drive to Harsil.
The evening is free for leisure and local attractions.
Dinner and overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Harsil – Gangotri – Uttarkashi (20 Kms & 90 Kms)
Description: After breakfast, take a road trip to Gangotri. After praying at the temple, have Pooja & Darshan at Gangotri temple.
Later, return back to Uttarkashi. Dinner and overnight stay at Uttarkashi.

Gangotri: Located in the 18th century, Gangotri is dedicated to Hindu goddess ‘Ganga’. It is located near a sacred stone where Bhagirath worshipped Lord Shiva and asked to hold Ganga in his matted locks. The temple is a beautiful 20 feet high structure made up of white granite. This is the perfect place to reconnect with you. The Gangotri temple dedicated to the goddess remains open from May to November.

Itinerary.Name: Uttarkashi – Guptkashi (235 Kms. Drive 08 – 09 Hrs)
Description: After breakfast, embark on a scenic road journey to Guptkashi, a sacred town nestled in the Garhwal Himalayas. En route, witness the heritage city of Tehri, which now lies submerged under the vast waters of the holy Ganges due to the construction of the Tehri Dam. The journey offers breathtaking views of lush valleys, towering peaks, and serene rivers. By evening, arrive in Guptkashi, known for its ancient Vishwanath Temple and spiritual significance. Check in at the hotel, enjoy a hearty dinner, and relax for an overnight stay. Guptkashi: Located in the northern Himalayan belt within the Mandakini river valley, which houses lush green forests, Guptkashi is famous for the Vishwanath temple- dedicated to Lord Shiva.

Itinerary.Name: Guptkashi – Kedarnath – Rudraprayag(35 Kms /2 Hrs.)
Description: After breakfast, proceed to the helipad as per the designated reporting time. Complete the boarding formalities and wait for your turn. Upon arrival in Kedarnath, one of the holiest Hindu pilgrimage sites, offer prayers and perform Pooja & Darshan at the sacred Kedarnath Temple, dedicated to Lord Shiva. After seeking blessings, return to the helipad and take a flight back to Guptkashi, from where you’ll drive towards Rudraprayag. Upon arrival, check in at the hotel, relax, and enjoy a peaceful dinner. Overnight stay at the hotel in Rudraprayag. Kedarnath Temple Built in the 8th century A.D. by Adi Guru Shankaracharya, the Kedarnath Temple is located adjacent to the site of an ancient temple built by Pandavas. As the name suggests, the temple is dedicated to the shrine of Kedar. Kedarnath is one of the four holy places that cover the famous Char Dham Yatra. It is believed to be one of the 12 Jyotirlingas of Lord Shiva. The temple is believed to be over 1000 years old.

Itinerary.Name: Rudraprayag – Badrinath (125 kms Drive/ 5 Hrs)
Description: After an early breakfast, embark on a scenic road journey to Badrinath, one of the most revered Char Dham pilgrimage sites. En route, visit Narsingh Temple and Adi Shankaracharya Samadhi at Joshimath, significant religious and historical sites. Upon reaching Badrinath, perform Pooja & Darshan at the Badrinath Temple, dedicated to Lord Vishnu. Explore nearby attractions like Vyas Cave, Ganesh Cave, Bhim Bridge, and the origin of River Saraswati at Mana Village, the last Indian village before the Tibetan border. In the evening, attend the divine Aarti at the temple. Dinner and overnight stay at the hotel. Badrinath Temple: Badrinath, one of the holiest temples in Uttarakhand, is nestled between the twin mountain ranges Nar and Narayan. Also known as Badrinarayan Temple, it is dedicated to Lord Vishnu in his Badrinarayan form. Originally built by Adi Shankaracharya in the 8th century, the temple was later reconstructed by the Garhwal kings in the 17th century after being destroyed by a landslide. Significant nearby sites include Narad Kund, where Adi Shankaracharya recovered Lord Vishnu’s idol, Brahma Kapal, a ritual site on the Alaknanda River, Sheshnetra, a rock marking Lord Vishnu’s serpent, and Mana Village, India’s last village. Other attractions include Bhim Pul, a natural bridge over the Saraswati River, and Vyas Gufa, where Ved Vyas composed the Mahabharata.

Itinerary.Name: Badrinath – Srinagar (190 kms / 07-08hrs)
Description: After attending the Maha Abhishek ceremony in the morning, proceed for Pooja and Darshan at the Badrinath Temple. Post breakfast, embark on a scenic road trip to Srinagar, Uttarakhand. Along the way, visit the four sacred confluences of the Panch Prayag—Vishnuprayag, Nandprayag, Karnprayag, and Rudraprayag—where important rivers merge with the Alaknanda River. Enjoy the breathtaking landscapes of the Garhwal Himalayas during the journey. By evening, arrive in Srinagar, check in at the hotel, and relax. Dinner and an overnight stay at the hotel in Srinagar.

Itinerary.Name: Srinagar – Haridwar (125 kms / 05 -06hrs)
Description: After breakfast, embark on a road journey to Haridwar. En route, visit Devprayag, the sacred confluence where the Alaknanda and Bhagirathi rivers merge to form the holy Ganges. Upon arrival in Haridwar in the afternoon, check into the hotel and relax. Later, visit the renowned Mansa Devi and Chandi Devi Temples, which are perched atop hills and offer stunning views of the city. In the evening, witness the divine Ganga Aarti at Har Ki Pauri, a mesmerizing spiritual experience. Dinner and overnight stay at the hotel in Haridwar. Haridwar Located at the feet of Shiva’s hills ‘Shivaliks’, HarIdwar is located in the HarIdwar district of Uttarakhand. It is one of the 7 holiest Hindu cities in India. Apart from being a famous tourist destination in India, HarIdwar is also famous among the people as being the location of Kumbh Mela. The lighted diyas floating on the river Ganges creates a spectacular sight. The town is dotted with innumerable temples and other religious places.

Itinerary.Name: HarIdwar – Delhi (200 kms / 06- 07 hrs)
Description: After breakfast, depart for Delhi by road, covering approximately 200 kilometers in 6–7 hours. Enjoy the scenic drive as you leave the spiritual aura of Haridwar behind. Upon arrival in Delhi, you will be dropped off at the railway station or airport for your onward journey, marking the end of a memorable pilgrimage
