Itinerary.Name: Arrive in Delhi (Check-in at 12:00 PM)
Description: Upon arrival at Indira Gandhi International Airport in Delhi, you will be greeted by our representative and transferred to your hotel for check-in at 12:00 PM. In the afternoon, begin a sightseeing tour of Old Delhi, starting with a visit to the grand Jama Masjid, followed by a drive past the historic Red Fort and a stop at Raj Ghat, the cremation site of Mahatma Gandhi. Enjoy a rickshaw ride through the bustling streets of Old Delhi before visiting Gurudwara Shri Bangla Sahib, a revered Sikh temple associated with Guru Hari Krishan. Conclude the day with an overnight stay in Delhi.

Itinerary.Name: Delhi – Amritsar (Train)
Description: After breakfast, you will be transferred to the railway station to board the Swarna Shatabdi Express (Train No. 12029), departing Delhi at 07:20 AM and arriving in Amritsar at 1:35 PM in AC chair car class. Upon arrival, you will be greeted by our representative and transferred to your hotel. Amritsar, a city rich in Sikh heritage, is home to the stunning Golden Temple, the spiritual center of Sikhism. The temple’s golden domes and serene waters create a peaceful atmosphere. In the evening, visit the Golden Temple for a soul-stirring experience. Enjoy an overnight stay in Amritsar.

Itinerary.Name: Amritsar
Description: After breakfast, embark on a full day of sightseeing in Amritsar, beginning with a visit to the Golden Temple, the revered spiritual center of Sikhism founded by Guru Arjan in the late 16th century. Explore the Akal Takht, the highest political institution of the Sikhs, located within the temple complex. Next, visit Jallianwala Bagh, a solemn memorial to the 1919 massacre that marked a turning point in India’s struggle for independence. In the evening, head to the Wagah Border to witness the dramatic and patriotic Border Retreat Ceremony between India and Pakistan. Enjoy an overnight stay in Amritsar.

Itinerary.Name: Amritsar – Dharamshala (195 km / Approx. 4 hours drive)
Description: After breakfast, embark on a scenic drive to Dharamshala, located approximately 195 kilometers from Amritsar, a journey of about four hours. Nestled on the slopes of the majestic Dhauladhar range, Dharamshala rises from an altitude of 1250 meters to 2000 meters, offering breathtaking views of snow-capped peaks and lush green landscapes. The serene atmosphere and natural beauty of the region make it a perfect retreat in the Himalayas. Upon arrival, check in to your hotel and enjoy the rest of the day at leisure. Overnight stay in Dharamshala.

Itinerary.Name: Dharamshala
Description: After breakfast, set out to explore McLeod Ganj, a charming suburb of Dharamshala often called 'Little Lhasa' due to its significance as the residence of the Dalai Lama and the headquarters of the Tibetan Government in Exile. Visit the Namgyal Monastery, an important center for Buddhist learning and monks’ training, and take a walk through the Tibetan Village School to gain insight into the local education system and community life. As you stroll through this tranquil settlement, immerse yourself in the rich culture, history, and spiritual atmosphere of the Tibetan people. Enjoy an overnight stay in Dharamshala.

Itinerary.Name: Dharamshala – Shimla (239 km / Approx. 5 hours drive)
Description: After breakfast, drive to Shimla, a journey of approximately 239 kilometers taking around five hours. Upon arrival, check into your hotel and set out to explore some of Shimla’s iconic landmarks, including the historic Shimla Mosque built in 1830, the grand ViceRegal Lodge, the neo-Gothic Christ Church dating back to 1844, the Gaiety Theatre, Scandal Point, and the revered Kaali Baari and Jakhoo Temples. Soak in the colonial charm and cultural richness of this hill station. In the evening, enjoy leisure time shopping along the vibrant Mall Road. Overnight stay in Shimla.

Itinerary.Name: Shimla – Kufri – Shimla
Description: After breakfast, enjoy an excursion to Kufri, a charming hill station located near Shimla, known for its scenic beauty and adventure activities. Visit the Himalayan National Park, home to a variety of native flora and fauna, and enjoy a pony or yak ride while taking in stunning panoramic views of the surrounding Himalayan range. Optionally, visit Chail, famous for having the world’s highest cricket ground, set amidst tranquil pine forests. Return to Shimla in the evening and spend the rest of the day at leisure, soaking in the town's peaceful ambiance. Overnight stay in Shimla.

Itinerary.Name: Shimla – Rishikesh (275 km / Approx. 6 hours drive)
Description: After breakfast, drive to Rishikesh, a spiritual town located approximately 275 kilometers from Shimla, with a drive time of around six hours. Nestled on the banks of the sacred Ganges River, Rishikesh is renowned for its deep religious significance, serene ambiance, and status as a global hub for yoga and meditation. The town attracts spiritual seekers and travelers from around the world, offering a peaceful retreat amidst natural beauty and spiritual energy. Upon arrival, check into your hotel and relax for the evening. Overnight stay in Rishikesh.

Itinerary.Name: Rishikesh – Haridwar – Rishikesh
Description: Begin the day in Rishikesh by visiting the iconic Ram Jhula and Lakshman Jhula, suspension bridges that offer stunning views of the Ganges and connect various ashrams and temples along the riverbanks. Explore the spiritual heart of the town through its many temples and peaceful ashrams. Later, drive to Haridwar, one of India’s most revered pilgrimage sites, and visit Har Ki Pauri, a sacred ghat where devotees gather for the mesmerizing evening Ganga Aarti. Also visit Mansa Devi Temple, perched atop a hill and accessible by cable car. Return to Rishikesh for an overnight stay.

Itinerary.Name: Rishikesh – Delhi (235 km / Approx. 5 hours drive)
Description: After breakfast, drive back to Delhi, covering a distance of approximately 235 kilometers in about five hours. En route, enjoy views of prominent landmarks such as India Gate, a war memorial dedicated to fallen soldiers, and Rashtrapati Bhawan, the official residence of the President of India. Upon arrival in the capital, you will be transferred to your hotel for check-in. Spend the rest of the day at leisure, relaxing or exploring the nearby areas at your own pace. Overnight stay in Delhi.

Itinerary.Name: Delhi – Varanasi (Flight)
Description: After breakfast, proceed to the airport for your flight to Varanasi, one of India’s most sacred pilgrimage destinations. Upon arrival, meet our representative who will assist with your transfer to the hotel. Varanasi, situated along the banks of the holy Ganges, is renowned for its spiritual ambiance, ancient ghats, and vibrant rituals that reflect centuries of devotion and tradition. In the evening, experience the mesmerizing Ganga Aarti at Dashashwamedh Ghat, a powerful ceremony of lights and chants that draws devotees and visitors alike. Enjoy the spiritual energy of the city before settling in for an overnight stay in Varanasi.

Itinerary.Name: Varanasi
Description: Begin your day with an early morning boat ride on the sacred Ganges River at sunrise, witnessing the serene rituals of pilgrims offering prayers and bathing in its holy waters. After this soulful experience, visit Banaras Hindu University, one of India’s most prestigious educational institutions, and explore the Bharat Kala Bhavan museum, known for its rich collection of Mughal miniatures, sculptures, and textiles. In the afternoon, take an excursion to Sarnath, the revered site where Lord Buddha delivered his first sermon, and explore its ancient stupas, monasteries, and ruins. Return to the city for an overnight stay in Varanasi.

Itinerary.Name: Varanasi – Delhi (Flight)
Description: After a leisurely morning in Varanasi, transfer to the airport for your flight back to Delhi. Upon arrival in the capital, visit the iconic Lotus Temple, renowned for its striking lotus-shaped architecture and serene ambiance, welcoming people of all faiths for meditation and reflection. Spend some quiet moments in this peaceful sanctuary before heading to your hotel. Enjoy the evening at your own pace or explore the nearby surroundings. Overnight stay in Delhi.

Itinerary.Name: Delhi – Departure
Description: After breakfast, check out of your hotel and proceed to the international airport for your onward journey. As you depart, carry with you cherished memories of India’s vibrant culture, spiritual depth, and diverse landscapes. Wishing you a safe and pleasant journey ahead.

Name: North India Temple Tour Package
Title: North India Pilgrimage Tour | Temple Circuit Travel Package
Description: Experience a spiritual journey with our North India Pilgrimage Tour. Visit sacred temples, ghats & holy cities across Varanasi, Prayagraj, Ayodhya & more.
Summary: Experience the divine energy of India's most revered temples with our North India Temple Tour Package. From the sacred banks of the Ganges to the grand temples of Varanasi and beyond, this journey offers an enriching spiritual experience. If you're planning a pilgrimage from the USA, our expertly curated tour ensures a seamless and unforgettable adventure. Book your North India Temple Tour today and immerse yourself in India's rich spiritual heritage. Looking for more sacred experiences? Discover the timeless beauty of ancient shrines with our South India Temple Tour Packages or explore our Chardham Pilgrimage Tour Package India for a deeper connection with the divine.
Overview: Embark on a spiritual journey through the heart of North India with our North India Temple Tour Package. Explore the historic and sacred temples, each with its unique significance and rich cultural heritage. This tour takes you through vibrant cities and ancient sites, offering a deep connection to India’s religious diversity, traditions, and spirituality. From the holy ghats of Varanasi to the divine temples of Amritsar, this package promises a fulfilling and peaceful experience.
AdditionalInformation:
• Best Time to Visit: October to March for pleasant weather and festive occasions.
  • Ideal For: Devotees, spiritual seekers, and cultural enthusiasts.
  • What to Bring: Comfortable clothing, a hat for sun protection, and essentials like sunscreen and a camera.
  • Customize the tour as per your preferences and travel pace.
WhatsIncluded:
• Comfortable accommodation at hotels and guesthouses.
  • Daily breakfast and meals as per itinerary.
  • Private transport for sightseeing and transfers.
  • Guided tours of temples and historical sites.
  • Entry fees to temples and monuments.
  • Assistance with Darshan and Pooja rituals.
  • Enjoy a morning boat ride on the Ganges in Varanasi
  • Professional English-speaking local guides in all cities
  • Eaze Tour Manager available as per group strength
  • 2 water bottles per guest per day during tours
  • Welcome garland upon arrival
WhatsExcluded:
• Personal expenses (telephone, tips, minibar, extra beverages, meals beyond breakfast).
  • Airfare, visa fees, and any medical/hospitalization or evacuation expenses.
  • Tips for drivers, guides, or restaurant staff.
  • Any expenses not listed above.

Address.AddressRegion: Delhi, Amritsar, Dharamshala, Shimla, Rishikesh, Haridwar, Varanasi

TourCompanion.Name: EazeTours Cultural Tour Guide
TourCompanion.Description: Friendly and knowledgeable guide well-versed in North India's religious and cultural history

Itinerary.Name: Arrive in Delhi
Description: Upon arrival in Delhi, you will be warmly greeted and assisted at the airport by our representative, ensuring a smooth transition from your flight. You will then be transferred to your hotel, where you can check in and unwind after your journey. Depending on your arrival time, you may choose to relax at the hotel or explore the bustling streets of India’s capital city. Delhi, a vibrant blend of history and modernity, offers countless attractions, from ancient monuments and bustling bazaars to luxury shopping and fine dining experiences. If time permits, you can take a short visit to nearby sites such as India Gate, Connaught Place, or Humayun’s Tomb to get a glimpse of the city’s rich heritage. Enjoy a comfortable overnight stay at your hotel, preparing for the incredible journey ahead through the diverse and mesmerizing landscapes of India. Dinner at the hotel is optional.

Itinerary.Name: Explore Delhi
Description: After a delightful breakfast, embark on a sightseeing tour of Old and New Delhi, experiencing the city's rich history and vibrant culture. Begin in Old Delhi, where you will explore the magnificent Red Fort, admire the grandeur of Jama Masjid, and pay homage at Raj Ghat, the memorial of Mahatma Gandhi. Stroll through the bustling alleys of Chandni Chowk, known for its chaotic charm, spice markets, and silver jewelry. In New Delhi, visit the soaring Qutub Minar, the elegant Humayun’s Tomb, and the iconic India Gate, a tribute to fallen soldiers. Drive past the stately President’s House, Parliament House, and the Government Secretariat buildings, witnessing the grandeur of British-era architecture. Conclude your day at Connaught Place, the city’s commercial and cultural hub, perfect for shopping and dining. Return to your hotel for an overnight stay, reflecting on Delhi’s fascinating blend of old-world charm and modernity.

Itinerary.Name: Delhi to Bhubaneswar
Description: After breakfast, transfer to the airport for your flight to Bhubaneswar, the capital of Odisha, known as the Temple City of India. Upon arrival, embark on a half-day sightseeing tour to explore the city’s rich cultural and spiritual heritage. Visit the majestic Lingaraj Temple, an architectural marvel from the 11th-13th century, dedicated to Lord Shiva. Explore the intricately carved Rajarani Temple and the exquisite Mukteswar Temple, renowned for its stunning gateway and sculptures. Continue to Dhauli Peace Pagoda, a site of historical significance where Emperor Ashoka embraced Buddhism after the Kalinga War. End your tour at the ancient Jain monk caves of Khandagiri and Udayagiri, which date back to the 2nd century BCE and offer a glimpse into early Jain monastic life. After a day of cultural exploration, check in to your hotel for a relaxing overnight stay.

Itinerary.Name: Bhubaneswar to Ratnagiri
Description: After an early breakfast, embark on an excursion to Ratnagiri, a significant Buddhist heritage site in Odisha. Part of the Diamond Triangle along with Udayagiri and Lalitgiri, Ratnagiri is home to ancient Buddhist monasteries, stupas, and sculptures dating back to the 5th–13th centuries. Explore the monastery ruins, adorned with intricate carvings and sculptures of Lord Buddha and Bodhisattvas, and visit the Ratnagiri Museum, which houses rare artifacts, bronze statues, and terracotta seals. Witness the majestic Mahastupa, an imposing structure that once stood as a center of Buddhist learning. After a day of historical exploration, return to Bhubaneswar for a relaxing overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Bhubaneswar to Baliguda
Description: After breakfast, embark on a scenic drive to Baliguda, a gateway to the tribal heartland of Odisha. The journey takes you through lush forests, rolling hills, and picturesque villages, offering glimpses of Odisha’s rural charm. Baliguda is known for its indigenous tribal communities, particularly the Kutia Kondh tribe, who have preserved their unique customs and traditions for centuries. Upon arrival, check in at the hotel and unwind. The evening is at leisure, allowing you to explore the surroundings or relax in preparation for the next day’s tribal encounters. Overnight stay in Baliguda.

Itinerary.Name: Baliguda Exploration
Description: After breakfast, embark on an immersive cultural journey through the Desai Kondh tribal villages, where you will witness the age-old traditions, lifestyle, and vibrant customs of one of Odisha’s indigenous communities. Walk through scenic villages, interact with the locals, and observe their distinctive attire, intricate jewelry, and traditional homes made of mud and bamboo. Experience their rituals, handicrafts, and unique agricultural practices, gaining a deeper understanding of their harmonious relationship with nature. After a day of exploration and cultural exchange, return to your hotel for an overnight stay in Baliguda.

Itinerary.Name: Baliguda to Rayagada (via Belghar & Kothagarh)
Description: After breakfast, embark on a scenic journey from Baliguda to Rayagada, passing through the culturally rich regions of Belghar and Kotagarh. Your first stop is Belghar, home to the Huttiya Kondha tribes, an ancient indigenous community known for their distinct traditions and deep-rooted connection with nature. Observe their unique way of life, admire their traditional houses made of bamboo and mud, and learn about their customs that have been preserved for generations. Continue your journey to Kotagarh, where you will experience the vibrant energy of the weekly tribal market, a bustling hub where various tribal communities gather to trade handmade crafts, fresh local produce, and intricately designed ornaments. This market offers a rare glimpse into their self-sustained lifestyle. After enjoying lunch en route, proceed to Rayagada, a beautiful town nestled in the Eastern Ghats. Upon arrival, check in at your hotel, relax, and unwind after an enriching day. Dinner and overnight stay in Rayagada.

Itinerary.Name: Rayagada to Jeypore (via Onukudelli)
Description: After breakfast, embark on a scenic drive to Onukudelli, home to the Bonda and Gadaba tribes, some of the most fascinating indigenous communities in India. Visit the weekly tribal market, where the Bonda women, adorned with heavy silver jewelry and vibrant attire, trade handmade goods and daily essentials. Experience the unique traditions and lifestyle of the Gadaba tribe as you explore their villages, witnessing their distinct homes and cultural practices. After an enriching interaction with these tribal communities, continue your journey to Jeypore, a historical town surrounded by lush landscapes. Upon arrival, check in at your hotel for dinner and an overnight stay.

Itinerary.Name: Explore Jeypore
Description: After breakfast, set out for an immersive cultural experience at Kundli Market, the largest tribal market in the region, where the Paraja tribe gathers to trade goods, handicrafts, and fresh produce. Observe their traditional attire, colorful ornaments, and bartering system, which has been practiced for generations. Engage with the locals and learn about their unique customs and way of life. After exploring the market, take some time to visit nearby Paraja villages, where you can witness their daily activities and traditional homes. Return to Jeypore in the evening for dinner and an overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Jeypore to Rayagada (via Laxmipur)
Description: After breakfast, depart for Laxmipur, where you'll visit the Dhuruba tribe, known for their unique traditions and way of life. Continue to the Bonda region, home to one of India's most primitive tribal communities. Witness their distinct culture, including their vibrant attire and bartering practices. Later, visit Jagannath Temple in Koraput, a rare temple where non-Hindus are allowed to enter, offering an inclusive spiritual experience. Explore the Tribal Museum, which showcases the rich heritage of Odisha’s indigenous communities. After lunch en route, proceed to Rayagada for dinner and an overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Rayagada to Chilika (via Taptapani)
Description: After breakfast, embark on a scenic drive to Chilika, India’s largest coastal lagoon, renowned for its stunning landscapes and rich biodiversity. En route, stop at Taptapani, famous for its natural hot springs, believed to have medicinal properties. Enjoy the tranquil surroundings and, if desired, take a dip in the warm, mineral-rich waters. Continue your journey through picturesque countryside and tribal villages, offering glimpses of rural Odisha’s cultural charm. Upon arrival at Chilika, check in at the hotel and unwind. Spend the evening at leisure, soaking in the beauty of the lagoon. Overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Chilika to Puri
Description: After breakfast, embark on a scenic drive to Puri, one of India's most revered pilgrimage destinations and home to the iconic Jagannath Temple. Upon arrival, check in at your hotel and unwind. Later, head to Puri Beach, where you can relax on the golden sands, take a refreshing dip in the sea, or simply enjoy the rhythmic sound of the waves. Stroll along the bustling shoreline, explore local handicraft stalls, and witness a mesmerizing sunset over the Bay of Bengal. After a serene evening by the beach, return to your hotel for a comfortable overnight stay.

Itinerary.Name: Explore Puri
Description: Begin your day with a visit to the revered Jagannath Temple, a sacred pilgrimage site and a marvel of Kalinga architecture. Explore its spiritual aura and witness the devotion of countless pilgrims. Next, visit Gundicha Temple, also known as the 'Garden House of Jagannath,' an important site during the Rath Yatra festival. Later, drive to Konark to explore the UNESCO-listed Sun Temple, an architectural masterpiece depicting the celestial chariot of the Sun God. Admire the intricate stone carvings and historical significance of this 13th-century marvel. After an enriching day of exploration, return to your hotel in Puri for an overnight stay.

Itinerary.Name: Puri to Bhubaneswar and Departure to Delhi
Description: After breakfast, bid farewell to the coastal charm of Puri as you embark on a scenic drive to Bhubaneswar Airport. Enjoy the last glimpses of Odisha’s vibrant culture and landscapes before boarding your flight to Delhi. Upon arrival in Delhi, you will proceed with your onward journey, carrying cherished memories of your incredible exploration through India’s rich heritage, tribal traditions, and architectural wonders. Safe travels!

Name: Orissa Tour Package India
Title: Orissa Tour Package India: Explore Ancient Temples
Description: Explore the rich culture and heritage with our Orissa tour package in India. Visit temples, wildlife sanctuaries, & scenic landscapes on a memorable journey.
Summary: From ancient temples to serene beaches and tribal heartlands, this journey offers a perfect blend of history, spirituality, and adventure. Plan your trip today and immerse yourself in the beauty of this incredible destination. Looking for a more immersive experience? Check out our Orissa Chhattisgarh Tour Package India for an extended cultural exploration or explore our Tribal Tour Package India to witness the unique traditions of indigenous communities. Your unforgettable journey awaits!
Overview: Explore the rich cultural heritage, ancient temples, and stunning landscapes of Orissa with our Orissa Tour Package. Known for its classical dance, art, and pristine beaches, Orissa offers a unique blend of tradition and natural beauty. Visit sacred temples, serene beaches, and UNESCO World Heritage sites, including the iconic Sun Temple of Konark and the Jagannath Temple of Puri. This tour promises an unforgettable experience for history lovers, spiritual seekers, and nature enthusiasts.
AdditionalInformation:
• Best Time to Visit: October to March, when the weather is pleasant for sightseeing.
  • Ideal For: Devotees, culture lovers, and nature enthusiasts.
  • What to Bring: Comfortable walking shoes, sunscreen, and a camera for scenic views.
  • Customize your itinerary based on personal interests and travel preferences.
  • Surprise gifts upon tour completion
  • Assistance on arrival/departure at the airport
  • All currently applicable taxes

• Personal expenses (telephone, tips, minibar, extra beverages, meals beyond breakfast).

  • Tips for drivers, guides, or restaurant staff.

TourCompanion.Name: Orissa Culture Expert
TourCompanion.Description: Local guide knowledgeable in the cultural and historical significance of Orissa's landmarks.

Itinerary.Name: Arrive in Bhubaneswar
Description: Upon arrival in Bhubaneswar, you will be warmly received and assisted with your transfer to the hotel. Spend the rest of the day at leisure, relaxing and settling in. Bhubaneswar, known as 'The Lord of the Universe,' is the present-day capital of Odisha and was once the seat of power for the ancient Kalinga Empire. Rich in history and heritage, the city dates back to the 7th century and is renowned for its temples and cultural significance. Enjoy your first evening in this historic city. Overnight stay in Bhubaneswar.

Itinerary.Name: Explore Bhubaneswar
Description: In the morning, set out on a guided city tour of Bhubaneswar, a city renowned for its remarkable temple architecture. Visit the 7th-century Brahmeswar and Parasurameswara temples, celebrated for their intricate lattice windows and detailed carvings. Explore the 10th-century Mukteswar Temple, admired for its elegant toranas (arches), and the 11th-century Rajarani Temple, known for its stunning sculptural work. Continue to the magnificent Lingaraj Temple, an architectural masterpiece of the Kalinga style, which non-Hindus may view only from the outside. The afternoon is free for independent exploration or relaxation. Overnight stay in Bhubaneswar.

Itinerary.Name: Bhubaneswar – Puri – Konark – Bhubaneswar
Description: Embark on a full-day guided excursion to Puri and Konark, two of Odisha’s most iconic destinations. Begin with a visit to Puri, located 62 kilometers from Bhubaneswar, one of India’s four sacred Dhams and the revered abode of Lord Jagannath. Set along the Bay of Bengal, Puri is famed for its spiritual significance and the vibrant Rath Yatra festival. Continue to the magnificent Sun Temple at Konark, also known as the Black Pagoda. This 13th-century architectural marvel is shaped like a colossal chariot drawn by seven horses and set on 24 intricately carved wheels, symbolizing the passage of time. Overnight stay in Bhubaneswar.

Itinerary.Name: Bhubaneswar – Balliguda
Description: After breakfast, drive to Balliguda, a gateway to the tribal highlands of Odisha located in the Phulbani district. The journey offers a scenic experience as you pass through lush Sal forests, winding mountain roads, and traditional Oriya villages that provide a glimpse into rural life. Enjoy the changing landscapes and natural beauty along the way. Arrive in Balliguda by evening and check in to your hotel. Spend the rest of the evening at leisure, preparing for the cultural exploration ahead. Overnight stay at a hotel in Balliguda.

Itinerary.Name: Balliguda – Rayagada
Description: In the morning, drive to Rayagada, a journey that takes you deeper into Odisha’s tribal heartland. En route, visit the villages of the Kutia Kondh tribe, a community known for its rich cultural heritage and once-feared tradition of human sacrifice, now long abandoned. Nestled in the remote mountains and forests, the Kutia Kondhs are known for their hospitality and vibrant traditions. If you wish, enjoy a short trek through the picturesque terrain to better experience the natural beauty and tribal life of the region. Arrive in Rayagada by evening. Overnight stay in Rayagada.

Itinerary.Name: Explore Rayagada
Description: Spend the day immersing yourself in the rich tribal culture of the Rayagada region. Begin with a visit to the vibrant weekly market at Kotagarh, where local tribes gather to trade goods and socialize, offering a unique opportunity to witness traditional attire, crafts, and customs. Continue your exploration with visits to the villages of the Desia Kondh and Dongaria Kondh tribes, known for their distinct customs, deep connection to nature, and striking traditional jewelry and clothing. Experience the authenticity of tribal life in this remote and culturally rich region. Overnight stay in Rayagada.

Itinerary.Name: Rayagada – Chatikona – Jeypore
Description: In the morning, drive to Jeypore with a stop at Chatikona to experience the vibrant weekly market of the Dongria tribe, known for their striking traditional attire and deep connection to the Niyamgiri hills. This colorful gathering offers a rare glimpse into tribal commerce and daily life, as the Dongria Kondhs bring forest produce, fruits, and animals to trade. En route, also visit the Jharia Paroja village, home to another indigenous community known for their unique customs and way of life. Continue your scenic journey through the tribal belt and arrive in Jeypore by evening. Overnight stay in Jeypore.

Itinerary.Name: Explore Jeypore
Description: Begin the day with a visit to Onkadelli, where you can witness the fascinating weekly market of the Bonda tribe, one of India’s most distinctive and ancient tribal communities. The Bonda people are known for their unique dress, elaborate bead jewelry, and independent lifestyle in the remote hills. This vibrant market offers a rare opportunity to observe their customs and interactions. In the afternoon, explore the villages of the Gadaba tribe, known for their colorful attire, traditional music, and graceful Dhemsa dance. Immerse yourself in the rich cultural tapestry of the region. Overnight stay in Jeypore.

Itinerary.Name: Jeypore – Kundli – Nandpur – Jeypore
Description: Travel to Kundli, located 65 kilometers from Jeypore, to visit the largest and most vibrant tribal market in the region, where members of the Sanaparoja and Mali tribes gather to trade goods in a colorful and lively setting. Continue your journey to Nandpur to explore Sanaparoja tribal villages, with optional short treks to remote settlements like Khilus, Saana Padar, and Bda Padar for an authentic look at rural tribal life. You may also visit the mystical Gupteshwar caves, a revered shrine nestled deep in the forest and home to the Dhuruba tribe. Explore nearby villages such as Ramanguda, Dogariguda, Silpader, and Talur before returning to Jeypore in the evening. Overnight stay in Jeypore.

Itinerary.Name: Jeypore – Jagdalpur
Description: Drive to Jagdalpur, a culturally rich town in the Bastar region, known for its vibrant tribal heritage. En route, stop at Kotapadu village to explore traditional terracotta craftsmanship and indigenous dyeing techniques, which reflect the artistic spirit and ancestral skills of the local communities. Engage with artisans and witness their intricate work firsthand. Continue your journey through scenic landscapes and tribal settlements, arriving in Jagdalpur by evening. Check in at your hotel and relax for the night. Overnight stay in Jagdalpur.

Itinerary.Name: Jagdalpur – Chitrakoot
Description: Drive to Chitrakoot and begin your day by visiting the villages of the Muria tribe, known for their vibrant culture and traditional practices. Explore their weekly market, a lively gathering where locals trade goods and celebrate community life. In the afternoon, visit nearby villages to further immerse yourself in the region's tribal heritage. Later, marvel at the breathtaking Chitrakot Waterfalls, famously dubbed the 'Niagara of India' for its impressive 100-foot drop and wide, horseshoe shape. The falls are especially spectacular during the monsoon season. Enjoy the serene beauty of the area. Overnight stay in Chitrakoot.

Itinerary.Name: Explore Chitrakut
Description: Spend the day exploring the natural and cultural wonders of Chitrakoot. Drive to the Kailash Cave in the scenic Kanger Valley National Park, a limestone cave adorned with fascinating stalactite and stalagmite formations, offering a glimpse into the region’s geological history. Afterward, visit the Bhadra tribal village to experience the traditional lifestyle, customs, and warm hospitality of the local community. Immerse yourself in the rich cultural tapestry of the Bastar region. Return in the evening to relax. Overnight stay in Chitrakoot.

Itinerary.Name: Chitrakut – Narayanpur
Description: In the morning, drive to Narayanpur, a region known for its rich tribal heritage and artistic traditions. Visit the villages of the Maria tribe, renowned for their distinctive tribal artwork and cultural expressions. En route, stop at Kondagaon, a hub of traditional Bastar handicrafts, to witness skilled artisans at work creating intricate wooden crafts and bell metal art. In the evening, enjoy an authentic tribal dance performance, offering a vibrant display of local music, rhythm, and celebration. Immerse yourself in the unique spirit of the region. Overnight stay in Narayanpur.

Itinerary.Name: Narayanpur – Raipur
Description: In the morning, depart from Narayanpur and drive to Raipur, the capital city of Chhattisgarh. Along the way, stop to visit the villages of the Maria tribe in the Gadbental area, known for their traditional lifestyle, vibrant attire, and ceremonial dances. This visit offers a final, enriching glimpse into the unique tribal cultures of central India. Continue your journey through scenic rural landscapes and arrive in Raipur by evening. Check in to your hotel and relax. Overnight stay in Raipur.

Itinerary.Name: Raipur – Departure
Description: After breakfast, check out from your hotel and transfer to Raipur Airport for your onward flight. Carry with you the memories of a culturally rich and immersive journey through the tribal heartlands of India. Safe travels!

Name: Orissa & Chhattisgarh Tour Package
Title: Orissa Chattisgarh Tour Package India - Eaze Tours
Description: Explore Orissa and Chhattisgarh with our tailored tour packages. Experience rich culture, stunning landscapes, and unique traditions in India.
Summary: Experience the rich cultural heritage and breathtaking landscapes of Orissa and Chhattisgarh with our thoughtfully crafted tour package. From ancient temples to vibrant tribal traditions, this journey offers an immersive experience like no other. Whether you're traveling from the USA or anywhere else, we ensure a seamless and enriching adventure. Book your Orissa Chhattisgarh Tour Package India today and create unforgettable memories. Looking for more travel options? Check out our Orissa Tour Package India or explore our Gujarat Tribal Tour Package India for an in-depth cultural experience.
Overview: Embark on a captivating journey through the culturally rich states of Orissa and Chhattisgarh. This Orissa & Chhattisgarh Tour Package takes you through ancient temples, stunning tribal villages, scenic landscapes, and vibrant festivals. From the sacred temples of Puri and Bhubaneswar in Orissa to the tribal culture and wildlife sanctuaries in Chhattisgarh, this tour is perfect for those seeking a deep dive into India’s traditional and spiritual heritage.
AdditionalInformation:
• Best Time to Visit: October to March, for pleasant weather and smooth travel conditions.
  • Ideal For: History buffs, culture enthusiasts, spiritual seekers, and nature lovers.
  • What to Bring: Comfortable clothing, walking shoes, sunscreen, and a camera to capture the beauty.
  • Customizable itineraries available based on your preferences.
  • Welcome garland on arrival at the airport/railway station
  • Surprise gifts at the tour’s conclusion

  • Private transportation for all transfers and sightseeing.
  • Guided tours of historical, cultural, and religious sites.
  • Entry fees to monuments, temples, and parks.
  • Professional guides with in-depth knowledge of local history and culture.
  • Assistance with rituals and temple darshan.

TourCompanion.Name: Tribal Culture Guide Team

Itinerary.Name: Arrive in Delhi (Check-in at hotel after 2:00 PM)
Description: Upon arrival at Indira Gandhi International Airport, you will be warmly welcomed by our representative, who will assist you with a smooth transfer to your hotel. Delhi, the capital of India, is a fascinating blend of history and modernity, where ancient monuments stand alongside bustling markets and contemporary skyscrapers. Over the centuries, various dynasties have ruled this city, leaving behind a rich architectural and cultural legacy. Nestled along the Yamuna River, Delhi has been a witness to the rise and fall of great civilizations for over 5,000 years. After check-in, take the rest of the day to relax or explore the city at your own pace. Overnight stay in Delhi.

Itinerary.Name: Explore Delhi
Description: After breakfast, embark on a captivating journey through the contrasting landscapes of Old and New Delhi. Begin with Old Delhi, where the grandeur of the Red Fort stands as a testament to Mughal splendor. Visit Jama Masjid, India's largest mosque, and take a thrilling rickshaw ride through the bustling alleys of Chandni Chowk. Pay respects at Raj Ghat, Mahatma Gandhi’s memorial. In the afternoon, explore New Delhi’s architectural gems, including Qutub Minar and the historic Iron Pillar. Drive past India Gate, Rashtrapati Bhawan, and Parliament House, soaking in the city’s colonial charm before returning to your hotel for an overnight stay.

Itinerary.Name: Delhi to Sawai Madhopur / Ranthambore
Description: After a leisurely breakfast, enjoy some free time before heading to the railway station for your journey to Sawai Madhopur. Board the Kota Janshatabdi Express (Train No. 12060) at 13:20 hrs and arrive at 18:02 hrs in an A/C Chair Car. Upon arrival, a representative will greet you and transfer you to Ranthambore, a renowned national park spanning 400 sq km. Home to majestic tigers, leopards, gazelles, and sambars, the park’s landscape is enriched by ancient ruins, adding to its allure. After checking in at the hotel, unwind and prepare for an exciting wildlife adventure the next day.

Itinerary.Name: Ranthambore Safari
Description: Day 4 in Ranthambore promises an exhilarating wildlife experience. Begin the day with an early morning game drive, venturing deep into the national park’s rugged terrain to spot elusive tigers, leopards, and a variety of other wildlife in their natural habitat. As the golden sunrise bathes the jungle, keep an eye out for deer, wild boars, and exotic birds. After returning to the hotel for breakfast and some leisure time, set out again in the evening for another safari. With Ranthambore’s stunning landscapes and historical ruins as a backdrop, every drive offers a unique adventure. Conclude the day with an overnight stay in Ranthambore.

Itinerary.Name: Ranthambore to Fatehpur Sikri and Agra (267 km, 5-6 hours)
Description: Day 5 takes you on a journey through history, beginning with a scenic drive from Ranthambore to Agra. En route, stop at Fatehpur Sikri, a magnificent yet abandoned Mughal city built by Emperor Akbar in the 16th century. Wander through its grand sandstone palaces, courtyards, and mosques, including the revered Tomb of Sheikh Salim Chisti, known for granting wishes. After exploring this UNESCO World Heritage Site, continue to Agra, the former Mughal capital and a city renowned for its architectural splendor. Upon arrival, check in at your hotel and relax, preparing for the wonders that await. Overnight stay in Agra.

Itinerary.Name: Agra and Overnight Train to Katni
Description: Day 6 begins with an early morning visit to the Taj Mahal, an architectural masterpiece symbolizing eternal love. As the morning light casts a golden glow over its pristine marble, admire the intricate carvings and inlay work. Next, explore Agra Fort, a formidable red sandstone fortress that once served as the residence of Mughal emperors. Walk through its palaces, courtyards, and halls, reliving the grandeur of the Mughal era. Later, visit the exquisite tomb of Itimad-Ud-Daulah, often referred to as the 'Baby Taj.' In the evening, transfer to the railway station for an overnight journey to Katni.

Itinerary.Name: Katni to Bandhavgarh (100 km, approx. 3 hours)
Description: Upon arrival in Katni, embark on a scenic drive to Bandhavgarh, one of India’s most renowned tiger reserves. Nestled in the Vindhya Hills, this park boasts one of the highest tiger densities in the country, making it an excellent destination for wildlife enthusiasts. The landscape features a mix of lush valleys, dense forests, and open meadows, with streams flowing into the River Son. Apart from its thriving wildlife, Bandhavgarh is steeped in mythology, with its hilltop fort believed to have links to Lord Shiva. In the afternoon, set out on an exhilarating safari before retiring for an overnight stay in Bandhavgarh.

Itinerary.Name: Bandhavgarh Safari
Description: Rise early for an exciting morning safari in Bandhavgarh National Park, where the dense forests and open meadows offer prime opportunities to spot the elusive Bengal tiger. Apart from tigers, the park is home to leopards, deer, wild boars, and a variety of bird species. The rugged terrain, ancient caves, and the historic Bandhavgarh Fort add to the park’s mystique. After a relaxing afternoon at the lodge, embark on another thrilling evening safari, as dusk is a prime time for wildlife activity. Absorb the sights and sounds of the jungle before returning to your accommodation for an overnight stay.

Itinerary.Name: Bandhavgarh to Kanha (250 km, approx. 6 hours)
Description: After an early breakfast, set off on a scenic drive to Kanha National Park, one of India's largest and most well-preserved wildlife reserves. This vast expanse of forests, grasslands, and streams inspired Rudyard Kipling’s The Jungle Book. Upon arrival, check in at your lodge and relax before heading out for an afternoon safari. Kanha is famous for its thriving population of Bengal tigers, barasingha (swamp deer), leopards, and diverse birdlife. As you explore the park’s meadows and sal forests, keep an eye out for wildlife in its natural habitat. Conclude the day with an overnight stay at the lodge.

Itinerary.Name: Kanha Safari
Description: Rise early for a thrilling morning safari in Kanha National Park, where you’ll have the best chance to spot Bengal tigers, leopards, and the rare barasingha deer. The park’s dense sal forests, expansive meadows, and tranquil streams create a breathtaking backdrop for wildlife encounters. After returning to your lodge for lunch and some rest, set out again in the afternoon for another safari, exploring different zones of the park. Keep your camera ready for sightings of wild boars, jackals, and a variety of bird species. As the sun sets, return to your lodge for a peaceful overnight stay.

Itinerary.Name: Kanha to Nagpur (262 km, approx. 6 hours) and Return to Delhi
Description: Enjoy a leisurely breakfast before departing for Nagpur, a major city known as the 'Orange City' of India. The scenic drive takes you through central India's lush landscapes, offering glimpses of rural life along the way. Upon arrival in Nagpur, transfer to the airport for your evening flight to Delhi. After landing in the capital, you will be greeted and escorted to your hotel. Take the evening to relax or explore nearby areas at your own pace. Enjoy a comfortable overnight stay in Delhi, preparing for the final leg of your journey.

Itinerary.Name: Departure from Delhi
Description: Enjoy a relaxed breakfast at the hotel before checking out. Depending on your flight schedule, you may have some free time for last-minute shopping or sightseeing. Later, our representative will assist with your transfer to Indira Gandhi International Airport. Bid farewell to India as you embark on your onward journey, taking with you unforgettable memories of diverse landscapes, rich cultural heritage, and incredible wildlife encounters. Safe travels!

Name: Tiger Safari India Tour Packages
Title: Book Luxury Tiger Safari Tours in India - Eaze Tours
Description: Experience the thrill of a Tiger Safari in India with Eaze Tours. Explore wildlife sanctuaries and get up close with majestic tigers in their natural habitat. Book Now!
Summary: Whether you're seeking adventure, nature, or a unique experience, this tour will leave you with memories to cherish forever. For those interested in exploring more of India's natural wonders, consider our Wildlife Safari Tour Package India for an expanded journey or indulge in the finest Luxury Holiday Packages in India for a blend of adventure and relaxation. Book your tour now and start your unforgettable Indian adventure!
Overview: Embark on an exciting Tiger Safari in India, where you can witness the majestic Bengal tigers in their natural habitat. India is home to several world-renowned tiger reserves and national parks, including Jim Corbett, Ranthambore, Bandhavgarh, and Kaziranga. This adventure is perfect for wildlife enthusiasts, photographers, and nature lovers, offering a rare opportunity to spot tigers along with a variety of other wildlife species in lush forests and pristine environments.
AdditionalInformation:
• Best Time to Visit: October to March, as the weather is pleasant, and wildlife sightings are more frequent.
  • Ideal For: Wildlife enthusiasts, photographers, and nature lovers.
  • What to Bring: Comfortable clothing, binoculars, camera, sunscreen, and a hat for sun protection.
  • Fitness Level: Moderate, as some safaris may require short treks or jeep rides through rugged terrain.

TourCompanion.Name: Wildlife Safari Support Team
TourCompanion.Description: Expert safari guides, wildlife spotters, drivers

Itinerary.Name: Arrive in Mumbai
Description: On the first day, upon your arrival in Mumbai, you will be warmly welcomed by our representative who will assist you with the transfer to your hotel. Once checked in, you can relax and settle in after your journey. This bustling metropolis, known as the financial and entertainment capital of India, offers a vibrant blend of colonial charm, modern skyscrapers, and rich cultural diversity. The rest of the day is at your leisure to unwind or explore the city at your own pace. Overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Baroda to Ahmedabad and Onwards to Utellia
Description: On the second day, after breakfast at the hotel, you will be transferred to the airport for your flight to Baroda (Flight: 9W-349, 10:15 – 11:05 hrs). Upon arrival, transfer to your hotel for check-in. Later, embark on an enriching excursion to Chhota Udaipur, home to the Rathwa tribes—one of the most ancient and culturally rich tribal communities of Gujarat. After enjoying an early lunch, set out on a jeep safari to explore tribal villages such as Kol, Kharakwada, Timla, and Devhat, where you can witness traditional lifestyles, unique art forms, and authentic village life. In the evening, return to Baroda for an overnight stay.

Itinerary.Name: Baroda to Ahmedabad and Onwards to Utellia
Description: On the third day, after breakfast, you will be transferred to the airport for your flight to Ahmedabad. Upon arrival, embark on a scenic drive to Utellia, a charming feudal village located approximately 78 km away, taking around 1.5 hours. Utellia is known for its peaceful rural atmosphere and its striking 19th-century palace, reflecting the grandeur of medieval architecture. After reaching, check in at your heritage hotel and take time to relax and soak in the tranquil surroundings. The rest of the evening is free for leisure, allowing you to explore the village or simply unwind. Overnight stay in Utellia.

Itinerary.Name: Excursion to Bharwad Tribal Village
Description: On the fourth day, embark on a cultural excursion to a Bharwad tribal village. The Bharwad community, traditionally shepherds and cattle herders, are known for their vibrant lifestyle and distinctive use of colors—especially blue, green, and white—in painting their homes. During your visit, you’ll have the chance to step into their homes and experience their everyday life, rich in tradition and simplicity. Some members of the community have also ventured into the diamond cutting and polishing industry, and you’ll get a unique opportunity to observe this intricate craft. Later, visit a local camel-breeding farm, famed for producing high-quality camels. Return for an overnight stay in Utellia.

Itinerary.Name: Utellia to Balaram (120 km, approx. 2 hours)
Description: On the fifth day, after breakfast, drive to Balaram, a serene and picturesque town nestled amid lush green forests and revered for its spiritual significance. En route, visit some of Gujarat’s most remarkable landmarks. Begin with the Calico Museum, renowned for its rare and exquisite collection of textiles. Then, stop at the beautifully carved Adalaj Stepwell, built in 1499, an architectural marvel that served both spiritual and practical purposes. Continue to the Modhera Sun Temple, dating back to 1026 AD, a stunning example of Solanki architecture often likened to the famed Konark Temple in Odisha. After a day of exploration, arrive in Balaram and check in at the elegant Balaram Palace Resort. Overnight stay at the resort.

Itinerary.Name: Balaram Excursion to the Gowala and Garasia Tribal Regions
Description: On the sixth day, set out on an enriching excursion to the tribal regions of the Gowala and Garasia communities, located in the scenic hills straddling the Gujarat-Rajasthan border. The Gowalas are a more settled community, while the Garasias maintain a nomadic lifestyle, each preserving distinct customs and traditions. Observe the differences in attire—Gowala women often wear more ornate clothing, whereas Garasia women favor simpler dress styles. Immerse yourself in their vibrant cultures, interact with locals, and gain insight into their daily lives. In the evening, enjoy a private tribal dance performance, offering a lively display of music and tradition. Overnight stay in Balaram.

Itinerary.Name: Balaram to Patan and Little Rann of Kutch
Description: On the seventh day, depart from Balaram and drive to Patan, a historic city that once served as the capital of medieval Gujarat. Renowned for its exquisite Hindu and Jain architecture, Patan is home to the magnificent 11th-century Rani-ki-Vav, a UNESCO World Heritage stepwell known for its intricate carvings and architectural brilliance. While in Patan, you’ll also have the rare opportunity to meet one of the three remaining families of Patola weavers, masters of the intricate double ikkat technique—an ancient and highly revered art form. After this enriching cultural experience, continue your journey to the Little Rann of Kutch and check in at the Desert Courser Camp. Overnight stay at the camp.

Itinerary.Name: Little Rann of Kutch
Description: On the eighth day, immerse yourself in the unique landscape of the Little Rann of Kutch, a striking expanse of salt flats and marshlands that form one of India’s most unusual ecosystems. Begin your day with a wildlife safari to spot the rare and endangered Asiatic Wild Ass, native to this region and found nowhere else in the world. The area is also rich in birdlife and other desert fauna. In addition to its natural wonders, the region is home to the nomadic Rabari and settled Banjara tribes, known for their vibrant clothing, embroidery, and traditional lifestyles. Spend the day exploring both the wildlife and the tribal heritage of this fascinating region. Overnight stay at Desert Courser Camp.

Itinerary.Name: Little Rann of Kutch to Bhuj
Description: On the ninth day, set off on a scenic drive to Bhuj, the cultural heart of the Kutch region, known for its vibrant traditions, crafts, and tribal heritage. As you travel through the arid yet captivating landscape, keep an eye out—you may be fortunate enough to spot migrating Rabari tribes journeying with their livestock, a rare and authentic glimpse into nomadic life. Upon arrival in Bhuj, check in at your hotel for a four-night stay, which will serve as your base to explore the region's rich and diverse tribal cultures. Spend the evening at leisure. Overnight stay in Bhuj.

Itinerary.Name: Bhuj – Exploring the Tribes of Kutch
Description: On the tenth day, begin your immersive exploration of the Rann of Kutch, a region renowned for its vibrant tribal communities such as the Megwar, Samma, Jat, Mutwa, Ahir, and Rabari. Each tribe boasts distinct customs, attire, and artistic traditions that contribute to the cultural mosaic of Kutch. You’ll start visiting these tribal villages over the next few days, gaining firsthand insight into their way of life. Later, explore the historic city of Bhuj, which has resiliently recovered from the devastating 2001 earthquake. Visit key landmarks including the Old City, the elegant Aina Mahal, the majestic Prag Mahal, and the Bharatiya Folk Museum, which vividly captures tribal heritage. Conclude your day by meeting a local artist who still practices the rare and ancient art of Rogan painting. Overnight stay in Bhuj.

Itinerary.Name: Little Rann of Kutch
Description: On the eleventh day, continue your cultural exploration with another excursion into the tribal regions of the Little Rann of Kutch. This journey offers deeper insight into the diverse communities that inhabit this stark yet beautiful landscape. Visit more remote villages to interact with local tribes and observe their daily routines, artistic expressions, and time-honored traditions. Each encounter reveals a unique facet of Kutch’s rich cultural mosaic, from embroidery and beadwork to mud-wall paintings and folklore. Return to Bhuj in the evening to relax and reflect on the day’s experiences. Overnight stay in Bhuj.

Itinerary.Name: Little Rann of Kutch
Description: On the twelfth day, continue your journey through the vibrant tribal heartland of the Little Rann of Kutch. Set out on excursions to different tribal villages, each offering a distinct window into the region's cultural richness. Witness traditional crafts, intricate embroidery, and the unique architecture of mud homes decorated with mirrors and motifs. Interact with local artisans and gain a deeper appreciation for their centuries-old customs and ways of life. These immersive experiences provide an intimate understanding of the resilience, beauty, and creativity of Kutch’s tribal communities. Return to Bhuj by evening. Overnight stay in Bhuj.

Itinerary.Name: Bhuj to Mumbai
Description: On the thirteenth day, enjoy a relaxed morning at leisure in Bhuj, giving you time to unwind or reflect on the rich cultural journey through Gujarat. Later, transfer to Bhuj airport for your flight to Mumbai. Upon arrival in the bustling metropolis, you will be met by a representative and transferred to your hotel. The rest of the day is yours to enjoy at your own pace—perhaps take a short walk, sample some local cuisine, or simply relax at the hotel. Prepare for the final leg of your journey. Overnight stay in Mumbai.

Itinerary.Name: Mumbai – Departure
Description: On the fourteenth and final day, enjoy a leisurely breakfast at your hotel before checking out. You will then be transferred to the international airport or railway station for your onward journey. As you depart, you’ll carry with you lasting memories of the Gujarat Tribal Tour—an enriching experience filled with vibrant cultures, timeless traditions, warm hospitality, and the striking landscapes of western India. From ancient temples and majestic palaces to remote tribal villages and artistic encounters, the journey offers a deep and unforgettable connection to India’s diverse heritage. Safe travels and fond farewell!

If you're planning your next adventure from the USA, our comprehensive travel packages offer seamless experiences across India. Explore the unique heritage of tribes like the Rathwa, Bharwad, Rabari, and Garacia, among others, and discover their age-old traditions, vibrant communities, and scenic surroundings.

  • Ideal For: Cultural enthusiasts, history lovers, adventure seekers, and those fascinated by tribal lifestyles.
  • What to Bring: Comfortable clothing and footwear, a camera to capture the vibrant scenes, and a journal for keeping notes of your experiences.

TourCompanion.Name: Tribal Culture Expert Guide
TourCompanion.Description: Expert guide specializing in tribal cultures, heritage, and traditions of Gujarat

Itinerary.Name: Arrival in Chennai
Description: On the first day of your journey, you will arrive in Chennai and be transferred to your hotel. In the afternoon, enjoy a sightseeing tour that unveils the cultural and historical richness of South India. Chennai, once a British settlement, beautifully blends colonial charm with traditional Tamil heritage. Highlights include the Kapaleeswarar Temple, an exquisite example of Dravidian architecture from 1250 AD, and the Parthasarathy Temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu. You will also visit Fort St. George, built in 1640 AD, and St. Thomas Mount, a sacred site marking the martyrdom of St. Thomas in 72 AD. Overnight at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Chennai – Kanchipuram – Mamallapuram (72 + 74 km / 2 hrs)
Description: On the second day, after breakfast, you will check out from your hotel in Chennai and drive to Kanchipuram, one of India’s seven sacred cities and a significant center of spirituality and culture. Once the capital of the Pallavas, and later ruled by the Cholas and Vijayanagar Rayas, Kanchipuram is home to remarkable temples. Visit the Ekambareswarar Temple, famed for its impressive 57-meter tall Rajagopuram, and the Kamakshi Amman Temple, a major Shakti pilgrimage site. Later, continue your journey to Mamallapuram. Upon arrival, check into your hotel and enjoy the rest of the day at leisure. Overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Mamallapuram
Description: On the third day, after a hearty breakfast, set out for a sightseeing tour of Mamallapuram, a coastal town known for its remarkable ancient architecture. Begin with a visit to the Shore Temple, one of the oldest stone temples in India, dedicated to both Lord Shiva and Lord Vishnu. Continue to the Five Rathas, magnificent monolithic temples each carved from a single rock, representing different architectural styles. Don’t miss Arjuna's Penance, the world’s largest bas-relief, measuring 27 meters by 9 meters and depicting divine figures, animals, and scenes from mythology. The rest of the day is free for leisure. Overnight at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Mamallapuram – Pondicherry (210 km / 6 hrs)
Description: On the fourth day, check out from your hotel in Mamallapuram and drive to Pondicherry, a charming town with a unique blend of French colonial heritage and Indian culture. Upon arrival, check in at your hotel and relax before heading out for a sightseeing tour. Visit the renowned Aurobindo Ashram, a spiritual center dedicated to the teachings of Sri Aurobindo, focusing on the integration of yoga and modern science. Later, explore Auroville, an experimental township founded in 1926 by Sri Aurobindo and The Mother, promoting unity, peace, and spiritual progress. Enjoy a leisurely evening. Overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Pondicherry – Thanjavur (54 km / 2 hrs)
Description: On the fifth day, after breakfast, check out from your hotel in Pondicherry and drive to Thanjavur, often referred to as the Rice Bowl of Tamil Nadu. Upon arrival, check in at your hotel and begin a sightseeing tour of this culturally rich city. Explore the magnificent Brihadeeswara Temple, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a masterpiece of Chola architecture, renowned for its massive central dome and intricately carved monolithic stone slab. Continue your tour with a visit to the Thanjavur Palace and the Saraswathi Mahal Library, which houses a remarkable collection of over 30,000 ancient manuscripts. Overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Thanjavur – Tiruchirappalli (128 km / 3 hrs)
Description: On the sixth day, after breakfast, check out from your hotel in Thanjavur and drive to Tiruchirappalli, a city rich in history and spiritual significance. Upon arrival, check in at your hotel before heading out for a sightseeing tour. Begin with the iconic Rock Fort, a towering ancient rock formation featuring a temple at its summit, offering stunning panoramic views of the city. Continue to Srirangam, a sacred island town, and visit the Sri Ranganathaswamy Temple, one of the largest and most revered Vaishnavite temples in South India. The grand temple complex is enclosed by seven concentric walls and boasts 21 majestic gopurams. Overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Tiruchirapalli – Madurai (160 km / 5 hrs)
Description: On the seventh day, check out from your hotel in Tiruchirapalli and drive to Madurai, one of the oldest continuously inhabited cities in the world. Upon arrival, check in at your hotel and relax before heading out for an afternoon of exploration. Visit the awe-inspiring Meenakshi Sundareswarar Temple, renowned for its soaring gopurams adorned with thousands of colorful sculptures and intricate carvings. Next, explore the Tirumalai Nayak Palace, an impressive 17th-century structure that beautifully blends Dravidian and Islamic architectural styles. End your day with a visit to the Vandiyur Mariamman Tank, a sacred temple tank featuring a central mandapam. Overnight at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Madurai – Chennai (Flight: 9W 3522 – 0830 / 0945 hrs) – Bangalore (Flight: 9W 487 – 1115 / 1200 hrs)
Description: On the eighth day, check out from your hotel in Madurai and transfer to the airport for your morning flight to Chennai. Upon arrival, connect to your next flight bound for Bangalore. Once in Bangalore, you will be met by your guide and transferred to your hotel. In the afternoon, set out on a sightseeing tour of the city, celebrated for its pleasant weather, lush green spaces, and vibrant culture. Key highlights include the majestic Vidhan Soudha, the beautifully landscaped Lalbagh Gardens, the historic Tipu Sultan’s Palace, and the ancient Bull Temple. Conclude the day with an overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Bangalore – Mysore (130 km / 3 hrs)
Description: On the ninth day, check out from your hotel in Bangalore and drive to Mysore, stopping en route at Srirangapatna, the historic island fortress and former summer palace of Tipu Sultan, surrounded by the serene river Cauvery. Explore its rich heritage before continuing your journey to Mysore. Upon arrival, check in at your hotel and prepare for an afternoon of sightseeing. Visit the magnificent Maharaja’s Palace, a grand Indo-Saracenic masterpiece adorned with ornate interiors. Continue to the Jaganmohan Palace, now an art gallery showcasing exquisite paintings and artifacts. End the day at the Brindavan Gardens, known for its illuminated fountains and vibrant evening light show. Overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Mysore – Hassan (190 km / 5 hrs)
Description: On the tenth day, check out from your hotel in Mysore and drive to Hassan, with a fascinating stop en route at Shravanabelagola. This serene village is renowned for the towering 17-meter statue of Gomateshwara, one of the most important pilgrimage sites for Jains. Afterward, continue to Hassan and check in at your hotel. In the afternoon, explore the remarkable temple towns of Belur and Halebid. Visit the Chennakesava Temple in Belur, celebrated for its exquisite carvings and architectural detail. Then proceed to Halebid, the former capital of the Hoysala Empire, to admire the ornate Hoysaleswara Temple. Overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Hassan – Bangalore (187 km / 4 hrs) – Bangalore – Mumbai (Flight: 9W 418 – 1630 / 1805 hrs)
Description: On the eleventh and final day of your journey, check out from your hotel in Hassan and drive to Bangalore. Upon arrival, you will be transferred to the airport to catch your flight to Mumbai. Once in Mumbai, proceed directly to the international terminal for your onward journey, concluding your enriching and memorable exploration of South India’s cultural, architectural, and spiritual heritage.

Name: South India Temple Tour Package
LocationDescription: Chennai – Mahabalipuram – Pondicherry – Thanjavur – Trichy – Madurai – Bangalore – Mysore - Hassan
Title: South India Temple Tour Package | Spiritual & Pilgrimage Trip
Description: Embark on the best South India temple tour with EazeTours. Explore ancient temples & heritage sites on a spiritual South India pilgrimage journey.
Summary: Embark on a spiritual journey through the sacred temples of South India with our South India temple tour package. This enriching experience offers a deep dive into India's rich religious heritage and vibrant culture. Whether you're from the USA or elsewhere, our tailored tours ensure a seamless and memorable adventure. Ready to explore more of India's spiritual wonders? Consider our Buddhist Pilgrimage Tour Package India, offering a unique opportunity to connect with Buddhist history at some of the most revered sites in the country. Your next adventure awaits!
Overview: Experience the spiritual richness and architectural beauty of South India with our South India Temple Tour Package. South India is home to some of the most revered and historic temples, known for their intricate architecture, grand rituals, and divine atmosphere. From the famous Meenakshi Temple in Madurai to the temple town of Kanchipuram, this tour will take you on a spiritual and cultural journey through Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, and Kerala, offering a glimpse into the ancient practices and traditions of Hinduism.
AdditionalInformation:
• Best Time to Visit: October to March, when the weather is ideal for temple tours.
  • Ideal For: Spiritual seekers, history lovers, and culture enthusiasts.
  • What to Bring: Comfortable clothing (preferably in light fabrics), sunscreen, a hat, and a camera for photography.
  • Fitness Level: Light walking, as temple visits may involve exploring large temple complexes.
  • Surprise gifts at tour end
  • Airport arrival/departure assistance
  • All applicable taxes
WhatsIncluded:
• Comfortable accommodation at hotels and guesthouses
  • Check-in and check-out at 12:00 PM
  • Daily hotel breakfast and dinner
  • Air-conditioned transfers covering airport, station, intercity, and sightseeing (includes parking, tolls, taxes, fuel, and driver allowances)
  • Guided tours of temples and cultural sites
  • Entry fees to temples and monuments
  • Assistance with Darshan and temple rituals
  • English-speaking local guides in all cities
  • Eaze Tour Manager support for the group
  • 2 water bottles per guest per day during sightseeing
  • Welcome garland upon arrival
WhatsExcluded:
• Personal expenses (telephone, tips, minibar, extra beverages, meals beyond breakfast).
  • Airfare, visa fees, and any medical/hospitalization or evacuation expenses.
  • Tips for drivers, guides, or restaurant staff.
  • Any expenses not listed above.

TourCompanion.Name: Temple Tour Expert
TourCompanion.Description: Experienced guide with deep knowledge of South Indian temples, history, and culture

Itinerary.Name: Arrival in Delhi
Description: Upon arrival in Delhi, you will be warmly greeted by our representative and escorted to your hotel for a seamless check-in experience. As you settle in, take the opportunity to unwind and absorb the first impressions of this bustling metropolis, where ancient history meets modern charm. The remainder of the day is at your leisure—whether you choose to relax in the comfort of your hotel or take a short stroll to explore the nearby surroundings, it’s the perfect time to ease into the vibrant energy, diverse culture, and captivating atmosphere of India’s capital city. This initial overnight stay at the hotel marks the beginning of your royal journey, setting the tone for the unforgettable experiences that await.

Itinerary.Name: Delhi Sightseeing
Description: Begin your exploration with a tour of Old Delhi, visiting the iconic Red Fort, Jama Masjid, and Rajghat, the memorial of Mahatma Gandhi. In the afternoon, discover New Delhi’s landmarks, including Qutub Minar, Chhatarpur Temple, Humayun’s Tomb, and the Bahai Lotus Temple. The evening is at leisure to unwind. Overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Delhi to Mandawa (260 km / 6 hrs)
Description: After checkout, embark on a scenic 6-hour drive to the charming town of Mandawa, nestled in the heart of the Shekhawati region and renowned for its intricately fresco-adorned havelis that reflect the rich cultural heritage of Rajasthan. As you journey through the changing landscapes of rural India, soak in the vibrant colors and rustic beauty that hint at the artistic treasures awaiting you. Upon arrival in Mandawa, check into your hotel and take some time to relax before heading out to explore the town's enchanting streets, often referred to as an “open-air gallery” of Rajasthani art and architecture. Stroll past elaborately painted mansions, centuries-old structures, and bustling local markets that offer a glimpse into the town’s glorious past. Enjoy a peaceful evening immersed in history and culture before retiring for an overnight stay in Mandawa.

Itinerary.Name: Mandawa to Bikaner (180 km / 4 hrs)
Description: After breakfast, check out and proceed to Bikaner. Upon arrival, check in at your hotel. Visit Junagarh Fort, built in 1593, which stands as a striking example of Rajasthani architecture, with beautiful palaces within its walls. Explore Lallgarh Palace, a grand structure built by Maharaja Ganga Singh in memory of his father, featuring beautiful lattice and filigree work. Spend the evening at leisure. Overnight at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Bikaner to Khimsar (145 km / 3 hrs)
Description: Check out and drive to Khimsar, with a fascinating stop at Deshnok to visit the famous Karni Mata Temple, renowned for its unique population of sacred rats that freely roam the temple grounds and are considered holy by devotees. This intriguing temple offers a one-of-a-kind spiritual experience unlike any other. After exploring the temple, continue your journey to Khimsar. Upon arrival, check in at the magnificent Khimsar Fort, a centuries-old structure that has been beautifully restored and now operates as a charming heritage hotel. Take time to relax and soak in the royal ambiance, warm hospitality, and historic charm of the fort. The rest of the evening is at your leisure to unwind or explore the surroundings at your own pace. Enjoy an overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Khimsar to Jaisalmer (305 km / 7 hrs)
Description: After breakfast, set out on a scenic drive to Jaisalmer, passing through Osian, an ancient desert town known for its stunning oasis and intricately carved Jain and Brahmanical temples that reflect the region’s rich cultural heritage. Enjoy the changing landscapes as you journey through the Thar Desert, witnessing small villages and sand dunes along the way. Upon arrival in Jaisalmer, often referred to as the 'Golden City' for its yellow sandstone architecture, check in at your hotel and unwind. Spend the evening at leisure, soaking in the unique ambiance of this historic desert.

Itinerary.Name: Jaisalmer Sightseeing
Description: Explore the golden city of Jaisalmer, which rises from the desert like a golden mirage. Visit Jaisalmer Fort, which houses the entire township within its ramparts, and admire the narrow lanes lined with havelis, Jain temples, and interconnected palaces. Discover Patwon-ki-Haveli, an exquisite example of Rajasthani architecture. Visit the Sam Sand Dunes for a camel safari to experience the vast desert. Evening at leisure. Overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Jaisalmer to Jodhpur (290 km / 7 hrs)
Description: Check out and drive to Jodhpur. After arriving and checking in, visit Mehrangarh Fort, an imposing structure perched on a hill, offering stunning views of the city. Also visit Jaswant Thada, a beautiful royal cenotaph built in memory of Maharaja Jaswant Singh II. Enjoy the local market in the evening. Overnight at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Jodhpur to Rohetgarh (45 km / 1 hr)
Description: Drive to Rohetgarh and check in at your hotel. In the afternoon, embark on a jeep safari to explore the Bishnoi villages. The Bishnois are environmentalists who have been preserving the local wildlife for centuries. Visit the villages of craftsmen such as potters, weavers, and metalworkers. Evening at leisure. Overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Rohetgarh to Udaipur (240 km / 6 hrs)
Description: Drive to Udaipur, with a visit to the magnificent Ranakpur Jain Temples en route. Nestled in a serene valley of the Aravalli Hills, these temples are renowned for their stunning marble architecture, intricate carvings, and the impressive 1,444 uniquely carved pillars that support the main temple. The peaceful ambiance and architectural brilliance make it one of the most important Jain pilgrimage sites in India. After exploring the temple complex and soaking in its spiritual atmosphere, continue your scenic drive to Udaipur, also known as the City of Lakes. Upon arrival, check in at your hotel and take some time to relax. Overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Udaipur Sightseeing
Description: Explore Udaipur, the 'City of Dawn,' nestled around tranquil lakes and surrounded by lush hills. Visit the City Palace, a magnificent architectural marvel overlooking Lake Pichola. Discover Jagdish Temple, a stunning Indo-Aryan temple built in 1651, and Sahelion-ki-Bari, a beautiful garden with fountains and marble elephants. Enjoy a boat ride on Lake Pichola, where you'll visit Jag Mandir and the Lake Palace. Overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Udaipur to Pushkar (240 km / 6 hrs)
Description: Check out and drive to Pushkar, a charming town known for its spiritual significance and vibrant culture, arriving in the afternoon. Upon arrival, check in at your hotel and take some time to relax before heading out to explore. Later, visit the serene Pushkar Lake, a sacred site steeped in mythology and associated with Lord Brahma, where pilgrims come to take a holy dip. Stroll around the lake’s ghats and soak in the peaceful atmosphere. Next, explore the bustling local market filled with colorful handicrafts, traditional clothing, and souvenirs. Don’t miss a visit to the famous Brahma Temple, one of the very few temples in the world dedicated to Lord Brahma, offering a rare spiritual experience. Enjoy the unique vibe of the town before returning for an overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Pushkar to Jaipur (130 km / 2.5 hrs)
Description: Check out and drive to Jaipur, the capital city of Rajasthan. Upon arrival, check in at your hotel. In the afternoon, visit the City Palace, a stunning blend of Rajasthani and Mughal architecture. Explore Jantar Mantar, an astronomical observatory built in 1726. Drive to the Palace of Winds (Hawa Mahal), a five-story palace with a unique façade designed for the royal ladies to observe street life. Overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Jaipur Sightseeing
Description: Embark on an unforgettable excursion to the majestic Amber Fort, a grand structure perched atop a scenic hill, offering panoramic views of the surrounding landscape. Accessible by an optional and traditional elephant ride, the journey to the fort itself is a unique experience that captures the royal charm of Rajasthan. Within its impressive walls, the fort houses architectural marvels such as the elegant Marble Palace, the awe-inspiring Temple of Victory, and the mesmerizing Hall of Mirrors, known for its intricate mirror work that sparkles with reflected light. In the afternoon, unwind with free time to relax at your own pace or explore the local markets, where you can shop for traditional crafts, textiles, and souvenirs. Conclude your day with an overnight stay at the hotel, soaking in the cultural richness and regal ambiance of the region.

Itinerary.Name: Jaipur to Agra (235 km / 6 hrs)
Description: Check out and drive to Agra, with a visit to Fatehpur Sikri en route. Explore the abandoned capital of Emperor Akbar, a fascinating site with architectural wonders. Continue your journey to Agra and check in at your hotel. Rest of the day at leisure. Overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Agra to Delhi (204 km / 4.5 hrs) Departure
Description: Start the day with a visit to the magnificent Taj Mahal, the breathtaking symbol of eternal love built in white marble by Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his beloved wife, Mumtaz Mahal. Marvel at the intricate craftsmanship and serene beauty of this UNESCO World Heritage Site, as the morning light casts a golden glow on its stunning façade. After soaking in the splendor of the Taj, head to the historic Agra Fort, a majestic red sandstone fortress that once served as the main residence of the Mughal emperors. Wander through its impressive halls and palaces, and enjoy spectacular views of the Taj Mahal from the fort’s iconic octagonal tower. Later in the day, embark on a comfortable drive back to Delhi, where you will proceed with your onward journey, carrying with you unforgettable memories of Agra’s timeless charm.

Name: Royal Delhi, Jaipur & Agra Golden Triangle Tour Package
LocationDescription: Delhi – Mandawa – Bikaner – Khimsar – Jasailmer – Jodhpur – Rohetgarh – Ranakpur – Udaipur – Pushkar – Jaipur – Agra – Delhi
Title: Royal Golden Triangle Tour India | Delhi, Agra & Jaipur Trip
Description: Experience a royal India tour with our Golden Triangle package. Discover majestic forts, palaces & heritage sites in Delhi, Agra & Jaipur with EazeTours.
Summary: Embark on a journey through India’s rich history and culture with our Golden Triangle Tour Package. Visit iconic landmarks, experience vibrant cities, and immerse yourself in the soul of India. Whether you're traveling from the USA or elsewhere, our meticulously crafted tours promise an unforgettable adventure. Ready for a royal experience? Explore our Palace on Wheels Tour Package India for a luxurious train journey that takes you through India’s royal heritage. Let your dream vacation begin today!
Overview: Experience the grandeur of India’s royal past with our Royal Delhi, Jaipur & Agra Tour Package. This package takes you through three of the most iconic cities in India – Delhi, Jaipur, and Agra. Explore majestic forts, palaces, and architectural marvels, and immerse yourself in the rich culture and history of India’s royal heritage. From the bustling streets of Delhi to the romantic Taj Mahal in Agra and the royal palaces of Jaipur, this tour offers an unforgettable experience of India's regal legacy.
AdditionalInformation:
• Best Time to Visit: October to March, when the weather is cool and pleasant for sightseeing.
  • Ideal For: History enthusiasts, culture lovers, and those interested in royal heritage.
  • What to Bring: Comfortable clothing and shoes, sunscreen, a hat, and a camera for capturing the beauty.
  • Fitness Level: Light walking involved during visits to forts, palaces, and monuments.
  • Surprise gifts at the end of the tour
  • Assistance with airport arrival and departure
  • All applicable taxes included
