TourCompanion.Name: Golden Triangle Tour Guides
TourCompanion.Description: Expert local guides for historical insights, photography, and cultural immersion

Itinerary.Name: Arrive in Delhi
Description: Upon landing in Delhi, you will be warmly greeted and transferred to your hotel. The rest of the day is yours to relax or explore the vibrant surroundings at your leisure. Settle in for an overnight stay, preparing for the cultural immersion ahead.

Itinerary.Name: Delhi Sightseeing
Description: Begin your exploration of Delhi with a morning tour of Old Delhi’s historical gems. Visit the majestic Red Fort, a UNESCO World Heritage Site built by Emperor Shah Jahan, followed by the sprawling Jama Masjid, India’s largest mosque. Pay homage at Rajghat, Mahatma Gandhi’s memorial. In the afternoon, delve into New Delhi’s highlights, including the towering Qutub Minar, the serene Chhatarpur Temple, and Humayun’s Tomb, a precursor to the Taj Mahal’s architecture. Conclude with a visit to the Lotus Temple, a symbol of unity and meditation. Enjoy a free evening before retiring to your hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Delhi to Jaipur (Drive: 265 km / 6 hrs)
Description: After breakfast, embark on a scenic 6-hour drive to Jaipur, the “Pink City.” Check into your hotel and embark on an afternoon tour. Explore the opulent City Palace, home to royal artifacts, and marvel at the astronomical instruments of Jantar Mantar. Admire the intricate façade of Hawa Mahal, the Palace of Winds, before returning to your hotel for an overnight stay.

Itinerary.Name: Jaipur
Description: Start your day with an excursion to Amber Fort, ascending its hilltop location via a traditional elephant ride. Discover its ornate Marble Palace, Hall of Mirrors, and Temple of Victory. The afternoon is free to wander through Jaipur’s bustling bazaars, perfect for picking up handicrafts and textiles. Overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Jaipur to Agra (Drive: 235 km / 6 hrs)
Description: Depart early for Agra, pausing en route at Fatehpur Sikri, Emperor Akbar’s abandoned sandstone capital. Upon arrival in Agra, visit the iconic Taj Mahal at sunset, witnessing its marble splendor glow in the golden light. Later, explore Agra Fort, offering panoramic views of the Taj from its ramparts. Overnight stay in Agra.

Itinerary.Name: Agra to Jhansi
Description: After breakfast, take a train to Jhansi, followed by a drive to Khajuraho. Check into your hotel and embark on a tour of the UNESCO-listed Khajuraho temples. Marvel at the intricate erotic sculptures and architectural brilliance of Kandariya Mahadeo Temple, Chausath Yogini, and others. Overnight in Khajuraho.

Itinerary.Name: Khajuraho to Varanasi
Description: Check out from your hotel and transfer to the airport for a flight to Varanasi. Upon arrival, you will be assisted and transferred to your hotel. In the afternoon, visit the Vishwanath Temple, also known as the Golden Temple, which was erected by Rani Ahalayabai Holkar and has a gold-plated spire. Explore the Bharat Mata Temple, dedicated to Mother India, and the Tulsi Manas Temple, dedicated to Lord Rama. The evening is free for you to wander through the local markets. Overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Varanasi to Delhi
Description: Early in the morning, take a boat ride on the Ganges River, experiencing the spiritual atmosphere. Later, take a trip to Sarnath, an important Buddhist site, where Lord Buddha gave his first sermon. Visit the Dhamek Stupa and the nearby Sarnath Museum, which houses the famous Ashoka Pillar. Afterward, check out from your hotel and transfer to the airport for your flight back to Delhi. Upon arrival, check-in at your hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Departure from Delhi
Description: After enjoying a hearty breakfast, complete the check-out process at your hotel and prepare for your transfer to Delhi’s international airport. As you make your way to the airport, take a moment to reflect on the unforgettable experiences and memories you've gathered throughout your journey. From vibrant cities and sacred temples to centuries-old monuments and bustling local markets, every stop along the way offered a unique glimpse into India’s rich cultural heritage and spiritual depth. With your heart full and your spirit enriched, bid farewell to this incredible land as you board your flight for your onward journey, bringing to a close a truly transformative and inspiring tour of India’s cultural and spiritual treasures.

Summary: Embark on an unforgettable journey through the cultural and historical treasures of North India with our Classical North India tour package. Perfect for travelers from the USA seeking a deep dive into the region's rich heritage, this tour offers a blend of iconic landmarks and authentic experiences. Ready to explore even more? Check out our North India Temple tour package for a spiritual journey or browse our other luxury tour packages inside India to tailor your perfect trip. Your adventure through India awaits!
Overview: Explore the timeless beauty and cultural heritage of India with our Classical Delhi, Jaipur, Agra, Khajuraho & Varanasi Tour Package. This carefully crafted tour offers a rich blend of royal grandeur, architectural marvels, spiritual exploration, and cultural experiences. From the historical landmarks of Delhi to the world-famous Taj Mahal in Agra, the stunning temples of Khajuraho, and the spiritual heart of India, Varanasi, this tour takes you through the best of India’s cultural and historical treasures.

Address.AddressRegion: Delhi, Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Varanasi

TourCompanion.Name: India Culture and History Guide Team
TourCompanion.Description: Experienced tour guides specializing in India's rich culture, history, and spirituality

Itinerary.Name: Arrive in Delhi
Description: Upon arrival in Delhi, you will be warmly welcomed by a representative who will greet you with traditional Indian hospitality and assist you with your luggage. You’ll then be comfortably transferred to your hotel in a private vehicle, where you can relax and unwind after your journey. As you drive through the bustling streets of the capital, you’ll catch your first glimpses of Delhi’s vibrant culture, historic architecture, and energetic atmosphere. Once checked in, the rest of the day is at your leisure to settle in, explore nearby areas, or simply enjoy the hotel amenities.

Itinerary.Name: Delhi Sightseeing
Description: The day starts with a guided tour of Old Delhi, a city with deep historical roots. Your first visit will be the Red Fort, constructed by the Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan.  Next, you’ll visit Jama Masjid, one of the largest mosques in India.  You will then continue to Rajghat, the memorial to Mahatma Gandhi.  In the afternoon, you will explore New Delhi, starting with the Qutub Minar, the tallest stone tower in India, built in 1191 AD. You’ll also visit Chhatarpur Temple, a popular Hindu temple known for its peaceful and serene atmosphere, and Humayun’s Tomb, believed to have been designed by his widow, which influenced later Mughal tombs, including the Taj Mahal.  The day concludes with a visit to the Bahai Temple, a lotus-shaped structure open to all faiths, ideal for meditation and tranquility.

Itinerary.Name: Delhi to Jaipur (Drive: 265 km / 6 hrs)
Description: You will check out from the hotel and drive to Jaipur.  Upon arrival, you will check in at the hotel.  In the afternoon, you'll enjoy a sightseeing tour of Jaipur.  You will visit the City Palace, a stunning complex with palaces and museums filled with royal collections. Next, you will explore the Jantar Mantar, an astronomical observatory built by King Jai Singh in 1726, featuring precision instruments.  Lastly, you will visit the Hawa Mahal, also known as the Palace of Winds, a five-story structure with a beautiful façade of windows and latticed screens.

Itinerary.Name: Jaipur
Description: In the morning, you will go on an excursion to Amber Fort, perched on a hill.  You’ll enjoy an elephant ride to enter the fort, which includes the Marble Palace, Temple of Victory, and the Hall of Mirrors. The afternoon is spent exploring the vibrant bazaars of Jaipur.  You will stay overnight at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Jaipur to Ranthambore (Drive: 115 km / 3 hrs)
Description: You will check out of the hotel and drive to Ranthambore. Upon arrival, you will check in at the hotel. Ranthambore National Park is renowned for its tiger population and offers excellent opportunities to see these majestic creatures in their natural habitat.  The park covers nearly 400 sq. km, nestled between the Aravali and Vindhya mountain ranges.  In the afternoon, you'll enjoy an exciting Jeep safari in the park.  You will stay overnight at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Ranthambore
Description: The day starts early with an exciting Jeep safari through the national park, giving you the perfect opportunity to witness the breathtaking beauty of the landscape as the sun rises and the wildlife begins to stir. Keep your eyes open for majestic creatures like tigers, elephants, deer, and a variety of bird species as you venture deep into the wilderness. After a break and some time to unwind, you will head back into the park for another Jeep safari in the afternoon, offering a fresh chance to explore different areas and spot more of the region’s diverse flora and fauna. The evening is yours to relax—perhaps enjoy a peaceful walk around the hotel grounds, indulge in a delicious local dinner, or simply reflect on the day's adventures. You will stay overnight at the hotel, resting up for the journey ahead.

Itinerary.Name: Ranthambore to Bharatpur to Agra
Description: After breakfast, you will transfer to the Sawai Madhopur railway station to board the train to Bharatpur. Upon arrival, you will be met by a naturalist for a bird-watching tour at Keoladeo Ghana National Park (Bharatpur Bird Sanctuary), known for its diverse birdlife, including the rare Siberian cranes.  After the birding tour, you’ll proceed to Agra, stopping en route to visit Fatehpur Sikri, the deserted capital city of Emperor Akbar.  Upon arrival in Agra, you will check in at the hotel for an overnight stay.

Itinerary.Name: Agra to Umaria
Description: The day begins with a visit to the iconic Taj Mahal, built by Emperor Shah Jahan.  You'll also explore Agra Fort, which offers magnificent views of the Taj Mahal.  Other sites include Itmad-ud-Daulah, often referred to as the 'Baby Taj.'  In the late afternoon, you'll check out from the hotel and transfer to the railway station to board the train for Umaria (Kalinga Utkal Express, departure at 16:15 hrs).  You will spend the night on board the train.

Itinerary.Name: Arrive in Umaria and transfer to Bandhavgarh (Drive: 45 km / 1 hr)
Description: You'll arrive in Umaria in the early morning and drive to Bandhavgarh.  Upon arrival, you will check in at the hotel. Bandhavgarh National Park, located in Madhya Pradesh, is known for its tiger population and beautiful landscapes.  The park spans over 448 square kilometers and offers excellent opportunities for wildlife sightings.  In the afternoon, you'll enjoy a Jeep safari in the park, and the evening is free for leisure.  You will stay overnight at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Bandhavgarh
Description: The day starts early with an exhilarating Jeep safari at Bandhavgarh National Park, giving you a chance to witness the jungle come alive in the soft morning light. As you drive through the park’s dense forests and open meadows, keep an eye out for Bengal tigers, leopards, and a variety of bird species that call this region home. After a refreshing break and some leisure time at the hotel, you’ll head out again in the afternoon for another thrilling Jeep safari, offering new opportunities to spot wildlife and experience the park’s diverse landscapes. As the sun sets, the evening is yours to unwind—whether you choose to relax at the hotel, reflect on the day’s adventures, or simply enjoy the natural surroundings. You’ll spend the night in comfortable accommodations, ready for more exploration the next day.

Itinerary.Name: Bandhavgarh to Kanha (Drive: 240 km / 6 hrs)
Description: You will check out from the hotel and drive to Kanha National Park, one of the world’s most well-known tiger reserves. Located in Madhya Pradesh, the park covers an area of 1,945 square kilometers and is home to diverse wildlife. Upon arrival, you will check in at the hotel.  In the afternoon, you'll head out for a Jeep safari in the park.  The evening is free for leisure, and you will stay overnight at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Kanha
Description: You'll have an early morning Jeep safari in Kanha National Park, where you’ll venture deep into the heart of the jungle just as the forest begins to wake up. This is the best time to spot a variety of wildlife in their natural habitat, including the majestic Royal Bengal tiger, deer, leopards, and a wide array of birds. After a break and some time to unwind, you'll head out again later in the afternoon for another thrilling Jeep safari to explore more of the park’s diverse ecosystem and catch glimpses of animals that may have remained hidden earlier. As the sun sets and the forest winds down for the night, you'll return to your hotel. The evening is free for you to relax, enjoy the serene surroundings, or reflect on the day's adventures. You will stay overnight at the hotel, recharging for another exciting day ahead.

Itinerary.Name: Kanha to Jabalpur (Drive: 160 km / 4 hrs) to New Delhi
Description: You will check out from the hotel in the morning after breakfast, ensuring you have ample time to gather your belongings and complete any remaining formalities. Following your departure, you will embark on a scenic drive to the Jabalpur railway station, allowing you to soak in the last glimpses of the region’s charm. Upon arrival at the station, you will prepare to board the Mahakaushal Express, which is scheduled to depart for Delhi at 16:10 hrs. Make sure to reach the platform well in advance to ensure a smooth boarding experience. Once aboard, you will settle into your reserved berth and begin your overnight journey toward the capital city. You will spend the night comfortably on the train, experiencing a restful travel experience as you continue your adventure.

Itinerary.Name: Arrive in Delhi and depart for your onward destination
Description: You'll arrive in Delhi, where a representative will warmly welcome you and assist with your transfer to the hotel. After checking in, you’ll have the rest of the day at your leisure to relax, explore the vibrant city at your own pace, or enjoy some last-minute shopping or sightseeing. Later in the evening, you will check out from the hotel and be driven comfortably to the international airport. There, you'll complete departure formalities and board your onward flight, carrying unforgettable memories of your journey.

Name: India's Wildlife Tour Packages: A Journey into the Wild
LocationDescription: Delhi – Jaipur – Ranthambore – Bharatpur – Agra – Umaria – Bandhavgarhh – Kanha – Jabalpur
Title: Tiger Safari in India | Best Tiger Safari Tour India Package
Description: Book your India Tiger Safari Package with EazeTours. Explore top tiger reserves on an unforgettable tiger safari tour in India with expert wildlife guides.
Summary: Embark on an unforgettable adventure through India's stunning wildlife with our wildlife safari tour packages. Experience the rich biodiversity and natural beauty of India, from lush jungles to serene landscapes, while encountering rare and majestic species. Whether you're from the USA or elsewhere, we offer customized packages to make your journey seamless and memorable. Ready for a more thrilling adventure? Explore our Tiger Safari Tour Package for an exclusive experience with the majestic Bengal Tiger. Plus, take a look at our tours to India from the USA to find the perfect trip that suits your travel desires. Your wildlife adventure awaits!
Overview: Over 100 national parks and wildlife sanctuaries call India their home beckoning nature buffs and thrill-seekers. Whether it's prowling around the tiger-dense forests of Ranthambore and Bandhavgarh, following the paths of elephants in Periyar, or watching birds in Bharatpur's paradise, India caters to each wildlife admirer's taste. These excursions mix thrills, learning, and preservation efforts letting folks see amazing life variety while aiding its safeguarding.
AdditionalInformation:
• Prime Time for Going: You wanna aim for October to June. Spotting animals is super when it's not raining.
  • How Long It Lasts: Choices vary from short 3-day breaks to full 10-day deep dives.
  • Making It Yours: They can tweak the adventures depending on what you're into, like snapping pics of animals or just watching them for fun.
  • All sightseeing rides are arranged as per the itinerary
  • The package can be modified to suit client interests

  • Check-in and check-out at 12:00 PM
  • Daily breakfast and dinner at the hotel
  • Air-conditioned vehicle transfers for airport, station, intercity, and sightseeing with all associated charges (parking, toll, taxes, fuel, driver allowance)

  • English-speaking local guides in all cities
  • Eaze Tour Manager accompaniment as per group size

  • Welcome garland at arrival

  • Airfare, visa fees, and any medical/hospitalization or evacuation expenses.

  • Any expenses not listed above.

TourCompanion.Description: Expert naturalist, safari guide, medical vehicle, first-aid kit

Itinerary.Name: Arrive in Delhi
Description: You'll arrive in Delhi, where a representative will warmly welcome you and assist with your transfer to the hotel. After checking in, you’ll have the rest of the day at your leisure to relax, explore the vibrant city at your own pace, or enjoy some last-minute shopping or sightseeing. Later in the evening, you will check out from the hotel and be driven comfortably to the international airport. There, you'll complete departure formalities and board your onward flight, carrying unforgettable memories of your journey.

Itinerary.Name: Delhi Sightseeing
Description: Your day begins with a sightseeing tour of Old Delhi, a city known for its rich historical tapestry.  The first stop is the Red Fort, constructed by the Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan.  A short drive will take you to the Jama Masjid, one of India's largest mosques.  You will then continue to Rajghat, the memorial dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi.  In the afternoon, you will explore New Delhi, with visits to the Qutub Minar, the tallest stone tower in India, built in 1191 AD.  You will also visit Chhatarpur Temple, known for its peaceful atmosphere, and Humayun’s Tomb, which served as an inspiration for the Taj Mahal and many later Mughal tombs.  The last visit of the day is to the Bahai Temple, a stunning lotus-shaped structure that welcomes people of all faiths.  Afterward, you will check out from the hotel and be transferred to the railway station to board the overnight train to Bikaner.  You will spend the night on the train.

Itinerary.Name: Bikaner to Gajner (Drive: 45 km / 1 hr)
Description: Upon arrival in Bikaner, you will receive assistance and be transferred to the Gajner Palace.  After checking in, you can spend the rest of the day at leisure. You have the option to explore the palace surroundings in horse-drawn carriages (buggies) or open jeeps, or take a nature walk in the nearby forest.  You will stay overnight at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Gajner to Bikaner and back to Gajner
Description: In the morning, you will enjoy a sightseeing tour of Bikaner, starting with a visit to Junagarh Fort, built by Raja Rai Singhji in the 16th century.  The tour continues to Devi Kund Sagar, a royal cremation site featuring beautiful cenotaphs (Chhatris) of Bikaner’s rulers.  The architecture of these cenotaphs is a significant highlight, with Maharaja Surat Singh’s Chhatri being a stunning example of white marble and Rajput painting.  Later, you will visit the Deshnok Temple, dedicated to Karni Mata, an incarnation of Durga, which is famous for its rats, considered sacred by devotees.  In the evening, you will return to Gajner to relax, with an overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Gajner to Mandawa (Drive: 250 km / 6 hrs)
Description: After checking out from the hotel, you will drive to Mandawa, a quaint town in the heart of Rajasthan known for its rich cultural heritage and historical significance. Upon arrival, you will check in at the beautifully restored Hotel Castle Mandawa, a former royal residence that offers a glimpse into the region’s regal past. The rest of the day is spent exploring this charming town, renowned for its stunning Havelis adorned with intricate frescoes and detailed artwork that reflect the opulence of a bygone era. As you wander through the narrow lanes, you'll discover architectural marvels and hidden gems that tell stories of merchant families and royal influences. You will stay overnight at the hotel, enjoying the peaceful ambiance and traditional hospitality.

Itinerary.Name: Mandawa to Nawalgarh and back to Mandawa
Description: In the morning, you will drive to Nawalgarh, a historic town founded in the 18th century, famous for its vibrant frescoes in the Shekhawati region.  The sightseeing includes visits to prominent havelis such as Anandilal Poddar Haveli, Aath Haveli, and Hodh Raj Patodia Haveli.  You will also explore the two forts of Nawalgarh and visit Roop Niwas Palace, a heritage hotel known for its painted rooms and luxurious interiors.  In the evening, you will return to Mandawa for an overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Mandawa to Dundlod and back to Mandawa
Description: In the morning, you will drive to Dundlod, a charming town in the heart of Rajasthan’s Shekhawati region, known for its historical richness and timeless appeal. Here, you will visit Dundlod Fort, a stunning blend of Rajput and Mughal architecture that reflects the grandeur of a bygone era. As you explore the fort’s intricate cultural motifs, ancient furniture, and beautifully carved interiors, you’ll be transported back in time to the royal heritage of Rajasthan. The serene atmosphere and scenic views from the fort provide a perfect backdrop for reflection and photography. You may also stroll through the surrounding village to witness the traditional lifestyle and local craftsmanship. Later in the day, you will return to Mandawa for an overnight stay at the hotel, where you can relax and unwind after a day of cultural discovery.

Itinerary.Name: Mandawa to Jaipur (Drive: 151 km / 3 ½ hrs)
Description: You will check out of the hotel and drive to Jaipur, famously known as the Rose Pink City for its stunning pink-hued architecture and rich cultural heritage. Upon your arrival, you will check in at your hotel and take some time to settle in and refresh. The rest of the evening is yours to enjoy at leisure—you can explore the vibrant local markets filled with colorful textiles, traditional handicrafts, and delicious street food. Take in the lively atmosphere, maybe even bargain for a souvenir or two. After an exciting evening of discovery, return to your hotel for a comfortable overnight stay.

Itinerary.Name: Jaipur
Description: The day starts with an excursion to Amber Fort, built in 1592 by Raja Man Singh. This fort, perched on a hill with stunning valley views, is a prime example of Rajput architecture, later expanded by Sawai Jai Singh. You will explore its massive gates, courts, stairways, pavilions, and beautiful palaces. In the afternoon, you will visit the City Palace, home to several palaces and museums that showcase royal collections and artifacts. Next, you will visit Jantar Mantar, the observatory built by King Jai Singh in 1726, which houses precise astronomical instruments. The day concludes with a visit to Hawa Mahal, a stunning five-story structure featuring latticed windows that allowed royal women to view the city streets. You will stay overnight at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Jaipur to Delhi (Drive: 265 km / 5 ½ hrs)
Description: After breakfast, you will check out of the hotel and begin your drive back to Delhi, enjoying the scenic journey one last time. Sit back, relax, and reflect on the wonderful experiences of your trip as you travel through the heart of India. Upon arrival in Delhi, you will be transferred directly to the International Airport, where our team will assist you with the check-in process for your onward flight. We hope you leave with unforgettable memories and look forward to welcoming you again in the future.

Name: Shekhawati Havelis Delhi-Bikaner-Mandawa-Jaipur Tour: A Cultural Journey
Title: Sekhawati Havelis Tour: Delhi, Bikaner, Mandawa, Jaipur
Description: Explore the stunning Sekhawati Havelis in Delhi, Bikaner, Mandawa, and Jaipur. Experience India’s rich culture and architecture with Eaze Tours. Book Now!
Summary: Embark on a memorable adventure with our Shekhawati Tour Packages and explore the unique beauty of Rajasthan’s fresco-painted havelis and vibrant culture. Whether you're planning your next trip from the USA or seeking an unforgettable Indian experience, this tour offers a blend of history, art, and local charm. For a luxurious journey, consider our India’s Golden Triangle Tour Package, covering iconic landmarks like Delhi, Agra, and Jaipur. Also, take a moment to browse through our other tours to India from the USA for even more inspiring travel experiences. Your dream vacation awaits!
Overview: Explore the grandeur of Shekhawati’s painted havelis, the royal charm of Jaipur, and the historical treasures of Delhi and Bikaner. This tour is perfect for history enthusiasts and art lovers seeking an immersive cultural experience.

Itinerary.Name: Arrive Mumbai
Description: Upon arrival in Mumbai, you will be greeted and transferred to your hotel. The remainder of the day is at leisure to relax and acclimate to the vibrant city. Enjoy an overnight stay at the hotel, preparing for the exploration ahead.

Itinerary.Name: Explore Mumbai
Description: Begin your day with a half-day city tour of Mumbai, immersing yourself in its bustling energy and colonial heritage. Visit iconic landmarks such as the Gateway of India, Prince of Wales Museum, Marine Drive, and Mani Bhawan (Gandhi House). Stroll through Kamla Nehru Park and the Hanging Gardens for panoramic views. Experience Mumbai’s vibrant nightlife and cultural diversity before returning to the hotel for an overnight stay.

Itinerary.Name: Mumbai to Bangalore
Description: Check out from the hotel and transfer to Mumbai Airport for your flight to Bangalore. Upon arrival, settle into your hotel before embarking on a sightseeing tour. Explore Bangalore’s lush parks, including Cubbon Park and Lalbagh Gardens, and admire architectural marvels like the neo-Dravidian Vidhana Soudha. Discover historical sites such as Tipu Sultan’s Palace and the ancient Bull Temple. Overnight stay in Bangalore.

Itinerary.Name: Bangalore – Hassan (Drive: 190 km / 5 hrs approx)
Description: Depart Bangalore and drive to Hassan, stopping en route at Shravanbelagola, a village famed for its Jain heritage. In Hassan, visit the UNESCO-listed Hoysala temples of Belur and Halebid. Marvel at the intricate carvings of the 12th-century Chennakesava Temple in Belur and the Hoysaleswara Temple in Halebid, remnants of the Hoysala Empire. Return to Hassan for an overnight stay. Belur – Situated on the banks of the Yagachi River, Belur was the capital of the Hoysala Empire 800 years ago. The town is home to one of the greatest monuments of medieval India, the 12th-century Chennakesava Temple, which commemorates the victory of the Hoysalas over the Cholas in the Battle of Talakad. The temple’s exterior is adorned with intricate sculptures and friezes, while its interior features exquisite panels and richly carved pillars. A tall stone pillar in the temple courtyard is balanced only by its center of gravity. Halebid – Halebid, once the capital of the Hoysala Empire known as Dwarasamudra, was founded in the early 11th century AD. After being raided by the Delhi Sultanate armies in 1311 and 1327, the city was deserted and came to be known as Halebid or the Old Capital. The Hoysaleswara Temple, dedicated to Lord Shiva, is a prominent surviving structure from the ancient city.

Itinerary.Name: Hassan – Mysore (Drive: 120 km / 3 hrs approx)
Description: After breakfast, drive to Mysore, pausing at Srirangapatna to explore Tipu Sultan’s summer palace and island fortress. In Mysore, visit the opulent Maharaja’s Palace, adorned with a golden throne, and the Jaganmohan Palace Art Gallery. Conclude the day with a visit to the illuminated Brindavan Gardens, famed for its musical fountains. Overnight in Mysore.

Itinerary.Name: Mysore – Ooty (Drive: 160 km / 5 hrs approx)
Description: Journey to Ooty, a serene hill station nestled in the breathtaking Nilgiri Mountains, known for its lush greenery, picturesque valleys, and pleasant weather. As you make your way through winding roads and scenic landscapes, take in the fresh mountain air and mesmerizing views. Upon arrival, check into your hotel, where you can unwind and relax after your journey. Spend the evening at leisure, strolling through the charming town, exploring nearby attractions, or simply soaking in the cool climate and misty surroundings. Enjoy a peaceful overnight stay in Ooty, preparing for the adventures that await.

Itinerary.Name: Ooty
Description: Start your day with a delightful sightseeing tour of Ooty, where the scenic hill slopes are adorned with lush tea estates, rolling downs, and tranquil lakes, all set against the backdrop of a refreshing climate. Begin by exploring the renowned Botanical Gardens, established in 1847 by the Marquis of Tweeddale, which boast an impressive collection of exotic and ornamental plants, along with a fascinating fossil tree trunk estimated to be 20 million years old. Next, immerse yourself in the serene beauty of Ooty Lake, where you can enjoy a paddle boating experience, though parts of the lake have become weed-locked over time. Continue your journey to the enchanting Rose Garden, home to an astonishing 1,919 varieties of roses, creating a mesmerizing floral display. As you delve into the town’s rich colonial heritage, visit historic British landmarks such as the gothic-style St. Stephen’s Church, built in 1820, the iconic Stone House bungalow, and Raj Bhawan, a grand structure dating back to 1877. For those interested in religious history, a visit to Kandal Cross is a must. This Roman Catholic shrine is believed to house a relic of the True Cross, earning Ooty the revered title of the 'Jerusalem of the East.' As the evening approaches, take some free time to unwind and enjoy the serene atmosphere at your own pace. Conclude your day with an overnight stay at your hotel, resting amidst the tranquil beauty of Ooty.

Itinerary.Name: Ooty– Cochin (Drive: 285 km / 8 hrs)
Description: After an early morning check-out from the hotel, begin your journey toward Cochin, enjoying the scenic drive through lush landscapes and picturesque views. Upon arrival in Cochin, proceed with a smooth check-in at your hotel, where you can unwind and relax after your journey. Take some time to explore the hotel's amenities or step out to get a glimpse of the city's vibrant culture and historic charm. Later, return to your hotel for a comfortable and restful overnight stay, preparing for the adventures that await in this beautiful coastal city.

Itinerary.Name: Cochin – Kumarakom (Drive: 51 km / 1.5 hrs approx)
Description: Begin your day in Cochin, a historic port city where the echoes of colonial past blend seamlessly with its dynamic present. Stroll through the bustling streets, where old-world charm meets modern vibrance, and take in the sights of heritage buildings and lively markets. Venture into the serene backwaters, where tranquil lagoons and golden-hued sunsets paint an idyllic scene, framed by swaying coconut palms. As you explore the city's waterfront, discover picturesque islands like Vypeen, Willingdon, Ramanthuruth, Vallarpadam, and Bolghatty, each adding to Cochin’s breathtaking cityscape. Step into history with a visit to the Jewish Synagogue, India’s oldest, adorned with exquisite Belgian chandeliers and hand-painted tiles. Nearby, the Mattancherry Palace, once the regal residence of the Maharajas, showcases captivating murals and royal artifacts. No visit to Cochin is complete without witnessing the iconic Chinese fishing nets, an ancient technique believed to have originated from Kubla Khan’s court and still practiced today by local fishermen. As the day winds down, check out from your hotel and embark on a scenic drive to Kumarakom, a charming backwater destination. Upon arrival, check in to your hotel and relax, soaking in the serene atmosphere of this tranquil retreat. Spend a peaceful night at your hotel, preparing for more adventures ahead.

Itinerary.Name: Kumarakom – Periyar (Drive: 122 km / 4 hrs approx)
Description: Begin your day with a leisurely morning, allowing yourself time to relax and soak in the surroundings. Later, check out from the hotel and embark on a journey to Periyar, a renowned wildlife sanctuary and one of Kerala’s most captivating destinations. As you arrive, check in at your hotel and prepare for an afternoon filled with adventure. A scenic boat cruise on the tranquil Periyar Lake awaits, offering a rare chance to observe wildlife in their natural habitat. As you glide through the waters, keep an eye out for wild elephants, the mighty gaur, graceful deer, wild boars, and the elusive Nilgiri langur. The sanctuary is home to an incredible variety of fauna, including tigers, sambars, barking deer, mouse deer, Nilgiri tahr, wild dogs, porcupines, lion-tailed macaques, Malabar giant squirrels, and sloth bears. Bird enthusiasts will be thrilled by the opportunity to spot vibrant species such as hornbills, blue-winged parakeets, whistling thrushes, flycatchers, and numerous water birds. As the day winds down, enjoy a relaxing evening at leisure, immersing yourself in the serene ambiance of Periyar before retiring for an overnight stay at your hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Periyar – Madurai (Drive: 160 km / 5 hrs approx)
Description: In the morning, you'll check out of the hotel and proceed to Madurai. Upon arrival, check into your hotel. The afternoon features a sightseeing tour of Madurai, including a visit to the Meenakshi Sundareswarar Temple, located centrally within the town, where you can admire the immense gopurams and explore the intricately carved temple complex, a significant pilgrimage and tourist site. The tour also includes the Tirumalai Nayak Temple, known for its Indo-Saracenic architectural style, where you'll see its impressive pillars, ranging from 4 to 12 meters, and its enormous domes. You'll also visit the Palace Building within the Tirumalai Nayak Temple, noting its beautiful arches and unique ornamental workmanship, and Vandiyur Mariamman Tank, a large temple tank with a central mandapam measuring 304.8 meters on each side. Madurai's traditional handicrafts, particularly those made from brass and bronze, are also a point of interest. The evening is yours to enjoy at leisure, with an opportunity to explore the local market, followed by an overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Madurai – Tiruchirapali (Drive: 128 km / 3 hrs approx)
Description: Upon arrival, you'll check in at the hotel.  The afternoon features a sightseeing tour of Tiruchirapalli, starting with the Rock Fort, which is perched on a massive rock 83 meters above the plains.  You'll also visit the Rock Fort Temple, built by the Nayak of Madurai, and learn about its historical significance during the Carnatic battles of the 18th century.  The tour includes Srirangam, a picturesque island between the Cauvery River and its tributary Kollidam, located north of Tiruchirapalli.  You'll also get to see the Sri Ranganathaswamy Temple, one of the largest Vaishnavite temples in South India, dating back to the 13th and 14th centuries, and marvel at its 21 magnificent towers, stone pillars with intricate carvings, and the seven walls surrounding the temple complex.  The evening offers leisure time to explore the local town, followed by an overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Tiruchirapali – Thanjavur (Drive: 54 km / 2 hrs approx)
Description: In the morning, you'll check out of your hotel and drive to Thanjavur, a city known as the Rice Bowl of Tamil Nadu and home to many ancient temple wonders. Upon arrival, you'll check in at the hotel.  Later, you'll embark on a sightseeing tour of Thanjavur, where you can view the Brihadeeswara Temple (Big Temple of God), an architectural marvel constructed by the Cholas.  The temple features a tower that rises 15 meters from a 28.8-meter square base, reaching a total height of 64.8 meters, and is capped by an 81.3-tonne monolithic stone slab with winged niches on four sides.  You’ll also get to see The Palace near the temple, a grand structure partly built by the Nayaks around 1550 AD and later expanded by the Marathas, showcasing vast corridors, spacious halls, and two towers: the armory and observation towers.  Additionally, you'll get to visit the Saraswathi Mahal Library, which houses over 30,000 palm leaf and paper manuscripts in Indian and European languages.  The evening will be yours to enjoy leisure time in the local town, followed by an overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Thanjavur – Pondicherry (Drive: 210 km / 7 hrs approx)
Description: In the morning, you will check out of the hotel and drive to Pondicherry. Upon arrival, you’ll check in at your new hotel. Later, you'll embark on a sightseeing tour of Pondicherry, taking in the famous landmarks of this former French colony. The tour includes a visit to the Aurobindo Ashram, which promotes a synthesis of Yoga and modern science to unite spirit and matter. You’ll also have the opportunity to see Auroville, a unique township founded by Shree Aurobindo and The Mother in 1926, dedicated to yoga, meditation, and spiritual growth. The evening is yours to enjoy at leisure, with time to get acquainted with the local town, followed by an overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Pondicherry – Mamallapuram (Drive: 74 km / 2 hrs approx)
Description: The morning is at leisure before checking out of the hotel and driving to Mamallapuram. Upon arrival, you will check into a hotel. The day continues with a sightseeing tour that starts with The Shore Temple, one of the oldest temples housing shrines dedicated to Lord Shiva and Lord Vishnu. You'll also visit The Five Rathas, five monolithic temples, each crafted in a different style and also known as the Pancha Pandava Rathas, with four of them carved from a single rock. See Arjuna’s Penance, the world’s largest bas-relief measuring 27m x 9m, depicting gods, demigods, men, beasts, birds, and almost all of creation. The evening offers free time to explore the local market, followed by an overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Mammalapuram – Kanhipuram – Chennai (Drive: 74 km / 2 hrs approx)
Description: In the morning, you'll check out of the hotel and drive to Kanchipuram, one of India’s seven sacred cities, also known as the Golden City. Kanchipuram holds historical significance as the capital of the Pallavas, and later the Cholas and the Rayas of Vijayanagar dynasties. You'll visit the Ekambareswarar Temple, an ancient temple notable for its 57-meter high Rajagopuram, one of South India's tallest towers. Other important temples will be seen, such as the Kamakshi Amman Temple, a major site for Shakti worship in India. The journey then continues to Chennai (72 km / 2 hrs). Upon arrival in Chennai, you’ll check in at the hotel. The evening is yours to enjoy at leisure, allowing time to get acquainted with the local town before an overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Chennai – Mumbai Departure
Description: The morning starts with a sightseeing tour of Chennai, offering a look into the city’s rich cultural heritage, ancient traditions, festivals, fine crafts, and classical music and dance. Highlights include a visit to the Kapaleeswarar Temple, a stunning example of Dravidian architecture dating back to 1250 AD, and the Parthasarathy Temple, dedicated to Lord Vishnu and originally built by the Pallavas in the 8th century. The tour also takes you to Fort St. George, the first stronghold of British power in India, constructed in 1640 AD, and St. Thomas Mount, the site of the Apostle St. Thomas's martyrdom in 72 AD. In the afternoon, you will check out of the hotel and transfer to the airport for your flight to Mumbai, where you will receive assistance and be transferred to the International Airport for your onward journey.

Book your tour today and let us guide you through the heart of this fascinating region. The tour continues through Ooty, Cochin, Kumarakom, Periyar, and Madurai, highlighting the beauty of Kerala's backwaters, wildlife sanctuaries, and temples. This comprehensive package promises a blend of heritage, nature, and adventure across South India's most cherished destinations. Each destination promises a unique and unforgettable experience.

  • Any expenses not listed above.

TourCompanion.Name: South India Tour Support Team
TourCompanion.Description: Tour guides, drivers, and emergency support staff

Itinerary.Name: Arrival Ahmedabad
Description: Upon your arrival at Ahmedabad airport, you will be assisted and transferred to your hotel. Ahmedabad, founded in 1411 and known as the 'Manchester of the East,' is situated on the banks of the Sabarmati River. You will have an overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Explore Ahmedabad
Description: The second day is dedicated to exploring the architectural delights of Ahmedabad, including its exquisitely carved wooden mansions, havelis, and labyrinthine lanes. You will have the opportunity to visit the Calico Museum (with prior permission, closed on Wednesdays), discover the Jama Masjid and Sidi Mosque, visit the Gandhi Ashram, a key historical site, explore the impressive Adalaj Step Well, and enjoy the vibrant Evening Market. The overnight stay will be at a hotel in Ahmedabad.

Itinerary.Name: Ahmedabad / Taranga / Vijaynagar ( 260 Kms – Including Visit)
Description: After breakfast, you will drive to Vijaynagar, visiting Taranga en route. At Taranga, you can explore the Jain Temples, one of the finest clusters of Jain temples in India, located 85 km from Balaram Palace Resort on a hilltop offering pristine views.  The Ajitnath temple, built under the patronage of Solanki Rajput King Kumarapala, is famous for its beautiful carvings on pillars, domes, and brackets. You’ll also visit Idar to explore historical sites and enjoy its natural beauty, including the Idar Fort, and stunning rock formations and temples. In the afternoon, you'll arrive at Vijaynagar. Later, you’ll visit nearby villages to explore the tribal belts on the borders of Gujarat and Rajasthan.

Itinerary.Name: Vijaynagar
Description: The fourth day involves a full-day visit around Vijaynagar. Located on the foothills of the Aravali Hills and surrounded by dense forests, Vijaynagar is home to many wild animals, including panthers, sloth bears, and hyenas, and boasts over 200 varieties of birds, making it a haven for bird watchers.  You can explore more than 20 ancient Jain and Shiv temples dating back to the 15th century, a treat for those fond of ancient art and architecture. Vijaynagar is also considered a paradise for painters, with its scenic beauty and rich history. The overnight stay will be at the palace.

Itinerary.Name: Vijaynagar – Zainabad ( 190 Kms – Including visit)
Description: In the morning, you will leave for Zainabad/Dasada. En route, you'll visit the magnificent Sun Temple at Modhera, an architectural marvel dedicated to the Sun God, featuring intricate carvings and a stunning stepwell. Next, you'll explore the historic city of Patan, renowned for its exquisite Patola Silk weaving tradition and the famous Rani Ki Vav, a UNESCO-listed stepwell known for its intricate sculptures. In the evening, you'll arrive at the breathtaking Little Rann of Kutch (Zainabad/Dasada), where you can visit nearby villages to experience local culture and, if time permits, explore a traditional salt farm. Your overnight stay will be in charming, rustic huts, offering an authentic experience of the region.

Itinerary.Name: Zainabad – Fullday
Description: Day six includes an exciting game drive in the Little Rann of Kutch, where you'll have the chance to spot the rare and endangered Asiatic wild ass in its natural habitat. This experience is subject to the Monsoon season, and if there is heavy rain, the visit may not be recommended due to challenging terrain conditions. However, in the event of unfavorable weather, an alternative plan will take you to the nearby villages around the Little Rann of Kutch, where you can explore local culture, traditions, and craftsmanship. After an eventful day, you'll unwind with an overnight stay in the traditional huts, offering a unique and immersive experience.

Itinerary.Name: Day 7 Zainabad to Bhuj ( 280 Kms / 7 Hours)
Description: In the morning, you will depart for Bhuj, an ancient walled city with maze-like streets and intricate crenellated gateways. In the afternoon, you'll visit the Ferguson Museum and Rao Pragmalji’s Palace, a stunning structure made of marble and sandstone. You’ll return to the hotel in the evening for an overnight stay. Note: A permit is required for access to the interior villages, and assistance with the procedure will be provided.

Itinerary.Name: Bhuj
Description: The eighth day is dedicated to exploring the tribal villages, each specializing in unique forms of handicraft. You'll discover the intricate art of Ahir embroidery, learn about the traditional methods of block printing passed down through generations, and experience the vibrant process of tie and dye, showcasing the region’s rich craftsmanship.

Itinerary.Name: Bhuj to Jamnagar ( 250 Kms / 6-7 Hours)
Description: You will drive to Jamnagar. In the afternoon, you'll visit the princely states of Saurashtra, often referred to as Choti Kashi or Banaras due to its numerous Hindu and Jain temples, explore a Muslim dargah, and discover the region's famous tie-and-dye work on fabrics, along with exquisite silken and gold embroidery. The overnight stay will be at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Jamnagar to Dwarka (150 Kms)
Description: In the morning, you will depart for Dwarka. You'll visit the Dwarkadheesh Temple (Jagat Mandir), located on the north bank of the Gomti Creek and dating back over 2,500 years.  You’ll explore the architectural marvel of the temple, built with the same plan and system as other ancient Hindu temples, admire the sixty columns supporting the roof of the audience hall, and view the one-meter tall, four-handed black Idol of Ranchhodrai. You’ll also visit the Rukmini Temple, dedicated to Lord Krishna's wife, and learn about Dwaraka’s history as the seat of Adi Shankaracharya. The afternoon includes a suggested visit to Bet Dwarka, a nearby island. The overnight stay will be at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Dwarka – Junagadh (onway visit Porbander)110 + 115 Kms
Description: After breakfast, you will drive to Junagadh. En route, you'll visit Porbandar, the birthplace of Mahatma Gandhi, and explore Kirti Mandir, which showcases Gandhi’s philosophy.  You'll then proceed to Junagadh, historically the capital of the Junagadh State, located at the foothills of the sacred Girnar Hill. You'll visit the two fortifications surrounding the town: the fort walls and Uparkot. Key sites to visit include Buddhist caves, Baba Pyara caves (2nd century), Adi-Kadi Vav, and Jami Masjid. The evening includes a visit (if time permits) and an overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Junagadh – Bhavnagar ( 235 Kms)
Description: Following breakfast, you will visit the Junagadh Sightseeing. If you opt to visit Girnar Temples, be prepared for a 4-5 hour visit covering over 10,000 steps (optional lift chairs are available at an extra cost).  Later, you'll proceed to Bhavnagar. Bhavnagar, founded by Bhavsinhji Gohil, is located on the scenic Gulf of Kambhat (Cambay) and is known for its picturesque beauty, world-famous temples, and monumental edifices. Upon arrival, you will check in and enjoy an overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Bhavnagar ( Fullday excursion to Palitana – 60 Kms onway)
Description: After breakfast, you will go for a full-day visit to Palitana, one of India’s most picturesque pilgrim centers, located at the foot of Shatrunjaya Hill.  The site features 863 exquisitely carved temples, built in marble over a span of nine hundred years, and is a significant symbol of Jainism. The visit to Palitana includes a climb of 3500 steps, taking about 4-5 hours (lift chairs are available at an extra cost). Afterward, you'll return to Bhavnagar for a city tour, which includes visits to Gaurishankar Lake, Takhteshwar Temple, and the Lock Gate. Enjoy an overnight stay in Bhavnagar.

Itinerary.Name: Bhavnagar – Ahmedabad ( 220 Kms)
Description: After breakfast, you will proceed to Ahmedabad. On the way, you'll visit Lothal, one of the southernmost outposts of the Indus Valley Civilization. You'll explore Lothal, an example of Harappan town planning with its impressive dockyard, citadel, residential quarters, workshops, and factories, and marvel at the complex's advanced sanitary drainage system. You'll also visit the museum that showcases archaeological finds from the Indus Valley period. You'll arrive in Ahmedabad in the evening, where you can enjoy the rest of the day at leisure and indulge in last-minute shopping. The overnight stay will be at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Ahmedabad – Departure Transfer
Description: You will be transferred to the airport for your onward destination. This marks the end of your 15-day journey through Gujarat.

Name: Gujarat 15 Days Tour Package India
Title: Gujarat Tourism Packages | 15-Day Cultural Tour of Gujarat
Description: Discover Gujarat with our 15-day cultural tour package. Explore temples, wildlife, heritage sites & local traditions with expert Gujarat tourism packages.
Summary: End your 15-day journey through Gujarat with unforgettable experiences, from exploring ancient temples to immersing yourself in vibrant cultural traditions. Whether you're seeking a spiritual retreat, historical exploration, or a blend of both, our Gujarat 15 Days Tour Package India offers the perfect balance. Ready to dive deeper into the rich cultural diversity of Gujarat? Check out our Gujarat Tribal Tour Packages India for a unique journey that takes you through the tribal heartlands of this incredible state. Book your tour today and make your dream vacation in India a reality!

This comprehensive itinerary takes you through the rich cultural heritage, ancient temples, pristine beaches, and vibrant cities of Gujarat. Explore the majestic Rann of Kutch, visit the famous Gir National Park, and delve into the history of vibrant cities like Ahmedabad, Surat, and Vadodara. Whether you're a history enthusiast, nature lover, or culture seeker, this 15-day tour will offer you an immersive experience of Gujarat's diverse attractions, making it a perfect getaway for those seeking an in-depth exploration of this dynamic state.

TourCompanion.Description: Experienced local guides with in-depth knowledge of Gujarat's culture, history, and attractions

Itinerary.Name: Arrive Delhi
Description: Met on arrival and transfer to hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Explore Delhi
Description: The second day includes a morning sightseeing tour of Old Delhi, featuring a visit to the Red Fort, built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan, and the Jama Masjid, one of India's largest mosques. The tour also includes a stop at Rajghat, Mahatma Gandhi’s memorial.  In the afternoon, you’ll take a sightseeing tour of New Delhi, where you will visit Qutub Minar, India’s tallest stone tower, Chhatarpur Temple, known for its peaceful ambiance, Humayun’s Tomb, which served as an inspiration for the Taj Mahal, and the Bahai (Lotus) Temple, open to all faiths for meditation. The evening is at leisure, with an overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Delhi – Mandawa (Drive: 260 km/6 hrs)
Description: On the third day, you will check out from your hotel in the morning and depart for Mandawa, a drive of approximately 260 km taking around 6 hours. Upon arrival in Mandawa, you will check into your hotel.  You’ll then explore the Shekhawati region, known for its painted havelis and frescoes, an area referred to as the open-air gallery of Rajasthan. The evening is at leisure, with an overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Mandawa – Bikaner (Drive: 180 km / 4 hrs)
Description: The fourth day involves checking out from the hotel in the morning and departing for Bikaner, a drive of approximately 180 km taking around 4 hours.  Upon arrival in Bikaner, you will check into your hotel.  Bikaner, a royal fortified city with a timeless appeal, is located in the north of the desert state and dotted with many sand dunes.  Here, you will visit Junagarh Fort, built in 1594 by Raja Rai Singh, a general in Emperor Akbar's army, a formidable structure encircled by a moat, housing beautiful palaces within, and constructed using red sandstone and marble, featuring picturesque courtyards, balconies, kiosks, and windows.  You’ll also visit Lalgarh Palace, an architectural masterpiece in red sandstone, built by Maharaja Ganga Singh in memory of his father, Maharaja Lal Singh, notable for its intricate lattice and filigree work, and surrounded by sprawling lawns adorned with blooming bougainvillea and frequented by dancing peacocks.  The evening is at leisure, with an overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Bikaner – Jaisalmer (Drive: 330 km / 7 hrs)
Description: On the fifth day, you will check out of the hotel in the morning and embark on a scenic drive to Jaisalmer, covering approximately 330 km in about 7 hours. Along the way, you’ll pass through the vast desert landscapes of Rajasthan, with opportunities to witness rural life, sand dunes, and historic towns. Upon arrival in Jaisalmer, often called the 'Golden City' due to its stunning sandstone architecture, you will check into your hotel for an overnight stay. Take the evening to relax, explore nearby attractions, or enjoy a traditional Rajasthani meal before your exciting adventures in Jaisalmer begin.

Itinerary.Name: Jaisalmer
Description: Day six is dedicated to exploring Jaisalmer, often referred to as the 'Golden City,' rising from the Thar Desert.  You'll visit Jaisalmer Fort, perched 80 meters high on a hill, housing an entire township within its ramparts, and wander through the enchanting, narrow lanes adorned with intricately designed havelis.  The itinerary also includes visits to three beautifully sculpted Jain temples dating back to the 12th–15th centuries AD, dedicated to the Jain Tirthankaras – Rishabdev, Sambhavnath, and Parswanath, five interconnected palaces within the fort, each reflecting the grandeur of Rajasthani architecture, and the fort's four main gateways – Akhaiya Pol, Ganesh Pol, Suraj Pol, and Hava Pol.  You’ll also relax by Gadisar Lake, a scenic rainwater lake surrounded by shrines and offering a variety of avian life, and experience the ripples on the wind-caressed dunes at Sam.  You can also enjoy a camel safari to immerse yourself in the desert's beauty.  The day concludes with leisure time, perhaps exploring local markets or enjoying traditional Rajasthani cuisine, followed by an overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Jaisalmer – Jodhpur (Drive: 290 km / 7 hrs)
Description: The seventh day starts with checking out from the hotel in the morning and driving to Jodhpur.  You will arrive in Jodhpur in the afternoon and check into your hotel.  The afternoon includes a sightseeing tour featuring Mehrangarh Fort, a majestic fort situated on a 125-meter-high hill, known for its formidable structure and four gates, where you can visit the Chamunda Mataji Temple and the museum housing various relics.  You’ll also visit Jaswant Thada, a cluster of royal cenotaphs built in 1899 AD in memory of Maharaja Jaswant Singh II, containing portraits of various Jodhpur rulers.  The evening is at leisure to explore the local market, followed by an overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Jodhpur – Jaipur (Drive: 325 km / 8 hrs)
Description: On the eighth day, you will check out of the hotel in the morning and embark on a scenic drive to Jaipur, enjoying the changing landscapes along the way. Upon arrival in the vibrant Pink City, you will check into your hotel, where you can unwind and relax after the journey. Take the rest of the day to explore the nearby surroundings, enjoy local cuisine, or simply rest in preparation for the exciting adventures ahead. Your overnight stay in Jaipur will set the stage for an immersive experience in this historic and culturally rich destination.

Itinerary.Name: Jaipur
Description: Day nine includes a morning excursion to Amber Fort, where you'll experience a traditional elephant ride to ascend to the fort.  Key attractions here include the Marble Palace, the Temple of Victory, and the Hall of Mirrors (Sheesh Mahal), known for its dazzling mirror work.  The afternoon city tour features a visit to Jantar Mantar, an 18th-century astronomical observatory built by Maharaja Jai Singh II, and the city palaces and museums within the City Palace, showcasing collections from the princely era.  You’ll also visit Hawa Mahal (Palace of Winds), a five-story palace with a unique façade of windows and latticed screens, designed for the royal ladies to observe street life discreetly.  The evening is at leisure to explore the local market, with an overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Jaipur – Agra (Drive: 235 km / 6 hrs)
Description: On the tenth day, you will check out from the hotel in the morning and visit Fatehpur Sikri en route, the deserted capital of Emperor Akbar. In the afternoon, you'll continue the drive to Agra, where you will arrive in the evening and check into your hotel. The rest of the day is free for leisure activities, with an overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Agra – Delhi Departure (Drive: 204 km / 4 ½ hrs)
Description: The final day starts with a morning city tour of Agra, featuring a visit to the Taj Mahal, a white marble mausoleum commissioned by Mughal emperor Shah Jahan, and Agra Fort, a UNESCO World Heritage site offering a view of the Taj Mahal from its octagonal tower. This marks the conclusion of your journey through Rajasthan's majestic landscapes and rich culture.

TourCompanion.Description: Expert guide for cultural, historical, and architectural insights

Itinerary.Name: Arrive Delhi
Description: Upon your arrival in Delhi, you will be met and transferred to your hotel for an overnight stay.

Itinerary.Name: Explore Delhi
Description: The second day is dedicated to exploring the historical and cultural riches of Delhi. The morning tour takes you through Old Delhi, where you'll visit the Red Fort, a magnificent structure built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan, and the Jama Masjid, one of India's largest and most famous mosques. The morning concludes with a visit to Raj Ghat, a memorial honoring Mahatma Gandhi. In the afternoon, the exploration continues with a tour of New Delhi's landmarks, including the Qutub Minar, India's tallest stone tower built in 1191 AD, and Humayun’s Tomb, believed to be designed by Humayun’s widow and a significant example of Mughal architecture. The evening is yours to enjoy at leisure in your hotel, with an overnight stay.

Itinerary.Name: Delhi – Jaipur (Drive: 260 Kms / 5 hrs approximately)
Description: On the third day, you'll drive from Delhi to Jaipur, a journey of approximately 260 km taking around 5 hours. Upon arrival in Jaipur, you will be greeted and transferred to your hotel, where you'll have free time to relax until lunch. In the afternoon, a guided tour will introduce you to Jaipur's iconic landmarks, including the Jantar Mantar, an 18th-century astronomical observatory, the City Palace, an opulent complex showcasing royal heritage, and the Hawa Mahal, the 'Palace of Winds,' designed with intricate latticework for royal women to observe street life. The evening is yours to explore Jaipur's vibrant local markets, followed by an overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Explore Jaipur
Description: On the fourth day, your journey begins with a morning excursion to the magnificent Amber Fort, a UNESCO-listed site perched atop a scenic hill. As you ascend the fort’s grand entrance on a traditional elephant ride, you’ll experience the regal charm of Rajasthan’s history. Once inside, explore the fort’s architectural marvels, including the Marble Palace, known for its intricate carvings, the Temple of Victory (Jai Mandir) with its beautifully decorated ceilings, and the stunning Hall of Mirrors (Sheesh Mahal), where thousands of tiny mirrors reflect light to create a dazzling effect. After the immersive historical tour, the afternoon is yours to relax or explore at your own pace. You may choose to stroll through the vibrant markets, savor local Rajasthani delicacies, or unwind at the hotel. The day concludes with a comfortable overnight stay at the hotel, preparing you for the adventures ahead.

Itinerary.Name: Jaipur – Agra (Drive: 250 Kms / 5 hrs approximately)
Description: Day five starts with an early morning departure for Agra, also known as the Pink City, with a scenic drive of approximately 270 km, taking around six hours. Along the way, you will visit Fatehpur Sikri, the former capital of Emperor Akbar, renowned for its stunning Mughal architecture and rich historical significance. This abandoned city showcases impressive structures like Buland Darwaza, Jama Masjid, and the palace of Jodha Bai, offering a glimpse into the grandeur of the Mughal era. After exploring Fatehpur Sikri, you will continue your journey to Agra, arriving in the afternoon. Upon arrival, you will check into your hotel for a comfortable overnight stay, allowing you to relax and prepare for the exciting experiences awaiting you in this historic city.

Itinerary.Name: Agra
Description: The sixth day is dedicated to exploring Agra.  The morning city tour includes a visit to the Taj Mahal, a white marble mausoleum built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal.  You will also explore Agra Fort, a UNESCO World Heritage site offering a view of the Taj Mahal. Additionally, you'll visit Sikandra, the Tomb of Akbar the Great, known for its beautiful decorations. The evening offers leisure time to explore the local markets, followed by an overnight stay at the hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Agra – Delhi (Drive: 203 Kms / 4 ½ hrs approximately)
Description: On the final day, enjoy a leisurely morning at your hotel, taking in the last moments of your stay and perhaps indulging in a relaxed breakfast or a short stroll around the property. Spend some time unwinding or making any last-minute arrangements before your departure. In the afternoon, you will begin your journey back to Delhi, which is approximately 203 km away, with a travel time of around 4.5 hours. As you drive through the scenic landscapes, take in the sights one last time before reaching the bustling city. Upon arrival in Delhi, you will be transferred directly to the airport, ensuring a smooth transition for your onward flight, concluding your journey on a seamless and well-organized note.

Itinerary.Name: Arrival in Colombo (40 Km /40 min. Drive from Airport to Colombo)
Description: Upon arrival at Bandaranaike International Airport in Sri Lanka, guests will be warmly welcomed by our representative. They will then be transferred to Colombo, the vibrant capital of the island. The evening will be spent exploring the city's rich colonial architecture and lively markets, offering a glimpse into its dynamic culture and history. Colombo, known for its blend of tradition and modernity, provides a captivating introduction to Sri Lanka. After a day of exploration, guests will enjoy a restful overnight stay in Colombo, preparing for the adventures to come.

Itinerary.Name: Negombo – Pinnawala – Sigiriya (147 Km / 3hrs. & 30mins. Drive)
Description: After breakfast, embark on a scenic drive to Sigiriya, with a stop at the Pinnawala Elephant Orphanage along the way. The Pinnawala Elephant Orphanage, established in 1975, serves as a sanctuary for orphaned elephants. Located in the Pinnawala village, 13 km northwest of Kegalle, it is home to the largest herd of captive elephants in the world, which includes 88 elephants from three generations. Visitors can witness the majestic animals being bathed and fed, offering an incredible experience. After spending time at the orphanage, continue the journey to Sigiriya, where you’ll visit the iconic Lion Rock Fortress, a UNESCO World Heritage site known for its ancient ruins and breathtaking views. The day concludes with an overnight stay in Sigiriya, allowing you to rest and reflect on the day's experiences before exploring more of Sri Lanka's rich history.

Itinerary.Name: Sigiriya → Anuradhapura → Aukana → Sigiriya
Description: After breakfast, depart for Anuradhapura, Sri Lanka’s first capital and one of the most significant ancient cities. Anuradhapura, established in the 5th century BC, was a planned metropolis with massive Buddhist shrines, monasteries, and palaces, designed for both royalty and commerce. Its suburbs also housed ascetics and services for the city. Today, it boasts restored monuments, preserved ruins, and ongoing archaeological excavations that highlight its role as the cradle of Sinhalese Buddhist civilization. Next, visit the Aukana Buddha Statue, a towering 46-foot figure representing Buddha in the Abhaya mudra, offering reassurance. Afterward, embark on a jeep safari in Minneriya National Park, a famous destination for elephant sightings, particularly during the Great Elephant Gathering from May to October. This park, centered around the Minneriya Reservoir, is a vital part of the elephant corridor connecting Kaudulla and Wasgamuwa. End the day with dinner and an overnight stay at Sigiriya.

Itinerary.Name: Sigiriya → Kandy via Matale (90 Km / 2hrs. & 40mins. Drive)
Description: After breakfast, embark on a drive to Kandy, with a visit to a spice garden in Matale en route. The spice garden offers an opportunity to explore Sri Lanka’s aromatic treasures, including cinnamon, cloves, nutmeg, and cardamom, which have been central to the island's history in the spice trade. Sri Lanka, known as the 'Island of Spices,' has long been a hub for the cultivation and export of these spices, which also play an important role in local cuisine and Ayurveda. Upon reaching Kandy, visit the Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. This temple, located within the royal palace complex, houses the sacred relic of Buddha’s tooth, symbolizing political power in Sri Lanka. In the evening, enjoy a traditional cultural dance show. After a day of exploration, enjoy dinner and an overnight stay at your hotel in Kandy.

Itinerary.Name: Kandy → Ramdoda → Nuwara Eliya (76 Km / 2hrs. & 40mins. Drive)
Description: After breakfast, head to the Peradeniya Botanical Gardens, located just 5.5 km west of Kandy. The 147-acre garden is home to over 4,000 plant species, including orchids and medicinal plants, making it a paradise for nature lovers. It also features the National Herbarium of Sri Lanka and attracts over 2 million visitors annually. Following the botanical exploration, continue your journey to Nuwara Eliya, often called 'Little England' for its colonial charm. Along the way, visit the Ramboda Falls, a beautiful sight, and tour a tea factory and estate to learn about Sri Lanka’s famous tea industry. Also, stop at the Sri Bhakta Hanuman Temple in Ramboda, where a 5-meter granite statue of Hanuman stands. This temple has gained popularity over time, with the town's name, 'Ramboda,' meaning 'Rama’s force.' After a day of sightseeing, enjoy a dinner and overnight stay at your hotel in Nuwara Eliya.

Itinerary.Name: Nuwara Eliya → Hikkaduwa via Galle (5hrs drive/168km)
Description: Begin your journey by visiting the Sita Amman Temple, a key site along the Ramayana Trail in Sri Lanka. The temple, located between Sita Eliya and Hakgala Botanical Gardens, is believed to be the place where Sita stayed during her captivity after refusing Ravana's palace, choosing instead to reside in Ashok Vatika. It is also the location where Hanuman first met Sita, showing her Rama’s ring as proof of his identity. A nearby stream, where Sita is said to have bathed, features rock imprints believed to be Hanuman's footprints. Afterward, take a leisurely stroll around Gregory Lake before continuing your journey to Hikkaduwa, a paradise for beach lovers. This coastal town, known for its pristine beaches, offers a perfect place to relax and unwind. End the day with a delicious dinner and an overnight stay in Hikkaduwa, soaking in the serene atmosphere of the beach.

Itinerary.Name: Hikkaduwa Leisure Day
Description: After breakfast, begin your day with a magical glass-bottom boat ride over the coral reefs, offering a glimpse into the vibrant underwater world. Alternatively, you can simply relax on the golden sands of Hikkaduwa, enjoying the warm sun and tranquil sea breeze. The beach offers a peaceful setting for unwinding, with the option to explore the marine life or just enjoy the serene atmosphere. After a day of beach bliss, return to the hotel and spend the afternoon resting, either on the beach or by the pool. You can take in the calming views or indulge in some quiet time, letting the sound of the waves enhance your relaxation. In the evening, savor a delicious dinner, relishing the local flavors, before settling in for an overnight stay at your hotel in Hikkaduwa. The day promises a perfect balance of relaxation and marine adventure.

Itinerary.Name: Hikkawauwa – Galle – Airport ( 150 Km  2 hrs)
Description: After breakfast, it's time to bid farewell to Sri Lanka. You will be transferred to Bandaranaike International Airport for your onward journey, leaving with unforgettable memories of your travels across this beautiful island. From the ancient temples and lush landscapes to the vibrant cultural experiences and tranquil beaches, Sri Lanka has offered a wealth of experiences to cherish. As you head to the airport, reflect on the unique moments and the stories that will stay with you long after your departure. Whether it was the historic sites, the serene nature, or the warm hospitality of the people, your time in Sri Lanka will remain a cherished part of your travel memories. As you board your flight, carry with you the spirit of this incredible destination and the promise of future adventures.

Overview: Embark on an unforgettable journey through Sri Lanka’s cultural heartlands, misty highlands, and sun-soaked beaches with Eaze Tours’ meticulously curated 7 Nights & 8 Days Sri Lanka Tour Package. Designed for travelers seeking a perfect blend of history, nature, and relaxation, this itinerary takes you to UNESCO World Heritage Sites, lush tea plantations, and pristine coastal gems. From the bustling streets of Colombo to the serene beaches of Hikkaduwa, experience the island’s rich heritage and natural beauty with seamless logistics and expert guidance. Highlights Include: This unforgettable journey offers a blend of wildlife encounters, cultural immersion, scenic landscapes, and coastal relaxation. Begin by visiting the Pinnawala Elephant Orphanage, where you can witness rescued elephants up close, followed by a safari in Minneriya National Park to spot wild elephants in their natural habitat. Dive into Sri Lanka's rich history by exploring the ancient city of Anuradhapura and the Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic in Kandy, a sacred site that houses the Buddha’s tooth. Continue your journey through the picturesque tea estates of Nuwara Eliya and marvel at the beauty of Ramboda Falls. Finally, unwind on the golden sands of Hikkaduwa, a perfect coastal retreat, where you can enjoy a glass-bottom boat ride to view the vibrant marine life beneath the surface. This tour combines nature, history, and relaxation, offering a well-rounded Sri Lankan experience. Perfect For: Families, history buffs, nature lovers, and adventure seekers.

TourCompanion.Name: Certified Local Guide
TourCompanion.Description: Experienced guide with knowledge of Sri Lankan history, culture, and nature.

Itinerary.Name: Arrive in Paro – Welcome to Bhutan
Description: Your journey begins with a breathtaking descent into Paro Airport, where panoramic views of the Himalayas greet you. After meeting your guide, transfer to your hotel for check-in. Spend the rest of the day acclimatizing to Bhutan’s serene atmosphere or strolling through Paro’s charming streets. Enjoy a peaceful overnight stay in Paro, preparing for the adventures ahead. Overnight stay at hotel in Paro.

Itinerary.Name: Leisure Day in Paro
Description: Ease into Bhutan’s rhythm with a relaxed day in Paro. Unwind at your hotel or explore the town independently. Your guide and vehicle are available from 9 AM to 5 PM for optional sightseeing—visit local cafes, browse handicraft shops, or simply soak in the valley’s tranquil beauty. Return to your hotel for another restful night in Paro.

Itinerary.Name: Hike to Tiger’s Nest Monastery & Kyichu Lhakhang
Description: Embark on a spiritual highlight: a 5-hour hike to Tiger’s Nest Monastery (Taktshang Lhakhang), clinging to a cliff 900m above Paro Valley. Legend says Guru Rinpoche meditated here after arriving on a tigress, making it Bhutan’s most sacred site. After exploring the restored monastery, descend to visit 7th-century Kyichu Lhakhang, one of Bhutan’s oldest temples. Wrap up your day watching archery matches at local markets before retiring to your Paro hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Paro to Thimphu (55 kms / 1-hour drive)
Description: Start with a visit to Ta Dzong, a watchtower-turned-National Museum showcasing artifacts from Bhutan’s history. Walk downhill to Rinpung Dzong, the “Fortress of Heap of Jewels,” adorned with intricate Buddhist murals. After lunch, drive to Thimphu, Bhutan’s capital, nestled in a verdant valley. Check into your hotel and enjoy an evening at leisure. Overnight stay at hotel in Thimpu.

Itinerary.Name: Thimphu Sightseeing
Description: Dive into Thimphu’s culture at Simply Bhutan, a living museum where traditional dances, crafts, and architecture come alive. Next, visit Buddha Point to marvel at the towering 51-meter Buddha Dordenma statue and sweeping valley views. Conclude your day at Trashichhoedzong, the fortress housing the king’s throne room and government offices. Overnight in Thimphu.

Itinerary.Name: Thimphu to Gangtey (150 kms / 5-hour drive)
Description: Journey through Wangdue Phodrang to Gangtey Valley, a glacial expanse famed for its stark beauty and endangered black-necked cranes. En route, stop at Dochula Pass for Himalayan vistas (weather permitting). Arrive in Gangtey, check into your hotel, and absorb the valley’s serene, open landscapes. Overnight stay at the hotel in Gangtey.

Itinerary.Name: Explore Gangtey Valley
Description: Discover Gangtey Monastery, a 17th-century Nyingmapa gem perched above the valley. Learn about migratory black-necked cranes at the Information Centre, equipped with telescopes for wildlife viewing. Stroll through Gangtey Village, interacting with locals and monks, before returning to your hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Gangtey to Punakha (85 kms / 3-hour drive)
Description: Drive to Punakha, Bhutan’s former capital, and visit Punakha Dzong, a majestic fortress at the confluence of two rivers. Admire its intricate woodwork and learn about its role as the winter seat of Bhutan’s monastic community. Check into your hotel and unwind amid Punakha’s subtropical warmth. Overnight stay at the hotel in Punakha.

Itinerary.Name: Punakha to Paro (120 kms / 4.5-hour drive)
Description: After breakfast, visit Chimi Lhakhang, the whimsical “Temple of Fertility,” linked to the divine madman Drukpa Kunley. Wander through nearby villages and rice fields before driving back to Paro via Dochula Pass. Savor tea with mountain views en route, then settle into your Paro hotel for the final night.

Itinerary.Name: Departure from Paro
Description: Bid farewell to Bhutan with a hearty breakfast before transferring to Paro Airport. Your guide assists with exit formalities, leaving you with memories of Himalayan vistas, sacred monasteries, and Bhutan’s timeless charm. Safe travels onward!
