TourCompanion.Name: Certified Bhutanese Local Guide
TourCompanion.Description: Experienced guide licensed by the Tourism Council of Bhutan with cultural and historical expertise

Itinerary.Name: Arrival in Paro
Description: Your journey begins with a warm welcome at Paro Airport, followed by a transfer to your hotel. After settling in, immerse yourself in Bhutanese culture with visits to Ta Dzong, a circular fortress housing the National Museum, and Rinpung Dzong, a stunning example of traditional architecture. If time permits, embark on the optional Zuri Hike for breathtaking panoramic views of the Paro Valley.

Itinerary.Name: Paro Excursion
Description: Rise early for a trek to Tiger’s Nest Monastery (Taktshang Lhakhang), a sacred cliffside site 900 meters above the valley. Legend says Guru Rinpoche meditated here after arriving on a flying tigress. The 5-hour hike rewards you with awe-inspiring vistas and a glimpse into Bhutan’s spiritual heart. After descending, unwind with a visit to a traditional Bhutanese farmhouse for an authentic cultural experience. Overnight stay at the hotel in Paro.

Itinerary.Name: Transfer from Paro to Thimphu (55 km, 1.5 hours Drive)
Description: A scenic 1.5-hour drive brings you to Thimphu. En route, pause at Chuzom, where Thimphu and Paro rivers meet, marked by Tibetan, Nepalese, and Bhutanese stupas. Explore Tschogang Lhakhang, a 15th-century temple linked to the “excellent horse” deity. Upon arrival, check into your hotel and stroll through Thimphu’s bustling streets. Visit the Simply Bhutan Museum and Local Crafts Bazaar to admire handwoven textiles, thangkas, and artisan crafts. Overnight stay at the hotel in Thimphu (Altitude 2400m).

Itinerary.Name: Thimphu Sightseeing
Description: Start with a moderate 5.2 km hike to Dodedrak Monastery, offering sweeping valley views and interactions with English-speaking monks. Later, explore Tashichho Dzong, the seat of government, and Dechen Phodrang Monastery, home to ancient murals. Cap the day with a visit to Wangditse Lhakhang, a serene temple nestled in the hills. Overnight stay at Thimphu.

Itinerary.Name: Thimphu to Gangtey (150 kms, 5 hours)
Description: Journey 5 hours through lush landscapes to Gangtey. Stop at Wangdue Phodrang before entering the Phobjikha Valley, a winter sanctuary for endangered black-necked cranes. Visit Gangtey Monastery, a 17th-century gem, and opt for the Longtey Hike (4 hours) through rhododendron forests and traditional villages. End the day with a peaceful stroll in Gangtey Village. Overnight at the hotel in Gangtey.

Itinerary.Name: Gangtey Exploration
Description: Traverse the Gangtey Nature Trail (5.5 km), winding through meadows, forests, and past chortens (stupas). Visit Gangtey Goempa, Bhutan’s largest Nyingmapa monastery, and the Black-Necked Crane Information Centre to learn about these majestic birds. Enjoy a leisurely afternoon soaking in the valley’s tranquility. Overnight stay at the hotel in Gangtey.

Itinerary.Name: Gangtey to Bumthang via Trongsa (140 km, 4 hours Drive)
Description: Drive 4 hours to Bumthang, stopping at Chendbji Chorten, a Nepali-style stupa, and Trongsa Dzong, the ancestral home of Bhutan’s royal family. Explore Ta Dzong, a watchtower-turned-museum, before crossing Yutong La Pass (3,400m) into Bumthang. Visit Chumey Valley’s weaving centers and unwind with a visit to the Red Panda Brewery and Swiss Bakery. Overnight stay at the hotel in Bumthan. “Bumthang is one of the most spectacular valleys in Bhutan and also the heartland of Buddhism. 29 kms ahead of Trongsa cross Yutongla pass (3,400m) and from here again the landscape looks different and dense forests of conifers stretches. The arrival of Bumthang begins with the wide, open cultivated Chumey valley.”

Itinerary.Name: Bumthang Sightseeing
Description: Discover Bumthang’s spiritual treasures: Kurje Lhakhang, where Guru Rinpoche’s body imprint is enshrined; Jambey Lhakhang, a 7th-century temple; and Tamshing Lhakhang, famed for ancient murals. Hike to Lhodrak Kharchhu Monastery, a hub for Tibetan cultural preservation, and browse local handicrafts in Chamkhar town. Overnight stay at the hotel in Bumthang (Altitude 3000m). Lhodrak Kharchhu Monastery: Located above the main town, about 3 km from Chamkhar town, the monastery was founded by Namkhai Nyingpo Rinpoche in 1984 who was recognized at a very young age by H.H. the 14th Dalai Lama and H.H. 16th Karmapa as the reincarnation of a Tibetan lama.

Itinerary.Name: Punakha to Paro (120 kms / 4.5-hour drive)
Description: After breakfast, proceed for an excursion to Ura Valley (48 km, 1.5 hours drive), crossing the Ura La Pass (3,600m) for views of Gangkar Puensum, Bhutan’s highest peak. Explore clustered villages and the Guru Rinpoche Temple, adorned with intricate paintings. Return to Bumthang for a relaxed evening. Overnight stay at the Hotel in Bumthang. “Above Ura village (3,100m) is a new temple dedicated to Guru Rinpoche. Inaugurated in 1986, it contains a huge statue of the master and remarkable paintings of the cycle of his teachings. Since the last 35 years Ura has been transformed from a marginal community to a prosperous valley.”

Itinerary.Name: Bumthang to Punakha (215 km, 6-7 hours drive)
Description: After breakfast, check out from the hotel and a 7-hour drive leads to Punakha. Stop at Wangdue Phodrang Dzong, perched on a ridge shaped like a sleeping elephant, and Punakha Dzong, a majestic fortress at the river confluence. This dzong, once Bhutan’s capital, remains the monks’ winter residence. Overnight stay at the hotel in Punakha. “It is believed that Zhabdrung established the Wangdue Phodrang Dzong upon direction from the great Yeshey Goenpo (Mahakala) who visited Zhabdrung at Chimi Lhakhang in Punakha and directed him to construct a Dzong on a ridge in Wangdue Phodrang. When Zhabdrung sent some superintendents to survey the site, they saw four ravens flying in circles around the spot where the Dzong is built today. When Zhabdrung learned about it, he took it as an omen and further directed the construction of the masterpiece.”

Itinerary.Name: Punakha Exploration
Description: Hike to Khamsum Yulley Namgyal Chorten, a hilltop monument with valley views, then visit Sangchhen Dorji Lhuendrup Nunnery. Marvel at its 14-foot Avalokiteshvara statue and observe nuns mastering Buddhist teachings and crafts like thangka painting. Overnight stay at the hotel in Punakha. The temple houses a 14-foot main bronze statue of Avalokiteshvara (Chenrigzig chagtong chentong). Other statues include those of Guru Padma Sambawa, Gautama Buddha, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel, Tsela Namsum, the 21 Taras and Tsepamay (Buddha of longevity). The Avalokiteshvara statue, one of the biggest in the country, was the handiwork of entirely local Bhutanese artisans. The temple complex also houses a permanent higher learning and meditation centre for nuns where, apart from religious training, it provides life skill training such as tailoring, embroidery, statue making and thangka painting.

Itinerary.Name: Punakha to Paro (120 km, 4.5 hours drive approx)
Description: Return to Paro via Chimi Lhakhang, the fertility temple, with a walk through rice fields and villages. Explore Simtokha Dzong, Bhutan’s oldest fortress, now a Buddhist studies school. Overnight stay at Thimphu.

Itinerary.Name: Punakha to Paro (120 km, 4.5 hours drive approx)
Description: After breakfast at the hotel, transfer to the airport for your onward journey. Our representative will help you with exit formalities and then bid you farewell.

Itinerary.Name: Arrival → Nuwara Eliya (via Pinnawala)
Description: Elephants & Tea Trails: Arrive at Bandaranaike International Airport and head to Nuwara Eliya. En route, visit the Pinnawala Elephant Orphanage to observe rescued elephants. Tour a Sri Lankan Tea Factory to learn about Ceylon tea production and sip freshly brewed varieties. Stop at the majestic Ramboda Falls and the Sri Bhakta Hanuman Temple, home to a towering Hanuman statue. Overnight: Nuwara Eliya

Itinerary.Name: Nuwara Eliya Exploration
Description: Lakeside Serenity & Local Flavors After breakfast, enjoy leisure time at Gregory Lake, surrounded by misty mountains. Dive into local culture with a visit to Nuwara Eliya’s vibrant markets. Later, explore the town’s colonial charm, dubbed “Little England” for its British-era architecture and cool climate. Overnight: Nuwara Eliya

Itinerary.Name: Nuwara Eliya → Bentota (via Sita Amman Temple)
Description: Mythology & Coastal Tranquility Visit the Sita Amman Temple, believed to be where Sita was held captive in the Ramayana epic. Drive to Bentota, stopping at Kitulgala’s scenic landscapes. Unwind at your beachfront hotel upon arrival. Overnight: Bentota

Itinerary.Name: Bentota → Galle → Bentota
Description: Dutch Heritage & River Adventures Discover the UNESCO-listed Galle Fort, a 17th-century Dutch marvel. Later, cruise the Madu River through mangrove tunnels and visit a Turtle Hatchery to learn about conservation efforts. Overnight stay in Bentota.

Itinerary.Name: Bentota → Colombo → Departure
Description: Cityscapes & Farewell Conclude your journey with a Colombo City Tour, exploring landmarks like Galle Face Green and Pettah Bazaar. Transfer to the airport for your onward flight, filled with memories of Sri Lanka’s magic.

TourCompanion.Description: Experienced local guides, transportation, and assistance throughout the tour

Itinerary.Name: Arrive in Delhi
Description: Your journey begins with your arrival at Delhi’s Indira Gandhi International Airport, where our representative will greet you at the arrival lounge, holding a placard for easy identification. After a warm welcome, you’ll transfer to your pre-booked hotel for check-in. Settle into your accommodations and rest after your travels, preparing for the adventures ahead. Your first evening in India’s bustling capital is free to relax. Overnight stay in Delhi.

Itinerary.Name: Sightseeing Delhi
Description: After breakfast, embark on a full-day guided tour of Delhi’s iconic landmarks. Start in Old Delhi, exploring the majestic Jama Masjid (built in 1650) and the UNESCO-listed Red Fort, a masterpiece of Mughal architecture. Pay homage at Raj Ghat, the serene memorial of Mahatma Gandhi, before hopping on a traditional rickshaw for a lively ride through the bustling lanes of Chandni Chowk. In New Delhi, marvel at the towering Qutab Minar, a 12th-century victory tower, and the symmetrical beauty of Humayun’s Tomb, a precursor to the Taj Mahal. Drive past India Gate, a war memorial, and the grand Rashtrapati Bhavan (Presidential Residence) flanked by Parliament House. The evening is yours to wander local markets like Connaught Place or Khan Market. Overnight stay at hotel in Delhi. “INDIA GATE, the memorial of the First World War and the road that leads from there to RASHTRAPATHI BHAWAN – the residence of the President of India, which is flanked by the houses of Parliament and the Government Secretariat buildings.”

Itinerary.Name: Delhi to Varanasi (Train Journey)
Description: Rise early for a morning train journey to Varanasi, one of the world’s oldest living cities and Hinduism’s spiritual heart. Upon arrival, transfer to your hotel and freshen up. As dusk falls, head to Dashashwamedh Ghat to witness the mesmerizing Ganga Aarti, a synchronized ritual of fire, chants, and devotion honoring the Ganges River. The flickering lamps and rhythmic hymns create an unforgettable atmosphere. Overnight stay at the hotel in Varanasi.

Itinerary.Name: Varanasi & Sarnath
Description: Begin at dawn with a serene sunrise boat ride on the Ganges, observing pilgrims performing rituals along the ghats. Return to the hotel for breakfast, then set out to explore Varanasi’s sacred temples. Later, drive to Sarnath, where Buddha delivered his first sermon after attaining enlightenment. Visit the Ashoka Pillar (India’s national emblem), ancient monasteries, and the Deer Park, where Buddha set the “Wheel of Dharma” in motion. Return to Varanasi for an overnight stay.

Itinerary.Name: Varanasi to Bodhgaya (254 kms or 05 ½ hrs drive approx)
Description: After breakfast, embark on a scenic 5.5-hour drive to Bodhgaya, the site of Buddha’s enlightenment under the sacred Bodhi Tree. Visit the Mahabodhi Temple Complex, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, and meditate in the tranquil gardens surrounding the tree. Explore nearby monasteries reflecting diverse Buddhist traditions. Overnight stay at the hotel in Bodhgaya.

Itinerary.Name: Bodhgaya – Rajgir & Nalanda Excursion (70 kms or 1 ½ hrs drive)
Description: Post breakfast, drive to Rajgir, where Buddha spent 12 years teaching. Ride the ropeway to Gridhakuta Hill for panoramic views, then explore Venuvana Monastery, gifted to Buddha by King Bimbisara. Continue to Nalanda, once the world’s premier ancient university. Wander its red-brick ruins and visit the onsite museum showcasing artifacts from its scholarly golden age. Return to Bodhgaya for an overnight stay.

Itinerary.Name: Bodhgaya to Kushinagar via Vaishali (330kms/ 7-8 hrs drive approx)
Description: After breakfast, Depart early for Kushinagar, stopping en route at Vaishali, where Buddha delivered his final sermon. Visit the Ashoka Pillar, Lotus Tank, and Chaumukhi Stupa, relics of this ancient Buddhist hub. Arrive in Kushinagar by evening, the site of Buddha’s Mahaparinirvana (final passing). Overnight stay in Kushinagar.

Itinerary.Name: Kushinagar to Lumbini (174 kms or 3 hrs drive approx, Nepal)
Description: After breakfast, begin with a visit to the Mahaparinirvana Temple, housing a 6-meter reclining Buddha statue, and the adjacent Ramabhar Stupa. Cross into Nepal and drive to Lumbini, Buddha’s birthplace. En route, explore the Mahakala Caves, believed to be meditation sites for ancient monks. In Lumbini, visit the Mayadevi Temple marking Buddha’s birth and the serene Peace Pagoda. Overnight stay in Lumbini.

Itinerary.Name: Lumbini to Sravasti via Kapilvastu (154 kms or 2 ½ hrs drive approx)
Description: After breakfast, visit Kapilvastu, where Buddha spent his early life as Prince Siddhartha. See the ruins of his palace and the Ashoka Pillar commemorating the site. Continue to Sravasti, an ancient town where Buddha performed miracles. Explore the Jetavana Monastery, where he spent 24 monsoons, and the Anand Bodhi Tree planted by his disciple. Overnight stay in Sravasti.

Itinerary.Name: Sravasti to Gorakhpur – Flight to Delhi
Description: Post breakfast, drive to Gorakhpur Airport for your return flight to Delhi. Upon arrival, transfer to your hotel. Spend your final evening shopping for souvenirs in Delhi’s vibrant markets or relaxing at leisure. Overnight stay in Delhi, marking the end of your spiritual and cultural journey.

Itinerary.Name: Departure from Delhi
Description: After breakfast, transfer to the airport for your onward journey.

Name: 11 Days Buddhist Tour Package â€“ In the Footsteps of the Buddha
Title: Footsteps of the Buddha Tour - 11 Days
Description: Follow the Buddha's journey with our 11-day Buddhist pilgrimage tour. Visit Lumbini, Bodh Gaya, Sarnath & more. Book spiritual travel with EazeTours.
Summary: Experience the spiritual legacy of Lord Buddha through this meticulously crafted Footsteps of the Buddha Tour. Whether you are a history enthusiast, a spiritual seeker, or an explorer, this journey offers deep insights into Buddhist culture and heritage. Explore more Buddhist tours by visiting our Buddha Tour Package page or browse other fascinating travel experiences at All India Tour Packages.
Overview: This 11-days spiritual tour takes you through India's most revered Buddhist landmarks, including Delhi, Varanasi, Bodhgaya, Kushinagar, Lumbini (Nepal), and Sravasti. Experience the serenity of these historic locations, where Lord Buddha attained enlightenment, preached his first sermon, and ultimately achieved Mahaparinirvana.

TourCompanion.Name: Buddhist Circuit Tour Guide
TourCompanion.Description: Qualified spiritual guide knowledgeable in Buddhist history and heritage sites

Itinerary.Name: Arrive Kathmandu.
Description: Arrive in Kathmandu on Day 01, where youâ€™ll be warmly welcomed with traditional flower garlands at Tribhuvan International Airport. After a smooth airport pickup, you'll be transferred to your hotel in the heart of the city. Once checked in, take some time to relax and settle in. The afternoon is free for orientationâ€”explore the nearby markets, get familiar with the local culture, or simply unwind after your journey. It's the perfect start to your Himalayan adventure. Enjoy your first overnight stay in Kathmandu, surrounded by the vibrant energy, colorful traditions, and spiritual charm of Nepalâ€™s capital city.

Itinerary.Name: KATHMANDU / LUKLA / PHAKDING â€¢ 8,700 feet
Description: Day 02 begins with an exhilarating flight on a twin-engine Otter to Lukla, offering breathtaking views of terraced hills and the towering Himalayan peaks. Upon landing in Lukla at 9,350 feet, we meet the rest of our trekking crew and begin our hike into the heart of the Khumbu region. The trail winds through picturesque villages and along the Dudh Koshi River as we make our way to Phakding, situated at 8,700 feet. The trek takes about two and a half hours. In Phakding, we reunite with trekkers from the Jiri extension. This is the official start of our Everest Base Camp trek itinerary, designed to gradually acclimatize as we journey toward the worldâ€™s highest peak. (B, L, D)

Itinerary.Name: NAMCHE BAZAAR â€¢ 11,300 feet
Description: Our trek continues along the banks of the Dudh Kosi River, crossing several thrilling suspension bridges adorned with colorful prayer flags. The trail offers a blend of natural beauty and cultural charm as we pass through pine forests and small Sherpa settlements. After entering Sagarmatha National Park, the path ascends steeply through a series of switchbacks, revealing breathtaking views of the surrounding peaks. The climb is challenging but rewarding as we arrive at Namche Bazaar, a vibrant Sherpa town and the gateway to the Khumbu region, located at 11,300 feet. The ebc trek package ensures we have ample rest and exploration time in this iconic town. (B, L, D)

Itinerary.Name: Rest Day & Exploration in Namche Bazaar
Description: Today is a rest and acclimatization day in the vibrant village of Namche Bazaar. Surrounded by stunning Himalayan scenery, Namche offers colorful shops, lively markets, and delicious local cuisine. In the early morning, a short hike above the village rewards us with a breathtaking sunrise and panoramic views of Mt. Everest, Lhotseâ€”the worldâ€™s fourth highest peakâ€”and the striking Ama Dablam. On our return, we visit the Sherpa Museum, which showcases traditional Sherpa culture and an impressive photography exhibit by a local naturalist. The museum also honors Sherpa climbers and their legendary mountaineering achievements. This day is a key part of our Everest Base Camp trek itinerary for proper altitude adaptation. (B, L, D)

Itinerary.Name: Trek to Thyangboche â€¢ 12,887 feet
Description: Todayâ€™s trek follows the glacial waters of the Dudh Kosi, offering breathtaking views of Himalayan giants like Everest, Lhotse, and Ama Dablam. The trail ascends through forests of rhododendron and fir, passing picturesque villages and prayer wheels that spin with the mountain wind. By afternoon, we reach the serene hilltop of Thyangboche, home to the regionâ€™s most revered monastery. Nestled at 12,887 feet, this spiritual center features richly decorated walls, a towering 20-foot Buddha statue, and the sacred instruments of the resident Lamas. This spiritual stop adds a rich cultural layer to our ebc trek package. (B, L, D)

Itinerary.Name: DINGBOCHE â€¢ 14,250 feet
Description: Leaving Thyangboche, we descend through peaceful forests to Debuche and cross a thrilling suspension bridge over the Imja Khola. The trail then climbs steadily to Pangboche, where thousands of intricately carved mani stones line the path, adding spiritual charm to the journey. As we continue ascending, the landscape becomes more alpine, opening up to breathtaking vistas. We arrive in the traditional Sherpa village of Dingboche, nestled at 14,250 feet, surrounded by dramatic views of Lhotse, Island Peak, and the elegant Ama Dablam. The Everest Base Camp trek package includes an overnight here for acclimatization. (B, L, D)

Itinerary.Name: dzongla â€¢ 15,075 feet
Description: Todayâ€™s trek begins with a scenic walk from Dingboche, passing through farmlands and alpine meadows, offering wide-open views of the surrounding Himalayan peaks. The trail gradually ascends along the lateral moraine of the Khumbu Glacier, revealing the raw beauty of the high alpine landscape. After a steady climb, we arrive at Dzongla, situated at 15,075 feet. This shorter day allows ample time to rest and acclimatize, helping our bodies adjust to the increasing altitude. The Everest Base Camp trek packages are thoughtfully planned with gradual climbs for altitude safety. (B, L, D)

Itinerary.Name: LOBUCHE â€¢ 16,175 feet
Description: Todayâ€™s trek continues along the lateral moraine of the Khumbu Glacier, offering dramatic views of the rugged terrain and snow-capped peaks. Along the way, we pass somber stone memorials dedicated to climbers who lost their lives on nearby summitsâ€”a poignant reminder of the mountainâ€™s power and allure. The trail steadily ascends through rocky landscapes and alpine wilderness until we reach Lobuche, situated at 16,175 feet. Here, we set up camp just below the terminal moraine of a tributary glacier, surrounded by towering Himalayan giants and the raw beauty of the high-altitude environment. (B, L, D)

Itinerary.Name: GORAK SHEP â€¢ 17,000 feet
Description: We begin the day with an early morning ascent of Kala Pattar, rising to 18,450 feet, where weâ€™re rewarded with one of the most iconic panoramic views in the world. From the summit, take in unforgettable vistas of Everest, Nuptse, Pumori, and other towering peaksâ€”offering a breathtaking experience without needing to climb Everest itself. After taking time to absorb the views and capture photos, we descend to Gorak Shep, located at 17,000 feet. Nestled beneath Kala Pattar, this high-altitude settlement is where we set up camp for the night. This is a key point in our Everest Base Camp trek itinerary. (B, L, D)

Itinerary.Name: EVEREST BASE CAMP â€¢ 17,575 feet
Description: Today marks a major highlight of the journey as we trek to the legendary Everest Base Camp, situated at 17,575 feet at the foot of the Khumbu Icefall. If weather conditions prevented the Kala Pattar climb yesterday, weâ€™ll have a second chance this morning to summit and enjoy its world-class views. The route to Base Camp winds through rocky terrain and glacier moraine, offering dramatic scenery all around. Upon arrival, we spend time exploring this iconic siteâ€”surrounded by prayer flags, expedition tents, and towering peaksâ€”soaking in the history and energy of the worldâ€™s highest mountain. A must-see on all Everest Base Camp trek packages. (B, L, D)

Itinerary.Name: PHERICHE â€¢ 13,950 feet
Description: Today we begin our descent from the high alpine zone, heading down the glacier and gradually reentering the lush valleys of the lower Khumbu. The trail offers stunning views of snow-capped peaks, now seen from a fresh perspective as we descend through rocky landscapes and open meadows. Upon reaching the village of Pheriche, situated at 13,950 feet, we take time to visit the Himalayan Rescue Association's Trekker's Aid Postâ€”a vital resource for trekkers and mountaineers in the region. It's a rewarding and informative stop on our journey back through the heart of the Himalayas. (B, L, D)

Itinerary.Name: NAMCHE BAZAAR â€¢ 11,300 feet
Description: Todayâ€™s trek leads us back along the banks of the Dudh Kosi River, winding through a spectacular rhododendron forest and past cascading waterfalls that sparkle in the mountain light. As we near Namche, the trail passes through serene pine forests, where we may spot musk deer grazing in the early morning calm. Upon arrival in Namche Bazaar, the lively energy returnsâ€”especially if it coincides with market time, when lowland porters, highland Sherpas, and Tibetan traders gather to exchange goods. Itâ€™s a perfect blend of natural beauty and cultural richness as we settle in for the night. (B, L, D)

Itinerary.Name: LUKLA â€¢ 9,350 feet
Description: Today marks the final day of trekking as we make our way from Namche Bazaar back to Lukla. The trail descends steeply at times, winding through pine forests, crossing high suspension bridges, and passing charming mountain villages one last time. Itâ€™s a day of reflection and celebration, with plenty of opportunities to take in the familiar sights of the Khumbu region. Upon reaching Lukla, we enjoy our final evening in the mountains, sharing memories with our trekking team and preparing for tomorrowâ€™s flight back to Kathmandu. (B, L, D)

Itinerary.Name: KATHMANDU â€¢ 4,383 feet
Description: If the weather is clear, we take a scenic morning flight from Lukla back to Kathmandu, offering one last breathtaking glimpse of the Himalayan peaks. The short but memorable journey marks a smooth and symbolic farewell to the mountains. Upon arrival in Kathmandu, we transfer to our hotel and enjoy a well-deserved rest. The remainder of the day is free to relax, explore the cityâ€™s vibrant streets, shop for souvenirs, or revisit some of its cultural landmarks. Spend your final night in Nepal reflecting on the incredible journey through the heart of the Himalayas. (B)

Itinerary.Name: DEPARTURE
Description: Enjoy some free time in Kathmandu for last-minute shopping, a leisurely breakfast, or quiet reflection before your journey home. At the scheduled time, you will be transferred to Tribhuvan International Airport for your onward flight. We bid you a heartfelt farewell, carrying with you unforgettable memories of the Himalayas, Sherpa hospitality, and the spirit of adventure.

Itinerary.Name: (B)  Mountain Flight
Description: Mountain flight take off from Kathmandu in the early morning for an hourâ€™s worth of spectacular mountain scenery. As the aircraft lifts up and heads towards the east, passengers donâ€™t have to wait too long to find out what is in store for them. There they are â€“ the mountains, as they always have been. First to their far left visitors see Gosaithan, also called Shisha Pangma, Standing at the majestic height of 8,013 m. Immediately to the right of Gosaithan, there appears Dorje Lakpa (6,966 m), a mountain that looks like the number 8 lying down and covered with snow. To the right of Dorje Lakpa is Phurbi-Ghyachu, which looms over the Kathmandu Valley. As the plane moves along, the mountains come closer and closer. Next on the vision is Choba-Bhamare, the smallest one of the lot at 5,933 m but singularly stubborn as it has never been climbed. Then appears the mountain that is not only prominent in sight but also in spiritually â€“ Gauri-Shankar. Lord Shiva and his consort Gauri are said to protect this mountain, at the proud height of 7,134 m and the summit had a history of unsuccessful attempts till 1979.Gauri-Shankar is sharp and very conspicuous during the mountain flight. As the plane moves towards the land of the rising sun, the eastern Himalaya a succession of glorious mountains follows. Melungtse, a Plateau â€“ like mountain stretches up to 7,023 m, Chugimago at 6,297 m is still a virgin, waiting to be climbed. At 6,956 m, Numbur Mountain resembles a breast, maternal source in the sky providing pure milk to the Shepas of the Solu Khumbu. Next is Karyolung, an intensely white mountain that at 6,511 m gleams with the rising sun. Cho-Oyu is the eighth highest mountain in the world. Reaching a height of 8,201 m, it appears stunningly beautiful from the aircraft. Next on the menu is Gyanchungkang, at a majestic height of 7,952 m, considered an extremely difficult climb. To the right of Gyanchungkang is Pumori (7,161m). As passengers get closer to Everest, there's Nuptse (7,855 m), which means West Peak, signifying its direction from Everest. Finally, thereâ€™s Everest (8,848m) itself, known as Sagarmatha by the Nepalese and Chomolungma by the Tibetans. Much has already been written about Everest, but to actually witness it face to face during a mountain flight is something else. Even while it looms therein front of the eyes, it remains and enigma, this highest spot on earth.

Name: Everest Base Camp Trek Package â€“ 15 Days EBC Itinerary
Title: Everest Base Camp Trek Package â€“ 15 Days EBC Itinerary
Description: Explore Everest Base Camp with our 15-day trek package. Detailed EBC trek itinerary, scenic routes & Sherpa culture. Book your Everest Base Camp adventure today!
Summary: Walk among legends on the iconic Everest Base Camp Trekâ€”an unforgettable journey into the heart of the Himalayas. Perfect for trekkers, adventurers, and mountain lovers, this expedition takes you from the bustling streets of Kathmandu to the serene glaciers beneath the worldâ€™s highest peak. With panoramic views, Sherpa culture, and the thrill of high-altitude trekking, every step brings you closer to natureâ€™s raw power and beauty. Discover more Himalayan adventures on our Nepal Tour Packages page or browse a variety of high-altitude expeditions at All India Tour Packages.
Overview: Mount Everest towers above the Khumbu at over 29,000 feet and is perhaps the most iconic symbol of challenge and adventure on Earth. On our classic Everest Base Camp trek package, follow in the footsteps of legends as we ascend from verdant Lukla to the vast glaciers and razor-sharp ridgelines of the Everest Himalayasâ€”home to the world's highest peaks. At Base Camp, stand face-to-face with the fabled Khumbu Icefall and its towering seracs. Hike to the summit of Kala Patar, at over 18,100 feet, for an unobstructed view of Everest's windblown summit, trailing a seemingly perpetual banner of cloud and snow. For well over two decades, our expert local staff have traveled the footpaths of the Everest region with REI membersâ€”providing insider perspectives, preparing fresh meals, and handling every detail of our camping and trekking needs. This EBC trek package begins and ends in Kathmandu, where opportunities abound to explore UNESCO World Heritage sites and discover the colorful traditions of both Buddhism and Hinduism.

Itinerary.Name: Arrival in Kathmandu & Traditional Welcome
Description: Upon arrival at Tribhuvan International Airport in Kathmandu, you will be warmly welcomed with traditional flower garlands by an Eaze Tours representative. A private vehicle will transfer you to your hotel, where you can relax and settle in after your journey. In the evening, enjoy a delightful Gala Nepali Dinner featuring authentic local cuisine and traditional drinks. The evening is brought to life with captivating cultural folk dance performances, offering you a vibrant introduction to Nepalâ€™s heritage. This memorable start sets the tone for your Nepal travel itinerary. Overnight stay at the hotel in Kathmandu.

Itinerary.Name: Kathmandu Sightseeing â€“ Culture & Spirituality
Description: After breakfast, begin a guided tour of Kathmandu, the historic â€œCity of Glory.â€ Visit key landmarks including Kumari Ghar (home of the Living Goddess), Kasthamandap, Kal Bhairab, and the Big Bell. Next, explore Swayambhunath Stupa, a sacred Buddhist site perched on a hill with stunning valley views. After lunch at a local restaurant, visit Pashupatinath Temple, Nepalâ€™s holiest Hindu shrine dedicated to Lord Shiva, followed by Boudhanath Stupa, one of the largest and most magnificent Buddhist stupas in the world. Return to your hotel after a spiritually enriching day. Overnight stay in Kathmandu.

Itinerary.Name: Journey to Chitwan â€“ Into the Wild
Description: After an early breakfast, depart Kathmandu for a scenic drive to Royal Chitwan National Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site renowned for its rich biodiversity. This part of the Kathmandu Chitwan Pokhara tour immerses you in Nepalâ€™s diverse natural landscape. Upon arrival, check into your jungle resort and receive a briefing on the upcoming activities. Enjoy lunch at the resort, followed by an afternoon nature walk and a peaceful boat ride through the parkâ€™s serene waterways. In the evening, savour a delicious dinner and experience a lively Tharu cultural performance featuring traditional stick dancing. The day ends with an overnight stay at the resort, surrounded by the sounds of the jungle.

Itinerary.Name: Wildlife Adventures in Chitwan
Description: Start your day early with a wake-up call at 5:30 a.m., followed by tea or coffee. At 6:00 a.m., set out on a birdwatching and jungle walk to experience the parkâ€™s morning wilderness. After breakfast at 8:00 a.m., enjoy a guided crocodile walk through grasslands and forests, leading to a serene boat ride on the Narayani River for crocodile sightings. Following lunch at 1:00 p.m., your afternoon includes an exciting elephant safari, jungle walk, observation tower visit, or nature walk with a boat ride. The day ends with dinner at 8:00 p.m. and an overnight stay at the resortâ€”another highlight of your Nepal tours and travels experience.

Itinerary.Name: From Jungle to Mountains â€“ Chitwan to Pokhara
Description: Begin your day early with a 5:30 a.m. wake-up call, followed by tea or coffee. At 6:00 a.m., set out for a refreshing birdwatching session or jungle walk. After breakfast at 8:00 a.m., depart Chitwan at 9:30 a.m. for a scenic drive to Pokhara, a picturesque valley famed for its natural beauty. This segment of your Nepal travel itinerary brings you from the jungles of Chitwan to the serene lakes of Pokhara. En route, stop for lunch at a quality local restaurant. Upon arrival, check in at your hotel. Pokharaâ€™s tropical charm, serene lakes, and majestic Himalayan backdrop offer a tranquil contrast to Chitwanâ€™s wild landscapes. Enjoy dinner and an overnight stay in Pokhara.

Itinerary.Name: Cultural Sights & Lake Serenity in Pokhara
Description: After breakfast, begin your day exploring Pokharaâ€™s rich trading heritage, where mountain traders and decorated pony caravans once filled the bustling bazaar. Visit the sacred Bindhyabasini Temple, a revered site for Hindu worshippers, followed by the Butterfly Museum, located within the university grounds and showcasing Nepalâ€™s vibrant biodiversity. In the late afternoon, enjoy a serene boat ride on Phewa Lake, gliding past the Kingâ€™s winter residence. Stop at the Varahi Temple, a peaceful golden shrine on a small island, frequented by pilgrims in traditional canoes. Enjoy lunch at a top local restaurant. Dinner and overnight at your Pokhara hotel.

Itinerary.Name: Return to Kathmandu â€“ By Road or Optional Flight
Description: After breakfast, begin your journey back to Kathmandu with a scenic drive that takes approximately 5â€“6 hours through Nepalâ€™s lush hills and charming villages. For a quicker option, you may choose a 25-minute flight from Pokhara to Kathmandu at an additional cost. Upon arrival, check in to your hotel and enjoy some leisure time. In the evening, savor a farewell dinner featuring local cuisine, reflecting on the unforgettable memories of your Kathmandu Chitwan Pokhara tour. Overnight stay at the hotel in Kathmandu.

Itinerary.Name: Departure from Kathmandu
Description: Enjoy your final breakfast at the hotel. The rest of the day is free for leisure, last-minute shopping, or simply relaxing until your scheduled transfer to Tribhuvan International Airport for your onward journey. We hope your time in Nepal has been enriching and memorable.

Name: DISCOVER NEPAL TOUR â€“  Kathmandu,Chitwan and Pokhara - 7 Nights 8 Days
Title: Nepal Travel Itinerary â€“ Kathmandu, Chitwan & Pokhara Tour
Description: Explore Nepal with our 7 Nights/8 Days Kathmandu, Chitwan & Pokhara tour. A perfect Nepal travel itinerary blending culture, wildlife & Himalayan beauty.
Summary: Experience the soul of the Himalayas with our 7 Nights/8 Days Nepal travel itinerary. Whether you're looking for ancient temples, wildlife adventures, or mountain serenity, this itinerary delivers it all. Ideal for travelers from the USA, UK, Europe, and beyond. Looking to extend your holiday? Donâ€™t miss our Bhutan Tour Package for Himalayan mystique or relax by the sea with our Sri Lanka Tour Package. Let Eaze Tours take you beyond Nepal to Asiaâ€™s most inspiring destinations.
Overview: Uncover the charm of Nepal with our Discover Nepal Tour Package, a beautifully crafted Nepal travel itinerary through Kathmanduâ€™s cultural wonders, Chitwanâ€™s vibrant wildlife, and Pokharaâ€™s tranquil lakes and Himalayan views. Perfect for couples, families, or solo explorers, this Kathmandu Chitwan Pokhara tour is a popular choice among travelers seeking Nepal tours and travels experiences that blend spirituality, adventure, and natural beauty. Youâ€™ll be transferred to your hotel in a private vehicle, where you can relax and settle in after your journey. In the evening, experience an authentic Nepali welcome with a Gala Dinner featuring traditional cuisine and local drinks. Enjoy a vibrant cultural folk dance performance, offering a lively and colorful glimpse into Nepalâ€™s rich heritage. This cultural evening sets the perfect tone for your Nepal trip package. Overnight stay at the hotel in Kathmandu.

Itinerary.Name: Spiritual & Cultural Tour of Kathmandu
Description: After breakfast, begin your exploration of Kathmandu, often called the â€œCity of Glory.â€ Visit historic sites including Kumari Ghar, home of the Living Goddess, Kasthamandap, Kal Bhairab, and the Big Bell. Next, head to Swayambhunath Stupa, a sacred Buddhist site perched atop a hill, offering sweeping views of the valley. After lunch at a quality local restaurant, visit Pashupatinath Temple, Nepalâ€™s holiest Hindu temple on the banks of the Bagmati River, followed by Boudhanath Stupa, one of the worldâ€™s largest and most striking Buddhist stupas. Return to your hotel. Overnight stay in Kathmandu.

Itinerary.Name: Journey to Chitwan â€“ Into the Wild
Description: After an early breakfast at the hotel, depart at 7:00 a.m. for a scenic 4â€“5 hour drive to Royal Chitwan National Park, one of Asiaâ€™s best-preserved wildlife sanctuaries. Home to the rare one-horned rhinoceros, Royal Bengal tigers, sloth bears, leopards, various deer species, and over 400 exotic bird species, the park offers an unforgettable jungle experience. This part of your Nepal classic tour brings you close to nature and wildlife. Upon arrival, check in at the resort and attend a briefing on park activities. Enjoy lunch at 1:00 p.m., followed by a nature walk and boat ride at 3:30 p.m. In the evening, savour dinner and enjoy a traditional Tharu stick dance.

Itinerary.Name: Wildlife Encounters in Chitwan National Park
Description: Begin your day early with a 5:30 a.m. wake-up call and a warm cup of tea or coffee. At 6:00 a.m., set out for a thrilling morning of wildlife activitiesâ€”choose between bird watching, an elephant safari, or a guided jungle walk. Return for breakfast at 8:00 a.m., followed by a crocodile walk at 9:30 a.m., which includes a scenic 45-minute trek through grassland and forest to the Narayani River and a relaxing boat ride back. After lunch at 1:00 p.m., enjoy an afternoon jungle walk, visit an observation tower, or take a nature walk with a boat ride. Dinner at 8:00 p.m. and overnight at the resort.

Itinerary.Name: From Chitwan to Pokhara â€“ Nature & Heritage
Description: Start your day with a 5:30 a.m. wake-up call and tea or coffee, followed by early morning bird watching or a refreshing jungle walk at 6:00 a.m. After breakfast at 8:00 a.m., depart Chitwan at 9:30 a.m. for a scenic four-hour drive to Pokhara, a serene valley renowned for its natural beauty and stunning Himalayan views. As part of this all-inclusive Nepal tourism package, youâ€™ll enjoy a journey filled with lush forests and rivers. En route, enjoy lunch at a quality local restaurant. On arrival, check in at your hotel. Surrounded by forests, rivers, and lakes, Pokhara offers a tropical ambiance, rich cultural history, and breathtaking views of Machhapuchhre and the Annapurna range. Overnight stay in Pokhara.

Itinerary.Name: Exploring the Charms of Pokhara
Description: After breakfast, begin your day with a visit to Pokharaâ€™s traditional bazaar, once a bustling trading hub for decorated pony caravans from the Kali Gandaki region. Explore the vibrant market atmosphere where mountain traders still barter their goods. Visit the sacred Bindhyabasini Temple, a revered site for locals, followed by the Butterfly Museum, showcasing Nepalâ€™s rich biodiversity. In the late afternoon, enjoy a tranquil boat ride on Phewa Lake, passing the royal familyâ€™s winter residence. Stop at the island-based Varahi Temple, a golden shrine nestled in greenery. Enjoy lunch at a lakeside restaurant. Overnight stay in Pokhara.

Itinerary.Name: Drive to Lumbini â€“ The Birthplace of Lord Buddha
Description: After breakfast, depart Pokhara for a scenic 5â€“6 hour drive to Lumbini, the sacred birthplace of Lord Buddha. Located in the Kapilvastu district of Nepalâ€™s western Terai region, Lumbini is a deeply spiritual destination and a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The journey covers approximately 250 kilometers, offering views of lush lowlands, terraced farms, and traditional villages. This spiritual stop makes the Nepal holiday package even more fulfilling. Upon arrival, check in to your hotel and spend the rest of the day at leisure. Overnight stay at hotel in Lumbini.

Itinerary.Name: Discover the Sacred Sites of Lumbini
Description: After breakfast, explore the sacred grounds of Lumbini, the birthplace of Lord Buddha and a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Begin with a visit to the Maya Devi Temple, which marks the exact spot where Queen Maya Devi gave birth to Siddhartha Gautama. Nearby, see the sacred pond and the historic Ashoka Pillar, built by Emperor Ashoka in 250 B.C. to honor the site. Stroll through peaceful monastic zones representing Buddhist traditions from around the world. Enjoy lunch during the excursion. Return to your hotel for dinner and relaxation. Overnight stay at the hotel in Lumbini.

Itinerary.Name: Fly Back to Kathmandu from Lumbini
Description: After breakfast at the hotel, you will be transferred to the airport for your flight back to Kathmandu. Enjoy a short and scenic aerial journey over Nepalâ€™s beautiful landscape. Upon arrival in Kathmandu, our representative will receive you and assist with the transfer to your hotel. The remainder of the day is at leisureâ€”explore nearby markets, relax at your hotel, or take an optional city stroll. This final leg rounds off your comprehensive Nepal trip package.

Itinerary.Name: Departure from Kathmandu â€“ Farewell Nepal
Description: Enjoy your final breakfast at the hotel. The rest of the day is free until your scheduled transfer to Tribhuvan International Airport for your onward journey. Take this time to reflect on your incredible journey through Nepalâ€™s rich culture, spirituality, and natural beauty. We wish you a safe and pleasant journey.

Itinerary.Name: Heritage Exploration of Kathmandu & Patan
Description: Begin your day with a delicious breakfast at the hotel before diving into Kathmanduâ€™s rich cultural heritage. The morning features a half-day tour of the â€œCity of Glory,â€ visiting Durbar Square, Kasthamandap, Kumari Ghar (home to the Living Goddess), Kal Bhairab, and the sacred Taleju Temple. Later, head to Swoyambhunath Stupa, one of the worldâ€™s oldest Buddhist sites, perched on a hill with panoramic viewsâ€”famously known as the 'Monkey Temple.' In the afternoon, explore Patanâ€™s Durbar Square, Golden Gate, Krishna Temple, Hiranya Varna Mahavihar, and the Thousand Buddha Temple. This immersive experience defines what a cultural tour Nepal truly offers. Overnight stay in Kathmandu.

Itinerary.Name: Bhaktapur Heritage Tour & Scenic Drive to Dhulikhel
Description: After breakfast at the hotel, embark on a half-day sightseeing tour of Bhaktapur, the 'City of Devotees.' Wander through its timeless alleys lined with ancient brick houses and intricately carved wooden windows. Highlights include Durbar Square, the Golden Gate, Palace of 55 Windows, Lionâ€™s Gate, Nyatpola Temple (Nepalâ€™s tallest), Bhairab Temple, Pottery Centre, and Dattatreya Temple. Later, enjoy a scenic drive to Dhulikhelâ€”a charming hillside town offering breathtaking Himalayan views. This leg of the Nepal vacation package lets you witness authentic rural life. En route, soak in the beauty of traditional villages and terraced rice fields. Conclude the day with an overnight stay at a hotel in Dhulikhel.

Itinerary.Name: Spiritual Sights â€“ Pashupatinath & Boudhanath
Description: Begin with breakfast at your hotel, then enjoy a scenic drive back to Kathmandu from Dhulikhel (approx. 32 km) and check in at your hotel. In the afternoon, embark on a half-day tour starting with Pashupatinath, Nepalâ€™s holiest Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, located on the sacred Bagmati River. While non-Hindus cannot enter the inner temple, the view from across the river offers a profound glimpse into spiritual rituals. Next, visit Boudhanath Stupaâ€”one of the largest and most revered Buddhist stupas in the world. Return to your hotel for an overnight stay in Kathmandu.

Itinerary.Name: Welcome to Kathmandu
Description: Upon arrival at Kathmandu Airport, you will be warmly greeted by an Eaze Tours representative with a traditional â€œFlower Garlandâ€ reception. Youâ€™ll then be transferred to your hotel, where you can unwind and settle in. Enjoy the rest of the day at leisure, soaking in the charm of Nepalâ€™s capital city. Your Kathmandu holiday package begins with a comfortable and culturally rich welcome. Overnight stay at the hotel in Kathmandu.

Itinerary.Name: Spiritual & Cultural Wonders of Kathmandu
Description: After breakfast at the hotel, begin your day with a visit to two of Kathmanduâ€™s most revered UNESCO World Heritage Sites. First, explore Pashupatinath Temple, one of the holiest Hindu shrines dedicated to Lord Shiva, where devotees gather for sacred rituals along the Bagmati River. Then visit Boudhanath Stupa, one of the largest and most stunning stupas in the world, known for its massive dome and tranquil ambiance. After lunch (on your own), continue your sightseeing tour of Kathmandu, also known as Kantipur or the 'City of Glory.' Discover historical landmarks such as Kumari Ghar, home to the Living Goddess; Kasthamandap, built from the timber of a single tree; The Big Bell, Kal Bhairab, and more. Conclude the day with a visit to Swayambhunath Stupa, perched atop a hill with sweeping views of the Kathmandu Valleyâ€”a true highlight of any Kathmandu tour package. Overnight at hotel in Kathmandu.

Itinerary.Name: Scenic Drive to Nagarkot â€“ Himalayan Panorama
Description: After breakfast at the hotel, embark on a scenic drive to Nagarkot, a serene hill station located 30 km east of Kathmandu on the valley rim. Recommended by Time Magazine as one of the best retreats, Nagarkot sits at an elevation of 2,175 meters and offers breathtaking panoramic views of the Himalayas. From this vantage point, witness five of the worldâ€™s ten highest peaks, including Mount Everest (8,848 m), Lhotse (8,516 m), Makalu (8,463 m), and Manaslu (8,163 m), among many others. The snow-capped peaks are especially mesmerizing during sunrise and sunset. Add a touch of natural grandeur to your Kathmandu Valley tour package with this unforgettable day. Overnight at hotel/resort in Nagarkot.

Itinerary.Name: Nagarkot to Bhaktapur â€“ Tranquility & Tradition
Description: Start your day with a peaceful morning in Nagarkot, enjoying breakfast and the serene mountain atmosphere. Take a leisurely walk or simply relax amid stunning Himalayan views. In the afternoon, drive to Bhaktapur, the 'City of Devotees,' known for its preserved medieval architecture and vibrant culture. Visit highlights such as Durbar Square, the Golden Gate, Palace of 55 Windows, Nyatapola Temple, and the Lion Gate. Explore charming lanes lined with traditional homes and intricate woodwork. This enriching day offers a historical complement to your Kathmandu holiday package. After immersing yourself in Bhaktapurâ€™s heritage, return to your hotel for an overnight stay.

Itinerary.Name: Farewell Kathmandu â€“ Departure Day
Description: Begin your final day in Nepal with a relaxed breakfast at the hotel. Enjoy some free time in the morningâ€”ideal for picking up souvenirs, capturing last-minute photos, or simply taking in the peaceful ambiance of Kathmandu one last time. Depending on your flight schedule, a representative will transfer you comfortably to the airport for your onward journey. As you depart, carry with you unforgettable memories from this expertly curated Nepal tour package. We hope your journey with Eaze Tours has been enriching and look forward to welcoming you again. End of Services.

Itinerary.Name: Arrive Kathmandu
Description: Upon arrival at Tribhuvan International Airport in Kathmandu, you will be warmly welcomed with traditional flower garlands by an Eaze Tours representative and transferred to your hotel by private vehicle. After settling in and relaxing, your introduction to Nepal begins with a memorable evening featuring a Gala Nepali dinner. Enjoy authentic local cuisine accompanied by traditional Nepali drinks, followed by a vibrant cultural folk dance performance that showcases the countryâ€™s rich heritage and warm hospitality. This festive evening sets the perfect tone for your journey ahead through Nepalâ€™s landscapes, culture, and spirituality. Overnight stay at the hotel in Kathmandu.

Itinerary.Name: Kathmandu Sightseeing Tour
Description: After breakfast, embark on a full-day guided sightseeing tour of Kathmandu, often called Kantipur or the â€œCity of Glory.â€ Visit key landmarks including Kumari Ghar, home to the Living Goddess, Kasthamandap, the Big Bell, and Kal Bhairab. Continue to the iconic Swayambhunath Stupa, a sacred Buddhist site perched on a hill with panoramic views of the Kathmandu Valley. Enjoy lunch at a quality international restaurant. In the afternoon, explore the revered Pashupatinath Temple, one of the holiest Hindu shrines, and the majestic Boudhanath Stupa, the largest in Nepal. Return to your hotel for dinner and overnight stay in Kathmandu.

Itinerary.Name: Fly to Lukla & Trek to Phakding (2,652 m)
Description: After an early breakfast, take a scenic flight from Kathmandu to Lukla (2,827 m), the gateway to the Everest short trek package. Upon arrival, meet your trekking team and begin your trek northward. The trail descends to Chablung (2,700 m) and crosses the Tharo Kosi River via a suspension bridge. From here, enjoy your first glimpse of Kusum Kangru (6,367 m), one of the region's most challenging trekking peaks. The trail gently ascends toward Ghat (2,590 m), passing mani stones and prayer flags, before continuing on to Phakding, where you will spend the night. Total walking time is approximately 3 hours.

Itinerary.Name: Phakding to Namche Bazaar [3420m]
Description: After breakfast in Phakding, begin your scenic trek along the Dudh Kosi River, passing through lush forests and traditional Sherpa villages. Cross several suspension bridges, including the famous Hillary Bridge, and enjoy stunning views of snow-capped peaks. The trail gradually ascends through rhododendron and pine forests, reaching the entrance of Sagarmatha National Park at Monjo, where your permits are checked. After a steep and challenging final climb, youâ€™ll arrive at Namche Bazaar (3,420 m), the vibrant heart of the Khumbu region. This bustling mountain town offers spectacular views and is an essential stop in any Everest trek package. Overnight stay in Namche Bazaar.

Itinerary.Name: Acclimatization day at Namche Bazaar
Description: There is an optional day hike to Kunde and Khumjung villages. For this hike, we start with a steep one-hour climb to the Shyangboche airstrip (3,790 m), from where we will slowly ascend towards Khunde passing numerous chorten (stone Buddhist monuments). From Khunde we follow the trail eastwards to Khumjung, the largest village in Khumbu, at the foot of the sacred peak Khumbila. After enjoying lunch here, we will follow a steep switchback trail descending to Chhorkung (3,540 m). From here, it is a quick descent back to Namche Bazaar (5 hrs). This enriching day helps you fully absorb the culture and terrain before continuing your Everest short trek.

Itinerary.Name: Acclimatization day at Namche Bazaar
Description: There is an optional day hike to Kunde and Khumjung villages. For this hike, we start with a steep one-hour climb to the Shyangboche airstrip (3,790 m), from where we will slowly ascend towards Khunde passing numerous chorten (stone Buddhist monuments). From Khunde we follow the trail eastwards to Khumjung, the largest village in Khumbu, at the foot of the sacred peak Khumbila. After enjoying lunch here, we will follow a steep switchback trail descending to Chhorkung (3,540 m). From here, it is a quick descent back to Namche Bazaar (5 hrs). This enriching day helps you fully absorb the culture and terrain before continuing your Everest short trek.

Itinerary.Name: Fly from Lukla to Kathmandu
Description: After an early breakfast, transfer to Lukla Airport for your scenic flight back to Kathmandu. If the weather is clear, enjoy breathtaking aerial views of the Himalayas, including peaks youâ€™ve trekked beneathâ€”an unforgettable farewell to the mountains. Upon arrival in Kathmandu, you will be transferred to your hotel. The rest of the day is free for rest, souvenir shopping, or optional sightseeing. Itâ€™s also the perfect time to book Everest short trek for your friends and family or extend your trip. Overnight stay at the hotel in Kathmandu.

Itinerary.Name: Departure from Kathmandu â€“ Farewell Nepal
Description: Enjoy a leisurely breakfast at the hotel. Youâ€™ll have free time until your scheduled departure transfer to Tribhuvan International Airport for your onward journey. Take this moment to reflect on your incredible experiencesâ€”from the vibrant culture of Kathmandu to the serene trails of the Himalayas. Thank you for choosing Eaze Tours to book Everest short trek and be part of your Himalayan dreams.

Summary: The Himalayas callâ€”and with Eaze Toursâ€™ Everest Short Trek Package, the dream is just 8 days away. Limited spots availableâ€”Contact Us Now to book your Everest trek or browse our Nepal tours for more inspiring itineraries!

Everest up close. Your journey begins and ends in Lukla, guiding you through charming Sherpa villages, ancient monasteries, and scenic trails surrounded by some of the worldâ€™s most breathtaking snow-capped peaks. TourCompanion.Description: Experienced Sherpa guides, porters, and safety crew with first aid and altitude training

Itinerary.Name: Airport â€“ Negombo (8 Km / 20 min Drive)
Description: Upon arrival at Colombo International Airport, you will be warmly welcomed by our representative. After a brief introduction, you'll be transferred to the coastal town of Negombo, known for its charming beaches and vibrant local culture. Take the rest of the day to relax and unwind after your journey. You can explore the nearby beach, enjoy fresh seafood, or simply rest at the hotel. This peaceful beginning sets the tone for your unforgettable Sri Lanka holiday package. Overnight stay in Negombo at a comfortable hotel, preparing for the exciting journey ahead.

Itinerary.Name: Negombo â€“ Dambulla â€“ Sigiriya (147 Km / 3hrs 30mins Drive)
Description: After breakfast, begin your journey towards Sigiriya with a stop at the famous Dambulla Cave Temple. Recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage Site, this remarkable temple complex is the largest and best-preserved in Sri Lanka. Set within five caves, the site features over 150 Buddha statues, intricate murals spanning 2,100 square meters, and ancient carvings that reflect the life of Lord Buddha. You'll also find statues of Sri Lankan kings and Hindu deities such as Vishnu and Ganesh. After exploring this spiritual masterpiece, continue to Sigiriya. Overnight stay at a hotel in Sigiriya.

Itinerary.Name: Sigiriya â€“ Polonnaruwa â€“ Sigiriya (57 Km / 1 hr Drive)
Description: After breakfast, depart for the ancient city of Polonnaruwa, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a key highlight of Sri Lankaâ€™s cultural triangle. This historic city flourished during the 12th century under King Parakramabahu, showcasing impressive ruins of royal palaces, Buddhist temples, and intricate stone carvings. Later enhanced by King Nissankamalla, Polonnaruwa stands as a testament to the islandâ€™s rich architectural and religious heritage. Enjoy lunch at a family-owned local restaurant overlooking serene paddy fields. Afterward, return to your hotel in Sigiriya for rest and relaxation. Overnight stay in Sigiriya.

Itinerary.Name: Sigiriya â€“ Kandy (90 Km / 2hrs 40mins Drive)
Description: After breakfast, proceed to Kandy, the cultural capital of Sri Lanka. En route, enjoy scenic views of the countryside as you head into the central hills. Upon arrival, visit the sacred Temple of the Tooth Relic (Sri Dalada Maligawa), located within the royal palace complex. This revered Buddhist temple houses the sacred tooth relic of Lord Buddha and holds great historical and spiritual significance. Believed to symbolize sovereignty, the relic played a central role in the countryâ€™s governance. The city of Kandy is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Overnight stay at a hotel in Kandy.

Itinerary.Name: Kandy â€“ Yala (182 Km / 4 hrs 20 mins Drive)
Description: After breakfast, begin your journey from Kandy to Yala, located in the southeastern region of Sri Lanka. Enjoy the changing landscapes as you travel from the lush hills of Kandy to the dry lowlands of Yala. Upon arrival, check in to your hotel and spend the rest of the day at leisure. Relax and unwind in the tranquil surroundings, preparing for the wildlife adventure ahead. Yala is renowned for its national park and diverse wildlife, including leopards and elephants. Overnight stay at a hotel in Yala.

Itinerary.Name: Yala â€“ Half Day Safari Adventure
Description: Begin your day early with a packed breakfast and enter Yala National Park by 6 a.m. for an exhilarating half-day safari. Yala, Sri Lankaâ€™s second-largest and most visited national park, offers diverse landscapesâ€”ranging from forests and grasslands to lagoons and beachesâ€”supporting a rich array of wildlife. The park is home to over 215 bird species, including six endemics, and around 90 species of water birds, many of which are seasonal migrants. Keep your eyes open for elephants, leopards, sloth bears, crocodiles, and more. After an unforgettable wildlife experience, return to the hotel to relax. Overnight stay in Yala.

Itinerary.Name: Yala â€“ Bentota
Description: After breakfast, embark on a scenic drive to Bentota, a charming beachside town on Sri Lankaâ€™s southwest coast. Along the way, stop at the Kosgoda Turtle Hatchery, run by the Wildlife Protection Society. Here, you can see tanks filled with baby turtles and learn about conservation efforts to protect these endangered creatures. Hatchlings are typically released into the sea at night for safety. Later, visit a local cinnamon factory to discover the story of Ceylon cinnamon, native to Sri Lanka. Learn about its historical significance, processing methods, and diverse uses. Dinner and overnight stay at a hotel in Bentota.

Itinerary.Name: Bentota â€“ Madu River Safari
Description: After breakfast, enjoy a serene boat safari on the Madu River, located in Balapitiya along Sri Lankaâ€™s southern coast. This beautiful lagoon, which opens to the Indian Ocean, is a biodiverse wetland ecosystem and was declared a Ramsar site in 2004. As you cruise through the mangrove tunnels, witness the rich aquatic life and spot various bird species, monitor lizards, and other animals that thrive in this unique habitat. The calm waters and natural beauty offer a peaceful and immersive experience in Sri Lankaâ€™s coastal ecology. Return to the hotel. Dinner and overnight stay at a hotel in Bentota.

Itinerary.Name: Bentota â€“ Colombo â€“ Departure
Description: After breakfast, check out from your hotel and drive to Colombo, Sri Lankaâ€™s bustling capital city. In the afternoon, explore Colomboâ€™s cultural highlights. Begin with a visit to the iconic Red Mosque (Jami-Ul-Alfar Mosque), one of the oldest and most distinctive mosques in the city, known for its striking red-and-white patterned architecture. Located in the busy Pettah area, itâ€™s a revered place of worship and a popular tourist attraction.Next, visit the Gangaramaya Temple, a significant Buddhist temple blending traditional and modern architectural styles. Situated near Beira Lake, it offers a rich spiritual and cultural experience. Later, proceed to the airport for your departure.
